original: 'dir gzhung ni spring yig dang lag yig rnams sam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni spring yig dang lag yig rnams sam /
translated: Here, the text refers to letters, notes, and so on,

original: lag rtsis kyis rku na rin thang brtsi bar bya ba la sogs @90a * //🔽pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: lag rtsis kyis rku na rin thang brtsi bar bya ba la sogs @90a * // pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: or to the value of the stolen goods when they are calculated by hand.

original: rnam pa gang yang rung bas rku na yang na smad pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa gang yang rung bas rku na yang na smad pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no offense if one steals in any way whatsoever.

original: rjes su bsgrub pa'i skabs smras nas /
analyzed: rjes su bsgrub pa'i skabs smras nas /
translated: Having discussed the section on subsequent activity,

original: da ni mthar thug pa'i skabs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni mthar thug pa'i skabs brjod par bya ste /
translated: now the section on culmination should be discussed.

original: nan khugs dang dang na 'then yang ma brkus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nan khugs dang dang na 'then yang ma brkus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not the case that there is no stealing if one steals by force or stealth.

original: nan khugs kyis rku ba gang yin pa sbyin par bya ba la gcig pa na yang gang yin pa 'di ni rku ba ma yin zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //🔽'di la yang khyad par brjod pa rnams la chom rkun pas rku ba bzhin du khongs su bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nan khugs kyis rku ba gang yin pa sbyin par bya ba la gcig pa na yang gang yin pa 'di ni rku ba ma yin zhes bya bar shes par bya'o // 'di la yang khyad par brjod pa rnams la chom rkun pas rku ba bzhin du khongs su bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that stealing by force is not stealing if the object is given later.🔽Here, the text refers to the various types of stealing, such as stealing by force, stealing by stealth, and so on.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa rku ba rnam pa du mchis /🔽nye ba la 'khor drug ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa rku ba rnam pa du mchis /🔽nye ba la 'khor drug ste /
translated: Stealing by force is stealing by force, such as by robbers.

original: nan khugs kyis rku ba dang / sgyur thabs kyis rku ba dang / gtams pa rku ba dang / phyir bsab pa rku ba dang / dngan 'then gyis rku ba dang / chos rku ba'o //
analyzed: nan khugs kyis rku ba dang / sgyur thabs kyis rku ba dang / gtams pa rku ba dang / phyir bsab pa rku ba dang / dngan 'then gyis rku ba dang / chos rku ba'o //
translated: 6. stealing through force, 7. stealing through deception, 8. stealing through hoarding, 9. stealing through fraud, 10. stealing through sighing, 11. stealing through Dharma.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gang rku ba drug po 'di rnams gsungs na 'di rnams kyi nang nas du zhig mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gang rku ba drug po 'di rnams gsungs na 'di rnams kyi nang nas du zhig mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: “Reverend Lord, if these six kinds of stealing have been taught, how many of them constitute a serious offense?”

original: nye ba 'khor chos rku ba ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad kyis mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor chos rku ba ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad kyis mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Upāli, all of them except for stealing through Dharma constitute a serious offense.”

original: de la chos rku ba ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de la chos rku ba ni nyes pa med de /
translated: Stealing through Dharma is not a fault.

original: rku sems med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba don go bar zad do //
analyzed: rku sems med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning is understood: because there is no thought of stealing.

original: sgyu thabs kyis rku ba ni rnam pa gnyis te chom rkun gyis len pa dang / dor byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu thabs kyis rku ba ni rnam pa gnyis te chom rkun gyis len pa dang / dor byed pa'o //
translated: Stealing through deception is of two kinds: taking through theft and taking through abandonment.

original: de la chom rkun gyis len pa na rku ba nyid yin pas dogs par bya ba med do //
analyzed: de la chom rkun gyis len pa na rku ba nyid yin pas dogs par bya ba med do //
translated: Taking through theft is not to be suspected, because it is just stealing.

original: dor byed pa la ni sbyor ba dor byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas brkus pa nyid du grags pa'o //
analyzed: dor byed pa la ni sbyor ba dor byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas brkus pa nyid du grags pa'o //
translated: In the case of theft by abandonment, the object is known to have been stolen by such statements as “I abandoned the object.”

original: gtams pa rku ba la ni gtams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtams pa rku ba la ni gtams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the case of theft by concealment, the object is known to have been stolen by such statements as “I concealed the object.”

original: phyir bsab pa rku ba la ni sngar brnyas pa dang bskyis pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir bsab pa rku ba la ni sngar brnyas pa dang bskyis pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the case of theft by restitution, the object is known to have been stolen by such statements as “I previously insulted and deceived him.”

original: nan khugs kyis rku ba la ni dbang gis mnan zhing len pa ste /
analyzed: nan khugs kyis rku ba la ni dbang gis mnan zhing len pa ste /
translated: In the case of theft by force, the object is known to have been stolen by such statements as “I took it by force.”

original: de'i phyir de brkus pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa 'ga' yang yod la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de brkus pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa 'ga' yang yod la /
translated: Therefore, some may doubt that it is not theft.

original: gang zhig dang na 'then gyis rku ba yang de ni mi ster btsam du zad kyis brkus pa ni ma yin no snyam du dogs pa yod pas de bas brkus pa nyid du btags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig dang na 'then gyis rku ba yang de ni mi ster btsam du zad kyis brkus pa ni ma yin no snyam du dogs pa yod pas de bas brkus pa nyid du btags pa ma yin no //
translated: In the case of theft by deception, some may doubt that it is not theft, thinking that “I am merely not giving it back, it is not that I have stolen it.” Therefore, it is not designated as theft.

original: dogs pa de gnyis bsal ba'i phyir mdo 'di bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dogs pa de gnyis bsal ba'i phyir mdo 'di bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this sūtra was taught to dispel those two doubts.

original: gnas dang bcas pa dang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rdzas gang gnas dang lhan cig tu brkus pa de yang ma brkus pa ma yin te @90b brkus pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gnas dang bcas pa dang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rdzas gang gnas dang lhan cig tu brkus pa de yang ma brkus pa ma yin te @90b brkus pa kho na yin no //
translated: “With or without a basis” means that the substance that is stolen together with the basis is not unstolen, but is stolen.

original: rdzas kyi gnas las mi sel ba nyid du gang du gnas la sel bar byed pa de ni 'dir gnas dang bcas pa la rku bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi gnas las mi sel ba nyid du gang du gnas la sel bar byed pa de ni 'dir gnas dang bcas pa la rku bar rig par bya'o //
translated: When one removes a substance from its basis, but does not remove it from the place where it is located, then here one should understand that it is stolen with its basis.

original: 'dir sbyor ba dang bral ba nyid ni de gnyis ni de nyid de gnas dang bcas par yang brkus pa nyid la bdag po la rdzas dang sbyor ba dral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba dang bral ba nyid ni de gnyis ni de nyid de gnas dang bcas par yang brkus pa nyid la bdag po la rdzas dang sbyor ba dral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, the absence of application is that both of those are the same, because the substance is stolen with its basis, and the application of the substance to the owner is severed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis yo byad lci ba gnas nas spo bar byed na mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis yo byad lci ba gnas nas spo bar byed na mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: Here, the treatise says: “If the Blessed One said that one is expelled from the monastery for stealing heavy goods,

original: dge slong gis yo byad lci ba gnas las ma spos par brkus na mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ba mchis sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis yo byad lci ba gnas las ma spos par brkus na mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ba mchis sam /
translated: then is it the case that a monk who steals heavy goods without removing them from their basis incurs a pārājika offense?”

original: yod de gnas gang na 'dug pa de gnas dang bcas te brkus na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod de gnas gang na 'dug pa de gnas dang bcas te brkus na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Yes, if one steals it together with the place where it is located.🔽Killing is not stealing.

original: bsad pa nyid ni brkus pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de bas na 'di tsam gyis brkus pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bsad pa nyid ni brkus pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de bas na 'di tsam gyis brkus pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not stealing merely by that.

original: 'dir gnas na spos pa nyid bsad pa dang lhan cig tu 'gyur ba'am phyis brkus pa zhes bya bar grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gnas na spos pa nyid bsad pa dang lhan cig tu 'gyur ba'am phyis brkus pa zhes bya bar grub pa'o //
translated: Here, the meaning is established that the act of stealing is either together with killing or after killing, if one steals while staying in that place.🔽It is not the case that one does not leave a part of the place.

original: phyogs gcig tu gnas nas ma 'phags pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas gang zhig la gnas nas spo bar gyur pa la rdzas rgyud gcig la phyogs 'ga' zhig gnas dor bar gyur te gzhan cung zad kyang ma grol ba ni mi 'dor ba de
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu gnas nas ma 'phags pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas gang zhig la gnas nas spo bar gyur pa la rdzas rgyud gcig la phyogs 'ga' zhig gnas dor bar gyur te gzhan cung zad kyang ma grol ba ni mi 'dor ba de
translated: If one becomes a thief while staying in a place, if a part of the substance remains in that place and is not released,

original: la 'di byas pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: la 'di byas pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: then it is not stolen.

original: thams cad kyis dor ba la byas pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad kyis dor ba la byas pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is stolen if all of it is released.

original: ltung ba ni de las khyer na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rnams la des ltung bas te /
analyzed: ltung ba ni de las khyer na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rnams la des ltung bas te /
translated: If one takes fruit from there, it is stealing.🔽The fruit is the fall from there, because it is the fall from one's own place.

original: sngon du 'degs pa la rang gi gnas nas phung ba la ltung ba de nyid rku ba'o //
analyzed: sngon du 'degs pa la rang gi gnas nas phung ba la ltung ba de nyid rku ba'o //
translated: The fall itself is the stealing.🔽The fall is the ground or cloth, etc.

original: der 'og tu sa'am gos la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni mchog gi brtsegs ma thob pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ltung ba ni 'dir brkus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: der 'og tu sa'am gos la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni mchog gi brtsegs ma thob pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ltung ba ni 'dir brkus par rig par bya'o //
translated: There, the fall is the stealing.

original: 'dir yul du thob par byed pa'i blo yang dag par gnas te bsdus pa'i blo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yul du thob par byed pa'i blo yang dag par gnas te bsdus pa'i blo ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the mind that obtains the object is the mind that is fully present, not the mind that is collected.

original: ji ltar bsdus te gzhag pa la de bas na 'dir brkus pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bsdus te gzhag pa la de bas na 'dir brkus pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: Because it is collected and placed there, it is known as the stealing here.

original: 'dir mngon par 'dod pas yul gyi rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir mngon par 'dod pas yul gyi rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Here, the object is established by manifest desire.

original: gang du rten pa nyid kyis 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: gang du rten pa nyid kyis 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa'am /
translated: Where there is no going by mere support,

original: 'gro bar bya ba mngon par 'dod pa de 'dir yul lo //
analyzed: 'gro bar bya ba mngon par 'dod pa de 'dir yul lo //
translated: or where there is manifest desire to go, that is the object here.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis shing thog rnams sprugs te ltung bar byas nas brkus na ltung ba cir 'gyur /🔽gal te sbyor ba gcig @91a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis shing thog rnams sprugs te ltung bar byas nas brkus na ltung ba cir 'gyur / gal te sbyor ba gcig @91a * //
translated: If a monk, having shaken the fruit from a tree, steals it by causing it to fall, what is the offense?

original: gis ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa tshang na mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gis ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa tshang na mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he steals five māsakas or more with a single action, he commits a heinous offense.

original: ci ste ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he does not steal five māsakas or more, he commits a serious offense.

original: 'dzag pa dang 'brul bar byed pa'i bu gu las ni byung na'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dzag pa dang 'brul bar byed pa'i bu gu las ni byung na'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the fruit falls from a hole or a crack,

original: 'dzag par byed pa'i bu gu zhes bya ba ni dper na chu krung la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dzag par byed pa'i bu gu zhes bya ba ni dper na chu krung la sogs pa'o ;
translated: A hole is, for example, a crevice in a riverbank.🔽If the fruit falls from a hole or a crack, the offense is the same as if it were stolen by hand or foot.

original: / lag pas byas pa dang rkang pas byas pa ni dper na gzhi'i chos can rdzogs pa'i bang mdzod la sogs pa la bu ga ni de bsal ba ma yin pa la nges par byung na'o //
analyzed: / lag pas byas pa dang rkang pas byas pa ni dper na gzhi'i chos can rdzogs pa'i bang mdzod la sogs pa la bu ga ni de bsal ba ma yin pa la nges par byung na'o //
translated: For example, if a hole is made in a completed granary or treasury, and the fruit falls out, then the offense is the same as if it were stolen by hand or foot.

original: de bas na chu klung dang bang mdzod la sogs pa la rku ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na chu klung dang bang mdzod la sogs pa la rku ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the offense for stealing from a river, treasury, and so on is the same as if it were stolen by hand or foot.

original: 'dir tha ma de tshun chad rdzas gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir tha ma de tshun chad rdzas gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, up to the last, they are the same substance.

original: 'di la ni byung ba tha ma las ji srid du bu ga la rdzas thams cad gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di la ni byung ba tha ma las ji srid du bu ga la rdzas thams cad gcig pa nyid de /
translated: Here, from the last arising, as long as there is a hole, all substances are the same.

original: de thams cad kyi rin thang gis ltung ba la rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de thams cad kyi rin thang gis ltung ba la rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the value of all of them is determined by the value of the last.

original: gang la lo thog bskyed pa la sogs pa'i dgos pa la rtse gcig pa nyid ma brten par chu rku ba la sogs pa de'i don du chu 'di brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la lo thog bskyed pa la sogs pa'i dgos pa la rtse gcig pa nyid ma brten par chu rku ba la sogs pa de'i don du chu 'di brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this water is spoken of for the purpose of stealing water, etc., without relying on the single-pointed purpose of producing crops, etc.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bcun pa dge slong gis 'bab chu bcad nas rku na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bcun pa dge slong gis 'bab chu bcad nas rku na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here, the text is: If a virtuous monk cuts off a stream and steals, what downfall does he incur?

original: chu'i phung po dang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: chu'i phung po dang po nas bzung ste /
translated: Beginning from the first mass of water,

original: ji srid tha ma'i bar gyi chu'i rin thang brtsi bar bya ste /
analyzed: ji srid tha ma'i bar gyi chu'i rin thang brtsi bar bya ste /
translated: up to the last, the value of the water should be calculated.

original: dngos po tshang na ni mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po tshang na ni mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the substance is complete, there is a final downfall.

original: dngos po ma tshang na ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po ma tshang na ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If the substance is incomplete, there is a serious offense.

original: btsun pa dge slong gis bang pa brtol te /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis bang pa brtol te /
translated: The monk, the Venerable, split open the egg.

original: 'bru rku na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bru rku na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: If a monk cuts open a granary and steals grain, what is his offense?

original: sbyor ba gcig gis rku ba nyid tshun chad kyi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gis rku ba nyid tshun chad kyi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The value of the grain should be calculated up to the point of the theft, which is the single point of preparation.

original: 'dir 'bugs pa nyid sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'bugs pa nyid sbyor ba ste /
translated: Here, the cutting open is the single point of preparation.

original: gzhan med pa'i phyir des bug pa byas la ji srid rang nyid 'byung ba de srid der sbyor ba gcig byas pa brjod par rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan med pa'i phyir des bug pa byas la ji srid rang nyid 'byung ba de srid der sbyor ba gcig byas pa brjod par rnam par gnas so //
translated: Since there is no other, the monk is said to have committed a single point of preparation, as long as he has not himself emerged from the granary.🔽If he steals from a heap, then each time he takes a portion, he commits a separate offense.

original: phung po las rku na ni len re re zhing blangs pa tha dad do zhes bya ba ni blangs pa re re phung po la rku na tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: phung po las rku na ni len re re zhing blangs pa tha dad do zhes bya ba ni blangs pa re re phung po la rku na tha dad pa'o //
translated: If he steals from a collection, then each time he takes a portion, he commits a separate offense.

original: bsdus pa las sel ba 'di 'dir bsdus pa las la yang dag par gnas pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsdus pa las sel ba 'di 'dir bsdus pa las la yang dag par gnas pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not a case of a collection that is a real entity.

original: bcus pa bzhin du ni 'dir rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bcus pa bzhin du ni 'dir rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not like the case of a pile.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis 'bru'i phung po las bcad de 'bru rkun ltung bcir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis 'bru'i phung po las bcad de 'bru rkun ltung bcir 'gyur /
translated: The text says, “If a monk cuts open a granary and steals grain, what is his offense?”

original: rin thang brtsi bar bya ste /
analyzed: rin thang brtsi bar bya ste /
translated: The value should be calculated.

original: gal te sbyor ba gcig gis dngos po tshang na ni mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sbyor ba gcig gis dngos po tshang na ni mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object is complete in one application, then it is a downfall.

original: gal te ma tshang @91b na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te ma tshang @91b na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If it is incomplete, then it is a serious violation.

original: dbral bar bya ba du ma nyid yin na de'i cha so so'i zhes bya ba ni brkus pa tha dad do zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbral bar bya ba du ma nyid yin na de'i cha so so'i zhes bya ba ni brkus pa tha dad do zhes sbyar ro //
translated: If the object to be stolen is multiple, then each part is a separate object of theft.

original: de rnams ni sbyar ba dang rnam par dbral bar bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams ni sbyar ba dang rnam par dbral bar bya ste /
translated: They are applied and separated.

original: gang rnams kyi rdzas rku ba de rnams du ma nyid la re re'i cha gang yin pa re re'o //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi rdzas rku ba de rnams du ma nyid la re re'i cha gang yin pa re re'o //
translated: The objects of theft are multiple, and each part is separate.

original: de'i don du rku ba tha dad pa'o //🔽brku bar bya ba'i rdzas kyi bdag po gcig la de'i cha gang yin pa de'i rin thang gang gis ltung ba gcig go //🔽gnyis pa la gang zhig de'i rin thang gis gzhan no //
analyzed: de'i don du rku ba tha dad pa'o // brku bar bya ba'i rdzas kyi bdag po gcig la de'i cha gang yin pa de'i rin thang gang gis ltung ba gcig go // gnyis pa la gang zhig de'i rin thang gis gzhan no //
translated: The theft for that purpose is separate.🔽If the owner of the object to be stolen is one, then each part is a separate object of theft.

original: gsum pa la gang zhig de'i rin thang gis gzhan no //
analyzed: gsum pa la gang zhig de'i rin thang gis gzhan no //
translated: If the value of each part is the value of another, then it is a separate object of theft.🔽If the value of each part is the value of another, then it is a separate object of theft.

original: de ltar na de bzhin du bzhi pa la sogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin du bzhi pa la sogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, it is the same for the fourth and so on.

original: sbyar ba dang dbral bar bya ba so so la 'di la rin thang tshang ba ni gang gi ngo bo gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba 'di 'di'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: sbyar ba dang dbral bar bya ba so so la 'di la rin thang tshang ba ni gang gi ngo bo gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba 'di 'di'i shes pa'o //
translated: The value of the object is determined by the individual who is to be robbed and the individual who is to be released.

original: rkun po rnams kyang ngo zhes bya ba la yang du ma nyid yin na so so'i skal ba'i chas rkus pa tha dad do zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: rkun po rnams kyang ngo zhes bya ba la yang du ma nyid yin na so so'i skal ba'i chas rkus pa tha dad do zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The thieves are also many, and the individual shares of the stolen goods are different.

original: der rku ba po gcig la cha ji tsam pa de tsam gyi rin thang gis de la ltung ba'o //
analyzed: der rku ba po gcig la cha ji tsam pa de tsam gyi rin thang gis de la ltung ba'o //
translated: If one thief steals the entire amount, then the downfall is commensurate with the value of the entire amount.

original: gnyis pa la ji tsam pa de tsam pa de la ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ji tsam pa de tsam pa de la ltung ba'o //
translated: If two steal it, then the downfall is commensurate with the value of half the amount.

original: de bzhin du gsum pa la sogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum pa la sogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The same applies to three or more thieves.

original: sbyar bar bya ba dang 'bral ba nyid la du ma yin na rku ba po rnams la yang du ma nyid la bsgrub pa gcig go /
analyzed: sbyar bar bya ba dang 'bral ba nyid la du ma yin na rku ba po rnams la yang du ma nyid la bsgrub pa gcig go /
translated: If the object to be stolen is many, then the thieves are also many, and the accomplishment is one.

original: sbyar bar bya ba dang dbral ba gcig la cha ji tsam pa de'i rin thang gis de la ltung ba gcig go //
analyzed: sbyar bar bya ba dang dbral ba gcig la cha ji tsam pa de'i rin thang gis de la ltung ba gcig go //
translated: One offense is incurred for the value of the entire amount of goods that are to be stolen, regardless of the portion that is actually stolen.

original: sbyar bar bya ba dang dbral bar bya ba'i gnyis pa'i cha gang yin pa de'i rin thang gnyis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyar bar bya ba dang dbral bar bya ba'i gnyis pa'i cha gang yin pa de'i rin thang gnyis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the second offense is incurred for the value of the second portion of goods that are to be stolen.🔽The text of this sutra states:

original: mdo 'di dag gi gzhung ni ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa brkus na ltung ba mthar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: mdo 'di dag gi gzhung ni ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa brkus na ltung ba mthar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “If a bhikṣu steals five māsakas or more, he incurs a downfall.”

original: dge slong shin tu mang po dag gis brkus na mthar mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /🔽yod de / skye bo mang po la brkus na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong shin tu mang po dag gis brkus na mthar mi 'gyur ba mchis sam / yod de / skye bo mang po la brkus na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Many bhikṣus asked, “Is it possible to steal more than five māsakas and not incur a downfall?”🔽The Bhagavān said, “If many people steal, it is a serious violation.”

original: de bzhin du skye bo ba mang po rnams dang lhan cig tu rku na yang nyes ba sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye bo ba mang po rnams dang lhan cig tu rku na yang nyes ba sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, if many people steal together, it is a serious violation.

original: 'dir skye bo mang po zhes bya ba'i tshad ni gcig gi chas dngos po tshang bar mi 'gyur ba de snyed du skye bo mang po de la dgongs nas nyes pa sbom po'i tshig 'di rnam par gnas pa yin no //🔽'di la blo gros du ma nyid yin na thob na brkus pa @92a * //🔽yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di la rkun po rnams du ma yin na rdzas gang la ma skyes pa la blo gros gcig pa ni btus nas byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir skye bo mang po zhes bya ba'i tshad ni gcig gi chas dngos po tshang bar mi 'gyur ba de snyed du skye bo mang po de la dgongs nas nyes pa sbom po'i tshig 'di rnam par gnas pa yin no // 'di la blo gros du ma nyid yin na thob na brkus pa @92a * // yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di la rkun po rnams du ma yin na rdzas gang la ma skyes pa la blo gros gcig pa ni btus nas byed pa nyid do //
translated: With regard to that, the term “grave offense” is established.🔽Here, if there are many thieves, then the thing is stolen when it is taken by one who has the same intention as the others.🔽If there are many thieves, then the thing is stolen when it is taken by one who has the same intention as the others with regard to the object.

original: blo gros tha dad pa 'byung zhing rkun po mang po rnams rnam par bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: blo gros tha dad pa 'byung zhing rkun po mang po rnams rnam par bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: If there are many thieves, then the thing is stolen when it is taken by one who has a different intention from the others, but the many thieves are acting together.

original: der rdzas de la thob pa ni brkus pa ste sbos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: der rdzas de la thob pa ni brkus pa ste sbos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In that case, the thing is stolen when it is taken, not when it is concealed.

original: gang gi tshe 'brel ba dang bcas pa nyid kyis thob pa'i snga rol du bdag gir byed pa la 'dir mi skyed pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'brel ba dang bcas pa nyid kyis thob pa'i snga rol du bdag gir byed pa la 'dir mi skyed pa nyid do //
translated: When it is taken, it is appropriated by one who is connected to the others, but it is not produced by one who is not connected to the others.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa mun khrod du chos gos gzhag pa la dge slong bzhis rku na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa mun khrod du chos gos gzhag pa la dge slong bzhis rku na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: If a monk places his Dharma robe in the dark and four monks steal it, what is the offense?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: nyes pa sbom por ro //🔽lan 'ga' mthar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por ro // lan 'ga' mthar 'gyur te /
translated: It is a serious offense.🔽If it is divided into four parts,

original: gang gi tshe cha bzhir byas pa de'i cha re res kyang dngos po tshang na mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe cha bzhir byas pa de'i cha re res kyang dngos po tshang na mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then for each part, if the object is complete, it is a serious offense.

original: ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If it is incomplete, it is a serious offense.

original: de ltar dngos po dang bdag po dang rjes su bsgrub pa dang / mthar thug pa'i skabs de rnams kyis ma byin par len pa'i skabs dag gi cho ga rnam par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po dang bdag po dang rjes su bsgrub pa dang / mthar thug pa'i skabs de rnams kyis ma byin par len pa'i skabs dag gi cho ga rnam par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the procedure of taking what is not given should be understood through these sections on the object, the owner, the subsequent establishment, and the finality.

original: pham par 'gyur ba gnyis pa'i zhu ba'i skabs so /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba gnyis pa'i zhu ba'i skabs so /
translated: This is the chapter on the second defeating offense.🔽If one dies before taking it, it is simply left there.

original: // / blang ba'i snga rol du shi ba nyid du gyur na gzhag pa nyid do zhes bya ba blong bar byed pa de'i blang ba ste bzung ba'o //
analyzed: // / blang ba'i snga rol du shi ba nyid du gyur na gzhag pa nyid do zhes bya ba blong bar byed pa de'i blang ba ste bzung ba'o //
translated: The taking is the taking of that which is to be taken.

original: rnam par 'byed pa'i dus la sngar cha bzung bas gal te rab tu byung ba shi ba nyid du gyur na gang las cha ste blangs pa de nyid la 'di'i gzhag pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa'i dus la sngar cha bzung bas gal te rab tu byung ba shi ba nyid du gyur na gang las cha ste blangs pa de nyid la 'di'i gzhag pa nyid de /
translated: If the ordained person dies, then the portion should be placed in the very place where it was taken from,

original: de shi ba'i yo byad nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de shi ba'i yo byad nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: because it is not the property of the dead.🔽If the opposite occurs, it is the property of the dead.

original: bzlog pa na shi ba'i yo byad nyid do zhes bya ba ni ci ste shi ba las snga rol du rdzas blangs par gyur na de'i tshe shi ba dang 'brel pa nyid do //
analyzed: bzlog pa na shi ba'i yo byad nyid do zhes bya ba ni ci ste shi ba las snga rol du rdzas blangs par gyur na de'i tshe shi ba dang 'brel pa nyid do //
translated: If the substance is taken before death, then it is related to the dead person.

original: gang las gzung ba de la der so sor sbyin par bya ba nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang las gzung ba de la der so sor sbyin par bya ba nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not to be given to the one who took it from the place where it was,

original: shi ba'i yo byad nyid kho na 'di la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shi ba'i yo byad nyid kho na 'di la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is the property of the dead.

original: dge 'dun ni pho nu dang 'dra bas de'i ched du rku ba ni bdag gir mi byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge 'dun ni pho nu dang 'dra bas de'i ched du rku ba ni bdag gir mi byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Saṅgha is like a male and female, so stealing for the sake of the Saṅgha is not not making it one’s own.

original: dper na pho nu rnams nor gcig pa rnams la so sor thams cad du nor ma bgos pas bdag gir bya ba'i blo 'byung ba de bzhin du dge slong rnams kyang dge 'dun gyi'o //
analyzed: dper na pho nu rnams nor gcig pa rnams la so sor thams cad du nor ma bgos pas bdag gir bya ba'i blo 'byung ba de bzhin du dge slong rnams kyang dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: In the same way, monks do not divide up the Saṅgha’s property individually.

original: de bas na dge 'dun gyi don du rku ba gang yin pa 'di ni bdag gis bya ba min pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dge 'dun gyi don du rku ba gang yin pa 'di ni bdag gis bya ba min pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that stealing for the sake of the Saṅgha is not something that should be done.

original: pham pa nyid gcig gis dge 'dun gyi ched du ma sha ka lnga tsam gyi dngos po brkus pa la so sor dge slong rnams kyi skal ba tshad ma yin pas sbom po'i ltung @92b ba med ces bya ba 'di rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: pham pa nyid gcig gis dge 'dun gyi ched du ma sha ka lnga tsam gyi dngos po brkus pa la so sor dge slong rnams kyi skal ba tshad ma yin pas sbom po'i ltung @92b ba med ces bya ba 'di rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: It is well known that a monk who steals just five māsakas for the sake of the Saṅgha does not commit a serious offense, because the Saṅgha’s share is not fixed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gnyug mar gnas pa dge 'dun gyi zhing rmed du 'jug pa des nyen kor na khyim bdag gi zhing 'dug pa yang rmed du bcug pa dang khyim bdag 'ongs te smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gnyug mar gnas pa dge 'dun gyi zhing rmed du 'jug pa des nyen kor na khyim bdag gi zhing 'dug pa yang rmed du bcug pa dang khyim bdag 'ongs te smras pa /
translated: Here is the story. A resident monk who was plowing the Saṅgha’s field also plowed a householder’s field nearby. The householder came and said,🔽“Venerable, why are you plowing my field?”

original: btsun pa ci'i phyir bdag gi zhing rmed du bcug / smras pa /
analyzed: btsun pa ci'i phyir bdag gi zhing rmed du bcug / smras pa /
translated: “Noble one, why did you have my field plowed?”🔽

original: 'di khyod kyi ma yin gyi dge 'dun gyi zhing yin no ;
analyzed: 'di khyod kyi ma yin gyi dge 'dun gyi zhing yin no ;
translated: This is not yours, it is the Saṅgha’s field.

original: / smras pa /
analyzed: / smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: btsun pa kho bos mi ma yin pa'i tshe bzhi bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: btsun pa kho bos mi ma yin pa'i tshe bzhi bstan par bya'o //
translated: “Venerable Sir, I will show you the four times of non-humans.”

original: khyim bdag de rnams la yul chos rnying pas mtshams su phur pa btab pa de bskos nas bstan pa dang / dge slong gis brkus pa dang phrogs pa na des khyim bdag de song pa dang phur pa de nang du bsnur nas zhing der rmos pa dang khyim bdag yang 'ongs te smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag de rnams la yul chos rnying pas mtshams su phur pa btab pa de bskos nas bstan pa dang / dge slong gis brkus pa dang phrogs pa na des khyim bdag de song pa dang phur pa de nang du bsnur nas zhing der rmos pa dang khyim bdag yang 'ongs te smras pa /
translated: The householder had a stake driven into the boundary of his field according to the old local custom. The monk stole the field and the householder went there. The monk pulled out the stake and plowed the field. The householder returned and said,🔽“Venerable Sir, you have defeated the crow and are still plowing?

original: btsun pa khyod ni khar tshang pham par byas te da dung yang ci'i phyir rmed par byed de 'gyod pa skyes nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: btsun pa khyod ni khar tshang pham par byas te da dung yang ci'i phyir rmed par byed de 'gyod pa skyes nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” He felt regret and the Bhagavān said,

analyzed: gal te dngos po tshang na pham pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “If the conditions are complete, there is a downfall of a defeating offense.”

original: 'dir gal te dngos po tshang na zhes bya ba'i tshig gis 'di la der skal ba gang yin pa de las ltung ba 'dir bskyed par mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba shes par bya ba yang ma yin te /

translated: Here, the phrase “if the requisite is complete” does not indicate that the requisite is that which is to be generated here, since it is asserted that a portion of that is to be generated here.

analyzed: ma sha ka lda nyid kyi phyir sbyin par gyur pa'i zhing la mi rigs pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //

translated: And it is not proper for the monks to be recipients of the complete requisite, because the complete requisite is not complete. It is not proper for the monks to be recipients of the complete requisite, because the procedure of the actual basis is not differentiated. It is not proper for the monks to be recipients of the complete requisite, because it is not proper for them to be recipients through the division of the requisite.

analyzed: bdag po tha dad pa ma yin pa ni rang gi dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni gang dang 'brel ba'i rdzas de nyid la rku ba gang yin pa dper na dge 'dun gyi yo byad la gnas nas dge 'dun gyi don nyid du spo bar byed cing ji
translated: The substance that is related to it is the same substance that is stolen. For example, if one moves the property of the Saṅgha from one place to another for the benefit of the Saṅgha,

analyzed: blang ba'i snga rol du zhes bya ba 'di las rtogs par bya'o //

analyzed: bgo skal gyi cha ni bdag gir bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo rkun po rnams dang 'grogs pa'i don du song ba la skal ba len par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni mi blang ba'i bsams pa ma yin no //
translated: The thought of not taking is not the thought of taking a share, thinking, “I will take a share of the property,” in the sense of associating with thieves.

original: 'dir bsnyen pa la skal ba dang ldan pa nyid ni 'di'o //
analyzed: 'dir bsnyen pa la skal ba dang ldan pa nyid ni 'di'o //

original: de bas na 'di la blang ba'i bsam pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la blang ba'i bsam pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is only the thought of taking in this case.🔽The thought of taking a share is this: “I will take a share of the property,” thinking, “I will take a share of the property that these thieves have stolen.”

analyzed: der gtogs pa'i las rjes su sgrub pa ni de'i ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rkun po'i bya ba der gtogs pa'i lam bsrungs pa la sogs pa dag rjes su sgrub pa ni rku ba de'i rjes su sgrub pa @93b ma yin pa ma
translated: The action of a thief belonging to that is not the subsequent performance of that stealing, because the subsequent performance of guarding the path, etc. is not the subsequent performance of that stealing.

original: yin no // skal ba nyid kyi phyir yang 'di la ltung ba grub pa'o //
analyzed: yin no // skal ba nyid kyi phyir yang 'di la ltung ba grub pa'o //
translated: The fault is established here because of the very possibility.

original: bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo yang bsal bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di'i tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo yang bsal bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di'i tshig go //
translated: The nature of the action is also excluded. This is the meaning of the phrase.🔽The state of being a companion or a servant is also not a cause of not being a thief.

original: lhan cig gnas pa nyid dang nye gnas nyid kyang brkus par mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'di dag gis rang nyid ma yin pa gzhan dag gis blangs pa dag dang lhan cig gnas pa nyid dang nye gnas nyid dag rang
analyzed: lhan cig gnas pa nyid dang nye gnas nyid kyang brkus par mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'di dag gis rang nyid ma yin pa gzhan dag gis blangs pa dag dang lhan cig gnas pa nyid dang nye gnas nyid dag rang
translated: By these aspects, the state of being a companion or a servant of others who are not themselves is not a cause of not being a thief.

original: gis brkus pa yang brkus pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gis brkus pa yang brkus pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The state of being a thief is also not a cause of not being a thief.

original: 'dir brkus pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir brkus pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, one is only a thief.

original: blangs pa nyid ni 'di dag gis dbang du byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: blangs pa nyid ni 'di dag gis dbang du byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are “taken” because they are brought under one’s control.

original: yongs su bskor ba la mtshams nyid gtso bo'o //
analyzed: yongs su bskor ba la mtshams nyid gtso bo'o //
translated: The boundary is primary in the case of “encircling.”

original: mtshams gnas pa spos pa yang 'dis ma bsdus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mtshams dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams gnas pa spos pa yang 'dis ma bsdus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mtshams dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: And the boundary is not excluded from the case of “moving the boundary.”

original: 'dir yongs su bskor ba zhes smos pa mtshams gtso bor rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yongs su bskor ba zhes smos pa mtshams gtso bor rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the boundary should be understood as primary in the case of “encircling.”

original: yongs su bskor ba nyid la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su bskor ba nyid la ni mi bya'o //
translated: But it should not be understood as primary in the case of “encircling” itself.

original: de bas na mi mthun pa dang lhan cig gnas pas phur pas brko ba la sogs pa gang yin pa mtshams de'i spos pa yang 'dis ma bsdus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mi mthun pa dang lhan cig gnas pas phur pas brko ba la sogs pa gang yin pa mtshams de'i spos pa yang 'dis ma bsdus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the moving of that boundary is not excluded by this, which is to say, by “digging with a pick-ax” and so on, which is to say, by living together with a non-relative.

original: 'di yang 'dir rku ba nyid kyis brjod pa rtogs par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di yang 'dir rku ba nyid kyis brjod pa rtogs par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And here, it should be understood that the term “stealing” is used figuratively.

original: mngon sum du blangs pa yang mi snang ba nyid na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba la dbang po dang nye ba ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: mngon sum du blangs pa yang mi snang ba nyid na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba la dbang po dang nye ba ni mngon sum mo //
translated: And even when the object is not visible, it is still stealing. Direct perception is that which is near the sense faculty.

original: de'i dngos po 'bul ba blangs pa ni mngon sum gyis blangs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po 'bul ba blangs pa ni mngon sum gyis blangs pa'o //
translated: The taking of the thing is the taking by direct perception.

original: der yang mi snang ba nyid na brkus pa yin gyi phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang nang byang gnyis mi snang bar gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
analyzed: der yang mi snang ba nyid na brkus pa yin gyi phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang nang byang gnyis mi snang bar gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
translated: And if it is not seen there, it is stolen. It is not only that the two, the following and the inner, are not seen.

original: de bas na bdag po gzung bar byed pa la yang ji srid du mthong ba'i bar la brkus par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na bdag po gzung bar byed pa la yang ji srid du mthong ba'i bar la brkus par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, even in the case of taking possession, as long as it is seen, it is not stolen.

original: de ltar yang rdzas 'di dang rnam par bral bar mi 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyor ba dang bral ba nyid ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: de ltar yang rdzas 'di dang rnam par bral bar mi 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyor ba dang bral ba nyid ni nyes byas so //
translated: And thus, the disconnection from the substance is not severed, and the disconnection itself is a minor offense.

original: de bas na nan gyis rku ba yang cho ga 'di yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na nan gyis rku ba yang cho ga 'di yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even in the case of forceful theft, this procedure should be understood to exist.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis be'u ras 'tshong ba thag med par gyur pa las be'u ras brkus te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis be'u ras 'tshong ba thag med par gyur pa las be'u ras brkus te /
translated: Here, the text says: A monk stole a piece of cloth from a place where cloth was sold, but there was no one there.

original: des de khyer te 'gro ba na be'u ras 'tshong ba des mthong nas des dge slong de la smras pa /
analyzed: des de khyer te 'gro ba na be'u ras 'tshong ba des mthong nas des dge slong de la smras pa /
translated: As he was carrying it away, the cloth seller saw him and said to the monk:

original: be'u ras ma 'phrog cig / dge slong gis smras pa /
analyzed: be'u ras ma 'phrog cig / dge slong gis smras pa /
translated: The monk said,

original: bstan la khyer te 'ong bar bya'o //
analyzed: bstan la khyer te 'ong bar bya'o //
translated: “I will take it to the teacher.”

original: des 'gyod pa skyes nas /
analyzed: des 'gyod pa skyes nas /
translated: He felt regret

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽pham @94a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / pham @94a * //
translated: and the Blessed One said,

original: pa'i ltung bar ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa'i ltung bar ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: “It is not a defeating offense.

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽'dir mi snang ba nyid las gzhan du ltung ba'i tshig la rgyu mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no // 'dir mi snang ba nyid las gzhan du ltung ba'i tshig la rgyu mthong ba yin te /
translated: It is a serious transgression.”🔽Here, the word “serious transgression” is used for a defeating offense, but it is not a defeating offense.

original: sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir 'dir nyes pa sbom por brjod pa zhes bya ba 'dir ni shes pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir 'dir nyes pa sbom por brjod pa zhes bya ba 'dir ni shes pa yin no //
translated: It is a serious transgression because it is a preparation for a defeating offense.

original: mi mthus rku ba ni dbang du byas pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba ni nan gyis len pa la mi la bag phebs shing dbang du byas pa nyid na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthus rku ba ni dbang du byas pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba ni nan gyis len pa la mi la bag phebs shing dbang du byas pa nyid na brkus pa yin no //
translated: “Stealing through force” means when one takes by force after overpowering the other.

original: 'dir mi zhes smos pa'i sgra 'di ni rigs la bsnyags pa des na skyes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de bud med la sogs pa la yang yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir mi zhes smos pa'i sgra 'di ni rigs la bsnyags pa des na skyes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de bud med la sogs pa la yang yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the word “person” is used in the sense of a class of beings. Therefore, it should be understood that this is not only for men, but also for women and so on.

original: gzhan dang lhan cig tu gtsug lag khang la sogs pa las rku ba nas dbang du byas pa las grol ba gang yin pa de'i don du yang 'di de ltar blang bar byas pa la grol ba na rku ba skye spa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dang lhan cig tu gtsug lag khang la sogs pa las rku ba nas dbang du byas pa las grol ba gang yin pa de'i don du yang 'di de ltar blang bar byas pa la grol ba na rku ba skye spa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that stealing arises when one is liberated.

original: de bdag nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /🔽gzhan rnams kyis bdag nyid dbang du bya ba la ;
analyzed: de bdag nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni / gzhan rnams kyis bdag nyid dbang du bya ba la ;
translated: It is not the case that it is by one's own nature.

original: skabs grol ba gang yin pa 'di ni rku ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skabs grol ba gang yin pa 'di ni rku ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not stealing when one is liberated from the control of others.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bdag nyid la brkus pa med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽gang bsams pa de dang 'brel bas ma bsams pa blangs pa brkus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bdag nyid la brkus pa med do zhes gsungs pa yin no // gang bsams pa de dang 'brel bas ma bsams pa blangs pa brkus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
translated: Here the text says that there is no stealing by oneself.🔽That which is connected with what is intended is not stealing what is not intended, and so on.

original: 'di ltar ma bsams pa ni rku ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma bsams pa ni rku ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that what is not intended is not stealing.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis ras sbyar ma ma byin par blangs nas de brkus te bar phye ba dang de'i bar nas dang rin thang chen po byung nas de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis ras sbyar ma ma byin par blangs nas de brkus te bar phye ba dang de'i bar nas dang rin thang chen po byung nas de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and the Blessed One said,

original: ras sbyar ma'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ras sbyar ma'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The value of the robe should be assessed.

original: 'dir dar rin thang chen po ni rku bar bsams pa ma yin pas de bas na ltung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir dar rin thang chen po ni rku bar bsams pa ma yin pas de bas na ltung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Here, since the valuable silk was not intended to be stolen, therefore there is no offense.

original: sbom po ni gang gi gang len pa de de'i rnam par gzhag pa la gzhan gyir rku ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbom po ni gang gi gang len pa de de'i rnam par gzhag pa la gzhan gyir rku ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Gross means that whatever is taken of another's, that is established as his.

original: sbom po ni zhes bya ba'i tshig de dang por smos pa ni dbang du byas pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbom po ni zhes bya ba'i tshig de dang por smos pa ni dbang du byas pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word gross is mentioned first in order to teach the basis.

original: gang zhig gang len pa de'i de zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa la bsdus nas 'jug pa rnams la gzhan gyi nor rku ba la gang zhig grogs kyi phyir 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gang len pa de'i de zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa la bsdus nas 'jug pa rnams la gzhan gyi nor rku ba la gang zhig grogs kyi phyir 'gro ba ste /
translated: The term his in the phrase his taking of what is not given refers to the person who takes what is not given. The term his in the phrase his taking of what is not given refers to the person who takes what is not given. The term his in the phrase his taking of what is not given refers to the person who takes what is not given.

original: bdag gi don du na ma byin par len par 'dod pa ni nyes pa sbom por ro //
analyzed: bdag gi don du na ma byin par len par 'dod pa ni nyes pa sbom por ro //
translated: If one goes for the sake of a friend, but takes what is not given for one's own sake, then one incurs a serious offense.

original: der gzhan gyi don nyid du na yang dngos @94b gzhi'i rnam pa'o zhes smos pa ni mdo 'di spros pa'o //
analyzed: der gzhan gyi don nyid du na yang dngos @94b gzhi'i rnam pa'o zhes smos pa ni mdo 'di spros pa'o //
translated: The term even indicates that the taking of what is not given is a basic offense even for the sake of another.🔽The term from a charnel ground indicates that the taking of what is not given is a basic offense even when one takes from a charnel ground.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'i dur khrod nas len pa po zhes bya ba ni 'dir len pa'i bdag nyid can yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa nyid la pham par byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'i dur khrod nas len pa po zhes bya ba ni 'dir len pa'i bdag nyid can yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa nyid la pham par byas pa nyid do //
translated: The term one who takes indicates that the taking of what is not given is a basic offense even when one takes for the sake of another.

original: de bas na ma byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid kyis bdag gir bya ba la sogs pa'i dbang gis gang zhig rnam par gnas pa nyid 'dir yongs su bzung ba dang bcas pa nyid 'di rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ma byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid kyis bdag gir bya ba la sogs pa'i dbang gis gang zhig rnam par gnas pa nyid 'dir yongs su bzung ba dang bcas pa nyid 'di rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the taking of what is not given is a basic offense when one takes what is not given by the owner, whether the object has arisen or not, and whether it is owned or not.

original: gang rnams kyis dur khrod kyi dngos po de ma byung bar 'gyur ba de rnams dang de la yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang rnams kyis dur khrod kyi dngos po de ma byung bar 'gyur ba de rnams dang de la yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: Those who do not take that cemetery thing as not arisen, they are the ones who have complete possession of it.

original: ci ste sho gam bzhin 'dir pham pa yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste sho gam bzhin 'dir pham pa yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that, like a toll, there is defeat here,

original: 'di ni yod pa ma yin te skyon po bzhin du sho gam la sbyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa ma yin te skyon po bzhin du sho gam la sbyin pa nyid do //
translated: that is not so, because the giving of the toll is like the giving of a fine.

original: 'di ltar dur khrod kyi rdzas de dag la phongs pa nyid kyis blangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dur khrod kyi rdzas de dag la phongs pa nyid kyis blangs pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the taking of those cemetery things is due to poverty.

original: brtse ba med pa nyid kyis 'di'i don du bsris la sogs pa nyid kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: brtse ba med pa nyid kyis 'di'i don du bsris la sogs pa nyid kyi rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of the cutting, etc. of those things is the lack of compassion.

original: de bas na ma byung ba dang 'byung bar ma gyur pa nyid yod kyang 'dir ma byung ba rnams la log par ma gyur pa de'i dngos po la bdag gir bya ba'i blo yang dag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na ma byung ba dang 'byung bar ma gyur pa nyid yod kyang 'dir ma byung ba rnams la log par ma gyur pa de'i dngos po la bdag gir bya ba'i blo yang dag par gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, although non-arising and non-occurrence exist, the cognition of ownership of those non-arisen things is well-established here.

original: de bas na 'dir pham pa mi skyed pa ni rku ba'i rnam pa 'di yongs su bzung ba dang bcas pa'i 'du shes kyis bzung ba zhes bya ba 'dir ni nyes pa sbom por shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir pham pa mi skyed pa ni rku ba'i rnam pa 'di yongs su bzung ba dang bcas pa'i 'du shes kyis bzung ba zhes bya ba 'dir ni nyes pa sbom por shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, here, not causing defeat is understood as a serious offense in this case of taking what is not given by the perception of what is possessed.

original: dngos po tshang ba ni spom po 'dir rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po tshang ba ni spom po 'dir rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The completeness of the basis should be understood here as serious.

original: rtsa ba'i ldum zhing dang sdong bu dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu'i kun dga' rab la sogs pa gsang sngags dag gis skems par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gsang sngags dag gis chud gzon pas chud gson pa de bstan pa'i phyir mdo 'di bstan🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ldum zhing dang sdong bu dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu'i kun dga' rab la sogs pa gsang sngags dag gis skems par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gsang sngags dag gis chud gzon pas chud gson pa de bstan pa'i phyir mdo 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase sprinkling with mantras on the root crops, stems, leaves, flowers, fruits, and so on in the garden is taught in this sutra to show the wasting of what is sprinkled with mantras.

original: chas kyis rdo pas rta bkri ba dang zhon te 'di brku bar bya'o snyam nas lus 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni chas sbyin pas rta khyer ba de ltar rnam pa des rta 'di brku bar bya'o snyam du lus 'gyur ba la nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: chas kyis rdo pas rta bkri ba dang zhon te 'di brku bar bya'o snyam nas lus 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni chas sbyin pas rta khyer ba de ltar rnam pa des rta 'di brku bar bya'o snyam du lus 'gyur ba la nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: The phrase with the intention of stealing this horse, changing one's appearance by wearing armor, holding a weapon, and mounting the horse means that by giving the appearance of a soldier, the horse is taken. With that appearance, thinking I will steal this horse, changing one's body is a serious offense.

original: de bzhin du zhon to rta 'di brku bar bya'o snyams nas de ltar sems shing lus g-yo ba la sogs pas lus 'gyur ba yang sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhon to rta 'di brku bar bya'o snyams nas de ltar sems shing lus g-yo ba la sogs pas lus 'gyur ba yang sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if one thinks, “I will steal this horse,” and one’s body changes through movement and so on, then one commits a serious offense.🔽Also, a boat is like that.

original: gru yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gru 'dir zhugs te 'di rku bar bya'o snyam du sems shing lus 'gyur bar byed na zhes bya ba ni sbom por zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: gru yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gru 'dir zhugs te 'di rku bar bya'o snyam du sems shing lus 'gyur bar byed na zhes bya ba ni sbom por zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
translated: If one thinks, “I will steal this boat by boarding it,” and one’s body changes, then one commits a serious offense.🔽Also, from this, it is like that.

original: 'di las 'di ltar snyam pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni sngar 'di zhes bya ba smos pa'i tshig gi @95a * //
analyzed: 'di las 'di ltar snyam pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni sngar 'di zhes bya ba smos pa'i tshig gi @95a * //
translated: The word “this” in the previous line is the basis for the word “this” in the present line.

original: gnas su 'dir rta 'di las gru 'di ltar brku bar bya'o snyam nas lus 'gyur ba yang sbom po'o //
analyzed: gnas su 'dir rta 'di las gru 'di ltar brku bar bya'o snyam nas lus 'gyur ba yang sbom po'o //
translated: If one thinks, “I will steal this horse from this boat in this way,” and one’s body changes, then one commits a serious offense.

original: 'dir 'di ni mi bsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'di ni mi bsal ba ma yin no //
translated: This is not an exception to the rule.🔽Here, the text states:

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gru rin po ches bkang ba rgal bar byed pa des 'di las 'di ltar brku bar bya'o snyam na der lus 'gyur bar byas nas des 'gyod pa skyes nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gru rin po ches bkang ba rgal bar byed pa des 'di las 'di ltar brku bar bya'o snyam na der lus 'gyur bar byas nas des 'gyod pa skyes nas /
translated: A monk who is crossing a river in a boat filled with jewels thinks, “I will steal this from here.” If he changes his body there, he will generate regret.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavan said,

original: pham par mi 'gyur te nyes po sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pham par mi 'gyur te nyes po sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “It is not a defeating offense, but a serious transgression.”

original: ji ste sbyor ba'i rnam pa 'di yin gyi sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ste sbyor ba'i rnam pa 'di yin gyi sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If one thinks, “This is the form of sexual union, but it is not sexual union,”

original: de bas na nyes byas kyis 'dir 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na nyes byas kyis 'dir 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then a minor offense would occur in this case.

original: nges pa thob pa la 'byung ba med pa mthong bas gcig tu spro ba nyams pa la rnam par 'gyur ba 'di zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa thob pa la 'byung ba med pa mthong bas gcig tu spro ba nyams pa la rnam par 'gyur ba 'di zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
translated: Since it is seen that there is no offense for one who has attained certainty, it should be understood that this is a change in the case of one who has completely lost enthusiasm.

original: de ltar na 'di la sbyor ba nyid skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di la sbyor ba nyid skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the form of sexual union would arise in this case.

original: pham dang phu nu dang bu sring dang mkhan po dang slob dpon dang mchod rten dang dge 'dun la sogs pa la bsdos pa sho gam gzhal dgos pa bzlas pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pham dang phu nu dang bu sring dang mkhan po dang slob dpon dang mchod rten dang dge 'dun la sogs pa la bsdos pa sho gam gzhal dgos pa bzlas pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having intercourse with a relative, a brother, a sister, a preceptor, a master, a stupa, the Sangha, and so on” means that one has intercourse with a relative, a brother, a sister, a preceptor, a master, a stupa, the Sangha, and so on.

original: 'di la bdag gi sho gam gyi bya ba 'di dag phul ba zhes bya ba'i brnag pa bskyed nas de 'da' bar byed na gzhan don nyid kyi phyir nyes pa sbom por te pham pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la bdag gi sho gam gyi bya ba 'di dag phul ba zhes bya ba'i brnag pa bskyed nas de 'da' bar byed na gzhan don nyid kyi phyir nyes pa sbom por te pham pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, if one thinks, I will give up these duties of mine as a toll collector, and one does not do it, then because of the benefit to others, there is a grave offense, but not a downfall.

original: gzhan gyi don la ni dngos gzhi'i rnam pa zhes bya ba 'di spros pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la ni dngos gzhi'i rnam pa zhes bya ba 'di spros pa yin no //
translated: This is the basic form of for the sake of others, and this is an elaboration.

original: brnyas pa dang bskyis pa dag mi sbyin par sems pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brnyas pa dang bskyis pa dag mi sbyin par sems pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The thought I will not give to those who are contemptible or stingy.

original: brnogs pa ni 'dir brkus pa'o //
analyzed: brnogs pa ni 'dir brkus pa'o //
translated: Here, contemptible means dishonorable.

original: de bas na des sbyin par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba mi sbyin pa'i kun tu rtog pa la sbyor ba nyid rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na des sbyin par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba mi sbyin pa'i kun tu rtog pa la sbyor ba nyid rigs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to apply the thought I will not give to the thought of not giving to those who are contemptible.

original: snon pa la yang brnyas pa dang bskyis pa dag la sbom po ste /
analyzed: snon pa la yang brnyas pa dang bskyis pa dag la sbom po ste /
translated: Also, I will not give to those who are stingy is a grave offense.

original: me sbyin pa'i kun tu rtog pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'dir rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: me sbyin pa'i kun tu rtog pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'dir rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: And the thought I will not give to those who are contemptible should be understood here.

original: gzhan gyi don du byin pa 'god pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yon bdag gis dge 'dun la mchod rten la sogs pa'i don du rdzas dge slong gi lag tu byin pa de rnams kyis 'god pa la sbom po ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du byin pa 'god pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yon bdag gis dge 'dun la mchod rten la sogs pa'i don du rdzas dge slong gi lag tu byin pa de rnams kyis 'god pa la sbom po ste /
translated: Also, it is a serious offense to assign what is given for the benefit of others.

original: 'dir don mi shes pa nyid dge 'dun gyi bdag nyid kyi bdag po la rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'dir don mi shes pa nyid dge 'dun gyi bdag nyid kyi bdag po la rgyu yin te /
translated: Here, the ignorance of the purpose is the cause for the master of the Saṅgha himself.

original: gang gi phyir pham pa dang 'dra ba'i sbom po'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir pham pa dang 'dra ba'i sbom po'o //
translated: Because it is a serious offense similar to a defeating offense.

original: gang gi phyir dge slong nad pas dge 'dun la rdzas phul ba da dge 'dun gyi 'di shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge slong nad pas dge 'dun la rdzas phul ba da dge 'dun gyi 'di shes pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the sick monk offered the goods to the Saṅgha, the Saṅgha does not know that it is his.

original: dge 'dun las kyang nye gnas de dag gis brku ba 'di byas ba ste sbyin pa po la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun las kyang nye gnas de dag gis brku ba 'di byas ba ste sbyin pa po la ni ma yin no //
translated: The Saṅgha is not the thief, but the attendants of the Saṅgha commit the theft.

original: de bas na brkus pa la @95b pham pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na brkus pa la @95b pham pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the thief is the one who generates the defeating offense.

original: yongs su ma bzung ba yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po gang sus kyang yongs su ma bzung ba la 'di yongs su bzung ngo snyam pa'i 'du shes can gyis blangs pa la nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de bas na mdo phyi ma la yan lag tu gtogs pa mdo 'di rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de bas na gros byed pa tha dad pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'di las gros byed par gyur pa ngag gi las sam lus kyi bya ba'i bdag nyid can gang yin pa de la mi 'gro ba las tha dad pa nyid ma
translated: That which is the consultation in this world, which is of the nature of verbal action or bodily action, is not distinct from non-consultation.

original: yin te / nyes byas 'di nyid la de khongs su gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yin te / nyes byas 'di nyid la de khongs su gtogs pa ste /
translated: This very fault is included in that,

original: nyes byas gnyis pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes byas gnyis pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is not a second fault.
