translated: One should examine well whether it is not taken, and then take it. This is added for the sake of regret and finding fault with the words of others.

original: de ltar legs par so sor brtag par byas nas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar legs par so sor brtag par byas nas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Having examined well in this way, one should take it.

original: ji ltar kun du bzung ba ma yin pa 'di zhes bya ba'i brtan pa nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar kun du bzung ba ma yin pa 'di zhes bya ba'i brtan pa nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: How does one become firm and certain that this is not taken?

original: lus bsnyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus sgyel cing bsnyal ba ni grags pa las dgos pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: lus bsnyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus sgyel cing bsnyal ba ni grags pa las dgos pa'i don du'o //
translated: One should not lie down on one’s body. One should not lie down on one’s body, turning it over, for the sake of fame.

original: brdung ba dang brdegs pa la sogs pa gzhan rnam par 'khrugs par gyur pas 'di lta bu bsnyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: brdung ba dang brdegs pa la sogs pa gzhan rnam par 'khrugs par gyur pas 'di lta bu bsnyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not lie down in this way, being disturbed by others, such as beating and striking.

original: 'bras bu'i mdun du dge slong gis bdag nyid dor ba la smrab pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i mdun du dge slong gis bdag nyid dor ba la smrab pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is what a bhikṣu says in front of a fruit, throwing himself away.

original: slar dge slong gi lus 'gyur ba rnam pa de lta bu ma bya'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: slar dge slong gi lus 'gyur ba rnam pa de lta bu ma bya'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de bsdus pa yin no //
translated: What is said there is included, “One should not change one’s body as a bhikṣu in that way.”

original: tshang gzhig par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye'u dang phug ron la sogs pa'i rten ni tshang ngo //
analyzed: tshang gzhig par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye'u dang phug ron la sogs pa'i rten ni tshang ngo //
translated: One should not destroy a nest. A nest is a support for birds, pigeons, and so on.

original: 'di la skur pa gdab pa ni dge slong gi gnas su sgo nga med pa la sogs pa gsal ba'i cho ga la sogs pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la skur pa gdab pa ni dge slong gi gnas su sgo nga med pa la sogs pa gsal ba'i cho ga la sogs pa rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the denial is to be understood as the ritual of clarifying the absence of eggs in the abode of a bhikṣu, and so on.

original: ma gnas pa der chos gos kyi cha mi blang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma gnas pa der chos gos kyi cha mi blang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not take a part of one’s robe there, in an unsuitable place.

original: gang du gnas pa la rnyed pa de 'byung ba de las gzhan du lo gcig gi chos gos rnyed pa la @96b yang mi blang ngo //🔽'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis dbyar gzhan du gnas la /
analyzed: gang du gnas pa la rnyed pa de 'byung ba de las gzhan du lo gcig gi chos gos rnyed pa la @96b yang mi blang ngo // 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis dbyar gzhan du gnas la /
translated: He should not accept robes for one year from anyone else who might offer them.

original: gzhan du dbyar gyi so sor cha blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du dbyar gyi so sor cha blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The text reads: “A monk should not enter the rains retreat in one place and then receive the share of the robes in another place.”

original: so so'i cha ni skal ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i cha ni skal ba'o //
translated: The “share of the robes” is the share of the robes.

original: 'dir lo gcig gi tshig ni dpe yin no //
analyzed: 'dir lo gcig gi tshig ni dpe yin no //
translated: The term “one year” is used here as an example.

original: gzhan du yang mi thob pa 'di bkag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yang mi thob pa 'di bkag pa'o //
translated: The prohibition is that he should not receive them from anyone else.

original: chom rkun pa las spyin bdag gi sems kyis len pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni chom rkun pa de'i drung nas blangs pa gang yin pa de la 'di ni sbyin bdag snyam pa'i sems kyis len na de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: chom rkun pa las spyin bdag gi sems kyis len pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni chom rkun pa de'i drung nas blangs pa gang yin pa de la 'di ni sbyin bdag snyam pa'i sems kyis len na de la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he receives them from a patron who has stolen them and then given them away, thinking that they belong to him.

original: ji ltar gzhan las blangs pa la nyes pa med pa de bzhin du 'di la'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan las blangs pa la nyes pa med pa de bzhin du 'di la'o //
translated: There is no offense if he receives them from someone else, just as there is no offense if he receives them from the thief himself.

original: gang gi phyir 'dis brkus pa de nyid kyis 'di 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dis brkus pa de nyid kyis 'di 'brel pa'o //
translated: He is connected with the thief because he stole the robes.

original: nor 'di la 'di ni bdag po ste de nyid kyis 'di gnang ba zhes bya ba 'di ltar yongs su ma dag pa'i sems kyis blangs pa la ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor 'di la 'di ni bdag po ste de nyid kyis 'di gnang ba zhes bya ba 'di ltar yongs su ma dag pa'i sems kyis blangs pa la ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The thought This wealth belongs to this person, and he himself has given it is impure, and so there is a downfall.

original: de bas na sbyin pa po'i sems kyis zhes bya ba 'di ni bye brag go //
analyzed: de bas na sbyin pa po'i sems kyis zhes bya ba 'di ni bye brag go //
translated: The phrase by the donor's intention is the distinction.

original: 'ong ba rku thabs can gyi chom rkun par ma grags pa las blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma shes pa dang glo bur du gyur pa ma grags pa las blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'ong ba rku thabs can gyi chom rkun par ma grags pa las blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma shes pa dang glo bur du gyur pa ma grags pa las blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not take from a thief who is known to be a robber, or from a place that is known to be a place of theft.  Not known means not recognized or not known to be a place of theft.

original: rku ba yang dag par srid pa la glags gcad pa'i don du 'di btags pa'o //
analyzed: rku ba yang dag par srid pa la glags gcad pa'i don du 'di btags pa'o //
translated: This is a reference to a thief who is known to be a thief, in order to prevent the opportunity for theft.

original: gang gi phyir rku ba de la gang zhig shes pa de ni grags pa zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir rku ba de la gang zhig shes pa de ni grags pa zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o ;
translated: Known should be understood as recognized.

original: / grags pa las blangs pa la chom rkun pa nyid kyis 'di brkus te gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rku ba yang dag par srid pa la glags med do //
analyzed: / grags pa las blangs pa la chom rkun pa nyid kyis 'di brkus te gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rku ba yang dag par srid pa la glags med do //
translated: The thief, having taken it from the famous one, cannot be accused of stealing another's property, saying, I did not steal it.

original: de las blangs pa ni mtshon gyis bcad pa dang kha dog ngan par bya ste bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las blangs pa ni mtshon gyis bcad pa dang kha dog ngan par bya ste bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The one who took it from the thief should keep it, having cut it with a weapon and spoiled its color.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni grags pa las de lta bur gyur pa nyid 'dzin pa la su zhig la glo bur du ma bcad pa yod pa srid par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di btags pa'o de ltar byas kyang slong na sbyin no zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni grags pa las de lta bur gyur pa nyid 'dzin pa la su zhig la glo bur du ma bcad pa yod pa srid par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di btags pa'o de ltar byas kyang slong na sbyin no zhes bya ba ni
translated: In this regard, who would be able to suddenly keep it without cutting it, having taken it from the famous one in such a condition? This is the implication of in this regard. If it is asked for, it should be given, even if it is treated like that.

original: de ltar brkus pa la yang mtshon gyis gcad pa dang / kha dog ngan par byas kyang slong na gang las de brkus pa des shes te gal te slong ba de la der sbyin par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar brkus pa la yang mtshon gyis gcad pa dang / kha dog ngan par byas kyang slong na gang las de brkus pa des shes te gal te slong ba de la der sbyin par bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even if the stolen property is cut with a weapon and spoiled in color, if it is asked for, it should be given to the one from whom it was stolen. This is the meaning of if it is asked for, it should be given.

original: gnad la bsgre bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnad la bsgre bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not go to extremes.🔽 In this regard, what is meant by going to extremes?

original: g-yon pos gnod pa ni yod pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pos gnod pa ni yod pa'o //
translated: The left hand is the one that does the harm.

original: gang gi tshe dang ldan pa spong byed kyis bzod par bya ba'i phyir khyim pa rnams kyis 'phags pa kun dga' bo la khye'u dang bu mo du ba dag sdud du bcug ste gnod par byed pa de'i @97a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dang ldan pa spong byed kyis bzod par bya ba'i phyir khyim pa rnams kyis 'phags pa kun dga' bo la khye'u dang bu mo du ba dag sdud du bcug ste gnod par byed pa de'i @97a * //
translated: When the Venerable Upali, in order to make the householder accept the teaching, had him take in the sons and daughters of noble Nanda and harm them,

original: tshe thams cad du sbyar ba 'di thams cad kyis bya ba nye bar btags pa'o //
analyzed: tshe thams cad du sbyar ba 'di thams cad kyis bya ba nye bar btags pa'o //
translated: at that time all this was enjoined by this whole application.

original: ma byin par len pa la yang 'di sbyar ba yod de rdo rje pha lam gyis brkus pa la gtong ba dang sbyin du 'jug pa la nor la kha na ma tho ba nyid dang bcas pa zhes bya ba 'di las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa la yang 'di sbyar ba yod de rdo rje pha lam gyis brkus pa la gtong ba dang sbyin du 'jug pa la nor la kha na ma tho ba nyid dang bcas pa zhes bya ba 'di las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This application also exists for stealing: “The one who steals a diamond must give it up and be made to give it up. There is a fault in the wealth.” This should be understood from the text.

original: gsang sngags dag gis gtong ba la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang 'dra ba'i rnam par dag pa dang skyon med pa'i sems kyis rku ba'i rnam pa nges pa gang gis kyang brkus pa chom rkun pa rnams las gsang sngags rnams gsang sngags🔽kyis gtong ba gang yin pa de ni nyes pa dang bcas par shes par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsang sngags dag gis gtong ba la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang 'dra ba'i rnam par dag pa dang skyon med pa'i sems kyis rku ba'i rnam pa nges pa gang gis kyang brkus pa chom rkun pa rnams las gsang sngags rnams gsang sngags kyis gtong ba gang yin pa de ni nyes pa dang bcas par shes par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that there is no offense in giving back what was stolen by a thief through a mind of pure and flawless supernatural power like a mantra.

original: byi bas khyer ba bdag pos blangs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba gang zhig len pa po 'di de'i rdzas byi bas brkus pa blangs pa la yang nyes pa med do //🔽rang gi 'du shes nyid kyis de len pa zhes bya ba 'dir nyes pa dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: byi bas khyer ba bdag pos blangs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba gang zhig len pa po 'di de'i rdzas byi bas brkus pa blangs pa la yang nyes pa med do //🔽rang gi 'du shes nyid kyis de len pa zhes bya ba 'dir nyes pa dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: There is no offense in taking back what was stolen by a rat, if the owner takes it back with the same perception as before.🔽This means that there is no offense in taking back what was stolen by a rat, if the owner takes it back with the same perception as before.

original: dge slong gzhan gyi rdzas la de'i rdzas su na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge slong gzhan gang la nor de brkus pa de la nor len par byed pa la nyes pa med de //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan gyi rdzas la de'i rdzas su na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge slong gzhan gang la nor de brkus pa de la nor len par byed pa la nyes pa med de //
translated: Also, with regard to the property of another monk, if one thinks it is one’s own property, there is no offense.

original: rku sems med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rku sems med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no thought of stealing.

original: rngon pa dag gis mngon par gtses par gyur pa'i ri dags gnas khang du zhugs pa blangs pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yongs su bskyab pa tsam du 'di blangs pa ste /
analyzed: rngon pa dag gis mngon par gtses par gyur pa'i ri dags gnas khang du zhugs pa blangs pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yongs su bskyab pa tsam du 'di blangs pa ste /
translated: Also, when a deer is seized by hunters and enters one’s house, there is no offense if one takes it, thinking, “I will protect it.”

original: bzung ba ma yin zhing gtong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bzung ba ma yin zhing gtong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not taken as a possession, nor is it given away.

original: de bas na 'dir skyon med do //🔽de shi na de dag la sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni de dag gis gtses pas der zhugs na de rnams la sbyin par bya ba nyid de rang gis gzung bar bya ba nyid dang gzhan la sbyin par bya ba ma yin pa nyid
analyzed: de bas na 'dir skyon med do // de shi na de dag la sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni de dag gis gtses pas der zhugs na de rnams la sbyin par bya ba nyid de rang gis gzung bar bya ba nyid dang gzhan la sbyin par bya ba ma yin pa nyid
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in this case.🔽If it dies, it should be given to them.

original: do // pham pa gnyis pa'i 'dul byed kyi skabs so /
analyzed: do // pham pa gnyis pa'i 'dul byed kyi skabs so /
translated: If a deer is seized by hunters and enters one’s house, it should be given to them, because it is not taken as a possession by oneself, nor is it given away to another.

original: // / nad pa la 'chi ba'i sems pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos nye bar bsgrub pas nye bar bsgrub par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsgrub pa gang zhig thos nas nad pa 'di 'chi ba'i bsam pa skyes par 'gyur ba'i nye bar bsgrub pa
analyzed: // / nad pa la 'chi ba'i sems pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos nye bar bsgrub pas nye bar bsgrub par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsgrub pa gang zhig thos nas nad pa 'di 'chi ba'i bsam pa skyes par 'gyur ba'i nye bar bsgrub pa
translated: That is, one should not teach a doctrine that will lead to the death of the sick person, hearing which he will die.

original: de ni nad pa'i phyir mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nad pa'i phyir mi bya'o //
translated: That is not to be done for the sick person.

original: dper na khyod dug zos par gyur pa ni bla'i 'di lta bu'i mi 'phrod pa za bar byed pa ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na khyod dug zos par gyur pa ni bla'i 'di lta bu'i mi 'phrod pa za bar byed pa ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, it is better for you to eat poison than to eat such unwholesome food.

original: nyes pa yod pa la pham par 'gro ba las gzhan bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa yod pa la pham par 'gro ba las gzhan bskyed pa'o //
translated: The presence of a fault is the production of something other than a defeat.

original: nyes pa med pa yod pa nyid la btags pa 'di @97b yin no ;
analyzed: nyes pa med pa yod pa nyid la btags pa 'di @97b yin no ;
translated: The presence of no fault is the designation of this.🔽One should not attend on the sick without permission from the one who is ignorant of the enemy of death.

original: / mi shes pa las 'chi ba'i dgra po ma smras par de'i nad g-yog tu mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni 'di la khyod kyi dgra bos 'chi ba'i phyir rjes su sgrub pa pos 'chi ba rjes su dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: / mi shes pa las 'chi ba'i dgra po ma smras par de'i nad g-yog tu mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni 'di la khyod kyi dgra bos 'chi ba'i phyir rjes su sgrub pa pos 'chi ba rjes su dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: That is, you should not attend on the sick person without permission from the one who is ignorant of the enemy of death, who is death itself.

original: de ltar bsgo bar ma byas par nad pa la nad g-yog mi shes pa nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgo bar ma byas par nad pa la nad g-yog mi shes pa nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not appoint as an attendant a person who does not know how to care for the sick, unless he is willing to learn.

original: gnas yod na mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni gal te mi shes pa de med par yongs su 'jug na 'di ni gzhag par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gnas yod na mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni gal te mi shes pa de med par yongs su 'jug na 'di ni gzhag par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: If there is no other choice, he should not be appointed.

original: de'i ngo bo yid ches pa la de'i tshig go //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo yid ches pa la de'i tshig go //
translated: The word of a trustworthy person is the nature of a trustworthy person.

original: slar dge slong gi nad pa la mi shes pa'i nad g-yog nye bar gzhag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: slar dge slong gi nad pa la mi shes pa'i nad g-yog nye bar gzhag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: A monk who is sick should not be attended by a person who is not trustworthy.

original: gal te de'i ngo bo yid ches par gyur na sbas nas gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba bstan pa 'dir sba ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de'i ngo bo yid ches par gyur na sbas nas gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba bstan pa 'dir sba ba'o //
translated: If he is a trustworthy person, he should be appointed in secret.

original: 'chi ba'i 'tshog chas mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni nad pa la zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i 'tshog chas mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni nad pa la zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should not keep at hand the implements of suicide.

original: de yang mtshon la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mtshon la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are such things as a knife.

original: de 'chi ba'i phyir rjes su bsgrub pa las nad g-yog gis bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de 'chi ba'i phyir rjes su bsgrub pa las nad g-yog gis bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the sick person is intent on dying, the attendant should prevent it.

original: de zhes bya ba ni nad pa'o ;
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni nad pa'o ;
translated: The sick person is referred to by the pronoun “he.”

original: / rdzas kyi phyir gzhan 'chi bar 'dod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed dang / chos gos la sogs pa'i rdzas thob par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: / rdzas kyi phyir gzhan 'chi bar 'dod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed dang / chos gos la sogs pa'i rdzas thob par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: This means for the sake of obtaining material things such as a begging-bowl, robes, etc.

original: bya ba ma yin pa byed pa la sems kyis rjes su yi rang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa byed pa la sems kyis rjes su yi rang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not rejoice mentally in the performance of what should not be done.

original: bya ba ma yin pa nyid byed pa ni bya ba ma yin pa nyid byed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa nyid byed pa ni bya ba ma yin pa nyid byed pa'o //
translated: The performance of what should not be done is the performance of what is not to be done.

original: rang ngam gzhan gyis 'das pa 'am ma 'ongs pa 'am /
analyzed: rang ngam gzhan gyis 'das pa 'am ma 'ongs pa 'am /
translated: Whether by oneself, or by another, in the past, future, or present,

original: da ltar byung ba la de'i rjes su yi rang bar sems kyis ma byas pa nyid dam lus kyi bya bas kyang ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la de'i rjes su yi rang bar sems kyis ma byas pa nyid dam lus kyi bya bas kyang ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: one should not rejoice mentally in that, nor by the performance of bodily action.

original: 'di dag la sems sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir grub pa dman pa'i de nyid brjod pa la gzhan du gtam gang yang med do zhes bya ba rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag la sems sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir grub pa dman pa'i de nyid brjod pa la gzhan du gtam gang yang med do zhes bya ba rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since these are preceded by the mind, it is said that there is no other way to express the inferior reality of the established, in order to understand that.

original: gzhung kha cig las tshe dang ldan pa nye sde'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las tshe dang ldan pa nye sde'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa /
translated: In some texts, it is said with reference to the Venerable Upasena:🔽If a monk should have a thought of desire, he should confess it as a transgression.

original: nye sde khyod kyis mngal na gnas pa rlugs par byas pa bden nam /
analyzed: nye sde khyod kyis mngal na gnas pa rlugs par byas pa bden nam /
translated: “Is it true, Upasena, that you caused an abortion?”

original: btsun pa ma lags te 'di ltar bdag gis rjes su yi rang bar ni bgyis so //
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags te 'di ltar bdag gis rjes su yi rang bar ni bgyis so //
translated: “No, Lord, I rejoiced in it.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: dge slong dag dge slong nye sde la ltung ba med de slar dge slong gis mngal na gnas pa rlugs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong nye sde la ltung ba med de slar dge slong gis mngal na gnas pa rlugs par mi bya'o //
translated: “Monks, the monk Upasena is without offense. But a monk should not cause an abortion.

original: dge slong mngal na gnas pa rlugs par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dge slong mngal na gnas pa rlugs par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: If a monk causes an abortion, he becomes guilty of a serious offense.”

original: de bas na mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: de bas na mdo 'di byas so //
translated: Therefore, this sūtra was composed.🔽You are not to be made to do this.

original: mdzes pa 'di byed par 'gyur ba khyed ni 'di byed du gzhug pa ma yin te /🔽'jug @98a * //
analyzed: mdzes pa 'di byed par 'gyur ba khyed ni 'di byed du gzhug pa ma yin te / 'jug @98a * //
translated: You are not to be made to engage in this.

original: pa ma yin zhes bya bar sems par byed na 'dis ni 'di byed de ci'i phyir mi byed /
analyzed: pa ma yin zhes bya bar sems par byed na 'dis ni 'di byed de ci'i phyir mi byed /
translated: If he thinks this, he does it. Why not?

original: bdag la 'dis ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas 'don pa 'di yin no /
analyzed: bdag la 'dis ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas 'don pa 'di yin no /
translated: What is the use of this to me? This is the meaning of the recitation.

original: 'di la dpe nyid rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la dpe nyid rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Here, the very example is established.

original: byed par 'gyur ba la gnas pa thams cad nyid la bya ba la gnas pa dang bya ba ma yin pa byed pa la rjes su yi rang ba la kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir shin tu yang dge slong la mi mthun pa
analyzed: byed par 'gyur ba la gnas pa thams cad nyid la bya ba la gnas pa dang bya ba ma yin pa byed pa la rjes su yi rang ba la kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir shin tu yang dge slong la mi mthun pa
translated: Because of the fault of engaging in and rejoicing in what should not be done, the monk is very much at odds with himself.

original: nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la khyad par mi brten pa'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la khyad par mi brten pa'o //
translated: The word also means that there is no distinction.

original: ji ltar yang rjes su yi rang ba la ltung ba nyid de gang gi phyir 'di la ltung bar bya ba zhes bya ba brjod pa dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang rjes su yi rang ba la ltung ba nyid de gang gi phyir 'di la ltung bar bya ba zhes bya ba brjod pa dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: How is there a downfall in rejoicing? Because it is said that this is to be condemned.

original: ltung ba la brten pa'i yid kyis sgrib pa 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba la brten pa'i yid kyis sgrib pa 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the mental obscuration based on a downfall.

original: gang du tham pa gsum pa zhes bya ba la ltos nas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang du tham pa gsum pa zhes bya ba la ltos nas brjod par bya ste /
translated: In the third line, where refers to the context.

original: de'i phyir srog bcad na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir srog bcad na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, if one kills a living being.

original: sems ji lta bus she na /
analyzed: sems ji lta bus she na /
translated: What kind of mind is it?

original: de'i phyir de ltar bsams pas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bsams pas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, with such a thought.

original: srog gcod pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: It is the mind of killing.

original: su'i srog gcod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: su'i srog gcod pa yin zhe na /
translated: Whose life is taken?

original: de'i phyir mir gyur pa'i'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mir gyur pa'i'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “of a human being.”

original: 'dir 'gro ba tsam la ni mtshan ma nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'gro ba tsam la ni mtshan ma nyid ma yin te /
translated: Here, mere being a human being is not the sign,

original: bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning dang mtshan med pa dang / mtshan gnyis pa dang / mngal nas skyes pa nyid la sogs pa khyad par 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba de'i phyir 'gro ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning dang mtshan med pa dang / mtshan gnyis pa dang / mngal nas skyes pa nyid la sogs pa khyad par 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba de'i phyir 'gro ba'i tshig go //
translated: because there is a difference in some respects, such as being a woman, a man, a eunuch, one without sexual organs, one with both sexual organs, or one born from a womb. Therefore, the word “human being” is used.

original: gzhan du 'du shes pas sam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du 'du shes pas sam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If one has a different perception, is it not so?

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'du shes pas so zhes bya ba smos te ma nor bar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'du shes pas so zhes bya ba smos te ma nor bar ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “with that perception,” without error.

original: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis she na /
translated: In what way, and by what aspect?

original: de'i phyir gang yang rung bas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yang rung bas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “by any means,”

original: rnam pa gang yang rung bas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gang yang rung bas so //
translated: by any aspect.

original: de nyid kyi spros pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi spros pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says,

original: bye brag med pa ni lus dang de dang 'brel pa dang / 'phangs pa dang gzhan dang bsgo ba rnams so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bye brag med pa ni lus dang de dang 'brel pa dang / 'phangs pa dang gzhan dang bsgo ba rnams so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Without distinction” means that the body, what is connected to it, what is thrown, and another are all the same.

original: bye brag med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di nas brtsams te ji srid du rgyu des gzhan gyi tshe shi na'o zhes 'byung ba yan chad kyi dbang du byas te rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di nas brtsams te ji srid du rgyu des gzhan gyi tshe shi na'o zhes 'byung ba yan chad kyi dbang du byas te rig par bya'o //
translated: “Without distinction” means that from here up to “by that cause, if another’s life is destroyed,” it is to be understood that they are all the same.

original: bye brag med pa ni tha mi dad pa ste /
analyzed: bye brag med pa ni tha mi dad pa ste /
translated: “Without distinction” means that they are not different.

original: shi ba'i don byed pa la 'di rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shi ba'i don byed pa la 'di rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “these” is that they all perform the meaning of “destroyed.”

original: rnam pa gang yang rung bas gsod pa la pham par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gang yang rung bas gsod pa la pham par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that one becomes guilty of a pārājika by killing in any way.

original: lus zhes bya ba ni lus nyid do //
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba ni lus nyid do //
translated: “Body” means the body itself.

original: de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang 'brel pa dbyig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang 'brel pa dbyig la sogs pa'o //
translated: “What is connected to it” means what is connected to the body, such as jewelry.

original: 'phangs pa ni lus kyis sam de dang 'brel pas gtang ba'o //
analyzed: 'phangs pa ni lus kyis sam de dang 'brel pas gtang ba'o //
translated: “What is thrown” means what is thrown by the body or what is connected to it.

original: de la gzhan gyi @98b nges par sbyar ba gsad par bya ba ni bud med la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi @98b nges par sbyar ba gsad par bya ba ni bud med la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Another” means a woman and so on who is to be killed.

original: bsgo ba zhes bya ba ni gsad par bya ba de nyid la rang gis bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: bsgo ba zhes bya ba ni gsad par bya ba de nyid la rang gis bsgo ba'o //
translated: The command is the command given by oneself to the one who is to be killed.

original: dug dang phye ma dang dong dang shing dang rang bzhin nyams pa gtong ba dang brang du 'debs pa dang / 'khrul 'khor dang sgyu thabs dang ro langs dang rjes su sbyor ba rnams so zhes bya ba ni bye brag med pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽rang bzhin nyams pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis nyams pa 'am gsod pa 'di nyid kyi don du mtshan ma de med par nyams pa'i rang bzhin gyis gang zhig der 'di lta bur gyur pa de la 'chi ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par 'gyur zhes bya
analyzed: dug dang phye ma dang dong dang shing dang rang bzhin nyams pa gtong ba dang brang du 'debs pa dang / 'khrul 'khor dang sgyu thabs dang ro langs dang rjes su sbyor ba rnams so zhes bya ba ni bye brag med pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro // rang bzhin nyams pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis nyams pa 'am gsod pa 'di nyid kyi don du mtshan ma de med par nyams pa'i rang bzhin gyis gang zhig der 'di lta bur gyur pa de la 'chi ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par 'gyur zhes bya
translated: Poison, dust, pit, tree, natural defect, giving up, striking the chest, machine, trick, zombie, and application are the particular methods of killing.🔽 The natural defect is the defect of that very person, or the defect of the natural condition of that very person for the purpose of killing. By the power of that, the condition of death arises for that person.

original: ba'i blos bskur ba ni rang bzhin nyams pas bskur ba'o //
analyzed: ba'i blos bskur ba ni rang bzhin nyams pas bskur ba'o //
translated: The giving up is the giving up by the mind, thinking, If it is like this for him, then the condition of death will be present for him.

original: ro langs phyed pa dang phyed du gyur pa nyid kyis yo byad rnams la gzhan du ma yin par bstan pa 'di la ro langs nying ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i ro langs kyi tshig bzung ba nyid du shes pas bsdus pa nyid du ma
analyzed: ro langs phyed pa dang phyed du gyur pa nyid kyis yo byad rnams la gzhan du ma yin par bstan pa 'di la ro langs nying ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i ro langs kyi tshig bzung ba nyid du shes pas bsdus pa nyid du ma
translated: analyzed as “not a zombie.”

original: byas so // g-yang du gtang ba'o zhes bya ba ni g-yang la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'i don gyis go bar bya'o //
analyzed: byas so // g-yang du gtang ba'o zhes bya ba ni g-yang la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'i don gyis go bar bya'o //
translated: “To be thrown into a pit” is understood to mean “into a pit, and so on.”

original: me dang chur 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: me dang chur 'jug pa'o //
translated: “To be burned in fire or drowned in water”

original: grang ba dang tsha bar 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni rkyen 'di dang ldan pa 'di la 'chi ba 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i blos so //
analyzed: grang ba dang tsha bar 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni rkyen 'di dang ldan pa 'di la 'chi ba 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i blos so //
translated: “To be exposed to cold or heat” means to be exposed to these conditions with the thought that death will occur.

original: pho nyar gtong ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni gang du 'jigs pa srid pa der pho nya dang mngags pa nyid du gtong ba'o //
analyzed: pho nyar gtong ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni gang du 'jigs pa srid pa der pho nya dang mngags pa nyid du gtong ba'o //
translated: “To be sent as a messenger, and so on” means to be sent as a messenger or an envoy to a place where there is danger.

original: der song na 'di dang 'di lta bu rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rnam pas bskul ba gang yin ba de nye bar bsdu ba'i don du sogs pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: der song na 'di dang 'di lta bu rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rnam pas bskul ba gang yin ba de nye bar bsdu ba'i don du sogs pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The word “etc.” in the phrase “and so on” is for the purpose of including the following: “If you go there, you will find such and such.”

original: de'i rjes su bsgrub pa chung du nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni rkang pa'i mthe bong dang rgya shug gi tshi gu dang shing bal la sogs pa bsnun pa lta bu dag go //
analyzed: de'i rjes su bsgrub pa chung du nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni rkang pa'i mthe bong dang rgya shug gi tshi gu dang shing bal la sogs pa bsnun pa lta bu dag go //
translated: After that, there is also the lesser form of subsequent action, which is like striking the big toe, a jujube fruit, or cotton with the hand.

original: rjes su bsgrub pa la chung ba 'di ni mtshan nyid 'di las grub ste bye brag ma smos pa de gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir 'di spros pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su bsgrub pa la chung ba 'di ni mtshan nyid 'di las grub ste bye brag ma smos pa de gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir 'di spros pa'o //
translated: This lesser form of subsequent action is established from this definition. This elaboration is for the purpose of clarifying that which is not specified.

original: gsad par bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning nyid do zhes bya ba ni bye brag med par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsad par bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning nyid do zhes bya ba ni bye brag med par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The object to be killed is a man, a woman, or a neuter, which is connected to the phrase “without distinction.”

original: gnas de dag bstan pa ni spros pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas de dag bstan pa ni spros pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of those states is the teaching of the meaning of elaboration.

original: gzhi des gzhan gyi tshe shi na'o zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni des de'i tshe ma yin yang 'on kyang nges de'i 'og tu'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhi des gzhan gyi tshe shi na'o zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni des de'i tshe ma yin yang 'on kyang nges de'i 'og tu'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text says, By that, at that time, but it does not mean that the time is only that. Rather, it is certain that it is after that.

original: 'dun pa bzlog pa'i 'og tu ni rgyu nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shi na zhes bya bar spyar ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa bzlog pa'i 'og tu ni rgyu nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shi na zhes bya bar spyar ro //
translated: After the reversal of intention, there is no cause, means if he dies.

original: shi ba 'am @99a * //🔽'gro ba la 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i gnas la bsgo bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: shi ba 'am @99a * // 'gro ba la 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i gnas la bsgo bar bya ba'am /
translated: If he dies,🔽or if he is afraid of going to a place,

original: nges par sbyar te gsad par bya ba'am /
analyzed: nges par sbyar te gsad par bya ba'am /
translated: or if he is definitely connected to being killed,

original: gzhan la de'i don du 'dus pa zlog par byed pa de las gzhan la 'da' bar byas nas de'i tshig ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la de'i don du 'dus pa zlog par byed pa de las gzhan la 'da' bar byas nas de'i tshig ma yin no //
translated: or if he turns back the assembly for his sake, then he transgresses that vow and it is not his vow.

original: sbyar bar byas pa'i shi ba la sbyor bar byed pa po'i rgyu mtshan nyid du sngar 'dun pa zlog par byed par gyur pa'i shi ba la de las pham pa 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyar bar byas pa'i shi ba la sbyor bar byed pa po'i rgyu mtshan nyid du sngar 'dun pa zlog par byed par gyur pa'i shi ba la de las pham pa 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he dies after being connected, then the reason for the one who connects is the characteristic of the cause. If he dies after the reversal of intention, then he transgresses that defeat.

original: phyis des skye ba yin te /
analyzed: phyis des skye ba yin te /
translated: Later, he is born from that.

original: 'di la ni sbyor ba tsam nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di la ni sbyor ba tsam nyid yin te /
translated: Here, it is merely the connection.

original: dngos gzhi'i pham pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i pham pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not a defeat that is the actual basis.

original: dku mnyes pas ma dang mngal na gnas pa gnyis las ma bsams pa shos na sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni shi na'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽shi ba'i don du mngal dang bcas pa'i lto ba mnyes pa las gang gi mngal du shi ba la ma bsams pa nyid de /
analyzed: dku mnyes pas ma dang mngal na gnas pa gnyis las ma bsams pa shos na sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni shi na'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro // shi ba'i don du mngal dang bcas pa'i lto ba mnyes pa las gang gi mngal du shi ba la ma bsams pa nyid de /
translated: If the mother is not the one who is thought of, it is a serious offense, if she dies.

original: shi ba la sbom po'o zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: shi ba la sbom po'o zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The meaning is that if the mother dies, it is a defeat.

original: bsams pa shos shi ba pham pa nyid de /
analyzed: bsams pa shos shi ba pham pa nyid de /
translated: If the one who is thought of dies, it is a defeat.

original: 'dir nges pa 'di la 'brel pa yin te ;
analyzed: 'dir nges pa 'di la 'brel pa yin te ;
translated: Here, this is the connection:

original: 'di la gsod par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la gsod par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If she dies, it is a defeat.”

original: de ltar yid la 'brel par gyur pa la yongs su ma spangs pa gang yin pa de la de bas na 'di spom po'o //
analyzed: de ltar yid la 'brel par gyur pa la yongs su ma spangs pa gang yin pa de la de bas na 'di spom po'o //
translated: In this way, if the one who is connected in mind is not completely abandoned, then it is a serious offense.

original: 'chi ba'i bdag nyid can gyi nye bar gsod pa'i mtshan ma can gyis mnyes pa yang cho ga 'di dang sbyar ba shi ba'i dogs pa yod par gyur pa las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i bdag nyid can gyi nye bar gsod pa'i mtshan ma can gyis mnyes pa yang cho ga 'di dang sbyar ba shi ba'i dogs pa yod par gyur pa las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the rite is also applied to one who is pleased with the sign of a murderer who has the nature of death, when there is doubt about death.

original: gzhi de las gsod pa la 'jug pa dang du len na'o zhes bya ba ni sbom po'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhi de las gsod pa la 'jug pa dang du len na'o zhes bya ba ni sbom po'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The basis is the one who commits the act of killing, and the grave offense is the one who consents to it.

original: gzhi byed pa po gang la sbom po 'di de'i rgyu mtshan du gzhan la gsod pa'i don gyis 'jug pa gang yin pa de gzhi de la sbom po'o //
analyzed: gzhi byed pa po gang la sbom po 'di de'i rgyu mtshan du gzhan la gsod pa'i don gyis 'jug pa gang yin pa de gzhi de la sbom po'o //
translated: The grave offense is the basis for the one who commits the act of killing on the basis of another, for the purpose of killing.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gzhan las tshe dang ldan pa nye sde'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs ba /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gzhan las tshe dang ldan pa nye sde'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs ba /
translated: Here, the text states in the context of Venerable Upasena:

original: nye sde khyod kyis mngal na gnas pa rlugs par byas sam /
analyzed: nye sde khyod kyis mngal na gnas pa rlugs par byas sam /
translated: “Upasena, did you cause an abortion?”

original: btsun pa bdag gis mngal na gnas pa rlugs par ma bgyis te /
analyzed: btsun pa bdag gis mngal na gnas pa rlugs par ma bgyis te /
translated: “Venerable, I did not cause an abortion,

original: 'on kyang bdag gis dang du blangs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag gis dang du blangs so //
translated: but I consented.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽“Upasena, you have committed a grave offense.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis de lta bu'i gnas pa dang du blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis de lta bu'i gnas pa dang du blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Monks should not accept such a thing.

original: gal te dang du len par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te dang du len par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If they do accept it, they commit an offense.

original: de'i don du mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: de'i don du mdo 'di byas so //
translated: This sūtra was composed for that purpose.

original: khyod kyi ming gis 'chi ba'i yo byad sbyin no zhes zer ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di lta bu'i tshig 'di la yang gzhi byas pa la sbom po'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi ming gis 'chi ba'i yo byad sbyin no zhes zer ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di lta bu'i tshig 'di la yang gzhi byas pa la sbom po'o //
translated: “If you say, ‘I will give you the means to die,’ it is also like that,” means that if you make a basis out of such words, it is a serious offense.

original: ji skad du dge @99b slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa las khyod kyi ming gis phye ma sbyin no zhes bya ba brjod pa la dge slong mas gzhi byas te /
analyzed: ji skad du dge @99b slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa las khyod kyi ming gis phye ma sbyin no zhes bya ba brjod pa la dge slong mas gzhi byas te /
translated: As it says in the Vinaya for nuns, if you say, “I will give you flour,” and the nun makes a basis out of that,

original: ji srid du bden par dge slong ma khyod mngal rlugs par byas pa bden nam /
analyzed: ji srid du bden par dge slong ma khyod mngal rlugs par byas pa bden nam /
translated: “For as long as it is true, nun, did you cause an abortion?”

original: btsun pa bdag gis mngal na gnas pa rlugs par ma bgyis te /
analyzed: btsun pa bdag gis mngal na gnas pa rlugs par ma bgyis te /
translated: “Lord, I did not cause an abortion.

original: 'on kyang bdag gis dang du blangs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag gis dang du blangs so //
translated: But I did accept it.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma rnams la bos te bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma rnams la bos te bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One addressed the nuns:🔽“Nuns, you should not accept the means to die.

original: dge slong mas gnas rnam pa de lta bu dang du blang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dge slong mas gnas rnam pa de lta bu dang du blang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: A nun should not accept such a condition.

original: dang du len par byed na nyes pa sbom po'i ltung ba 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dang du len par byed na nyes pa sbom po'i ltung ba 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: If she accepts it, she incurs an increased offense of a serious transgression.

original: de bas na mdo 'di byas pa yin no ;
analyzed: de bas na mdo 'di byas pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, this sūtra was composed.

original: / cho ga 'di la 'di sbyor cig ces bya ba 'di lta bu'i gzhi byas pa'i dbang du byas nas 'di gnyis ni sbom po'i ltung ba la btags pa'o //
analyzed: / cho ga 'di la 'di sbyor cig ces bya ba 'di lta bu'i gzhi byas pa'i dbang du byas nas 'di gnyis ni sbom po'i ltung ba la btags pa'o //
translated: These two are designated as serious transgressions based on the basis of the statement, “Apply this rite to this.”

original: bdag gi phyir nyes pa sbom po'i dgongs pa nyid 'di dge slong gi rnam par 'byed pa las 'gal tshabs dang bcas pa'i tshig can rang gis 'jug pa rab tu rig pa la gzhi byed pa 'di yin gyi snang pa dang bslangs pa la ni ma yin no
analyzed: bdag gi phyir nyes pa sbom po'i dgongs pa nyid 'di dge slong gi rnam par 'byed pa las 'gal tshabs dang bcas pa'i tshig can rang gis 'jug pa rab tu rig pa la gzhi byed pa 'di yin gyi snang pa dang bslangs pa la ni ma yin no
translated: This is the intention of the serious offense for oneself in the analysis of bhikṣus in the Vinaya, which is based on the words with the term “condemned” and the term “self-initiated.” It is not based on “apparent” and “requested.”

original: // de bas na rnam par sbyar ba nyid kyi phyir go bar byed pa nyid yod kyang mi smra ba'i ngo bor gzhi byas pa la 'dir sbom por rnam par shes pa ste pham pa la ni ma yin no //🔽gzhan dud 'gro ma yin pa dang sprul pa bsad pa las yang ngo zhes bya ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sbom po'o zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // de bas na rnam par sbyar ba nyid kyi phyir go bar byed pa nyid yod kyang mi smra ba'i ngo bor gzhi byas pa la 'dir sbom por rnam par shes pa ste pham pa la ni ma yin no // gzhan dud 'gro ma yin pa dang sprul pa bsad pa las yang ngo zhes bya ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sbom po'o zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, even though the act of killing is present, since it is a mere preparation, it is a serious offense, not a defeat.🔽Also, in killing another who is not an animal or a magical creation. The word also indicates that it is a serious offense.

original: mi'i 'go ba las gzhan pa'i sprul pa dud 'gro spangs pa la yang gsod pa la sbom po'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi'i 'go ba las gzhan pa'i sprul pa dud 'gro spangs pa la yang gsod pa la sbom po'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that killing a magical creation that is not a human or an animal is a serious offense.

original: 'di ni dngos gzhi'i cho ga la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos gzhi'i cho ga la ltos pa'o //
translated: This is based on the rule of the main practice.

original: 'di las srog chags su gyur pa ma yin pa'i sprul pa la 'dir bkag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las srog chags su gyur pa ma yin pa'i sprul pa la 'dir bkag pa'o //
translated: Here, the prohibition is on killing a magical creation that is not a living being.

original: 'dir gzhung ni tshe dang ldan pa rnams mi ma yin pa shin tu chen po bsad kyang sbom por zad do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni tshe dang ldan pa rnams mi ma yin pa shin tu chen po bsad kyang sbom por zad do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text says, “Venerables, even killing a very large nonhuman is only a serious offense.”

original: sprul pa'i phyir gzhung ni gtam gyi gzhi las /
analyzed: sprul pa'i phyir gzhung ni gtam gyi gzhi las /
translated: Because of emanation, the treatise declares:

original: 'gro ba thams cad du ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad du ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “What is not included in all the destinies?”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not nirvana.

original: rgyal ba'i bstan pa la mi 'jug pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i bstan pa la mi 'jug pa yang yin no //
translated: It is not the non-entry to the Conqueror’s teaching.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not complete nirvana.

original: des de la smras pa /
analyzed: des de la smras pa /
translated: He said to him:

original: khyod ni sprul pa ste srog bcad na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: khyod ni sprul pa ste srog bcad na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “You are an emanation. What is the offense if one kills you?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: nyes pa sbom por ro //🔽gzhan las ni ro langs kyi bsam pas @100a * //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por ro // gzhan las ni ro langs kyi bsam pas @100a * //
translated: “It is a serious transgression.”🔽In another text it says:

original: sprul pa gsod par byed na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sprul pa gsod par byed na zhes gsungs so //
translated: “If one kills an emanation with the thought of a zombie, it is a serious transgression.”

original: gzhan du yang de dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir 'di rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gzhan du yang de dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir 'di rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This is also established because it is similar to that.

analyzed: de ltar ltung ba rtogs par bya'o //

analyzed: dri bar byas pa la ma smras par nad pa la sman sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gso ba la mkhas pas changs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i nad g-yog bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i tshig gis gso bar bya ba la mkhas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir
translated: One should not give medicine to the sick without their consent means that one who is skilled in healing should be a Dharma companion who cares for the sick, as stated in the line One should give medicine to the sick. Since one who is not skilled in healing is not that,

translated: The meaning is that it

translated: If he is not able to go to the monastery together, and it is not the time for food or drink, then the bowl should be washed, the robe should be put away, and the alms-food should be received and examined.🔽 The phrase if he is not able to go to the monastery together means

analyzed: su phyin par mi nus la zan dang skom gyi dus su ma yin na lhung bzed bkru ba dang byug ris gzhag pa dang byin len dang brtag par bya'o //
translated: if he is not able to go to the monastery together with his companion, and it is not the time for food or drink, then the bowl should be washed, the robe should be put away, the alms-food should be received and examined.

original: gal te dus su na khyer te bsu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni ci ste dus la yang zas dang btung ba dag la phyin par nus pa med na de'i phyir khyer te bsu bar byas te zan dang skom de blangs nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te dus su na khyer te bsu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni ci ste dus la yang zas dang btung ba dag la phyin par nus pa med na de'i phyir khyer te bsu bar byas te zan dang skom de blangs nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is not the right time, but one is able to go to the food and drink, then one should take it and go to meet him.

analyzed: 'dir ltung bas ni phyi dro bzung ngo zhes bya ba shugs kyis go bar bya'o // pham par 'gyur ba gsum pa'i rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: Here, the downfall is accrued by the end of the afternoon.

original: // / mi'i 'gro ba pa'i lag pa gcod pa ni spom po'o //
analyzed: // / mi'i 'gro ba pa'i lag pa gcod pa ni spom po'o //
translated: The third downfall is to cut off the hand of a human being.

original: nags mes gtong na'o zhes bya ba ni de las srog chags gsad par ma bsams kyang spyir srog chags mang po yod pa'i blos 'di ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: nags mes gtong na'o zhes bya ba ni de las srog chags gsad par ma bsams kyang spyir srog chags mang po yod pa'i blos 'di ni sbom po'o //
translated: If one sets fire to a forest, even if one does not intend to kill the animals there, this is a serious offense, because one has the general idea that many animals are there.

analyzed: srog chags nyung ngu'i blos ni 'di nyes byas su rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: If one has the idea that there are few animals there, it is considered to be a minor offense.

original: med par nges pa @101b la ltung ba med do /
analyzed: med par nges pa @101b la ltung ba med do /
translated: There is no downfall if there are no animals there.

original: srog chags rnams la ma ltos par mnyam par spyod pa nyid kyi phyir 'dir 'di rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags rnams la ma ltos par mnyam par spyod pa nyid kyi phyir 'dir 'di rnam par shes pa'o //

original: sbyor ba thob pa'i phyir 'di ma smos so //
analyzed: sbyor ba thob pa'i phyir 'di ma smos so //
translated: It is not mentioned here because it is obtained through practice.

original: 'dir dngos gzhi rnams la mtshan nyid ji lta bar rtogs par bya ba nyid de gnod pa med pa'i phyir srog gcod pa ni nags la mes gtong du 'jug pa la med pa la nges pa yod par 'gyur ba la mi skyed do //

translated: Here, the actual basis is to be understood according to its characteristics, because it is not damaged. For example, killing is not killing by setting fire to a forest, but it is killing by causing the definite death of those who are not dead.

analyzed: yod pa'i blo la nyes byas tsam por 'gyur ba la yang ji tsam du nyes byas 'dir rigs su gyur pa gang yin pa rnams la spyi'am bye brag gcig tu ma zad kyi de rnams shi ba la de'i rigs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rjes la na smad par
translated: For those who have the idea that they exist, it is only a minor offense. Even for those who are of the same type, it is not only a general or specific offense, but also an offense that arises after the completion of the type of death.

original: gyur ba'i ltung ba de tsam dag la skyed pa'o //
analyzed: gyur ba'i ltung ba de tsam dag la skyed pa'o //
translated: In that case, it is generated for those who have that much of a downfall that is to be confessed.

analyzed: gal te mi'i 'gro ba pa rnams la nyes pa yod na ni sbom po'o //

translated: If consciousness is present in humans, then animals would exist here. And that is said to be like deer. For humans, it is a serious offense. For others, it is a wrong action.

original: sbom po ni zhes bya ba'i tshig dang por smos pa ni dbang du bya ba bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sbom po ni zhes bya ba'i tshig dang por smos pa ni dbang du bya ba bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The first mention of the word gross is for the purpose of teaching the basis.

original: gal te nad pa na re bdag la khrus dang bskyod pa la sogs pa cung zad byed na gdon mi za bar kho bo 'chi bar 'ong zhes de skad zer pa la yid ma ches shing de gzhan nyid du khrus la sogs sgrub par byed na sbom po'o

translated: If a sick person says, If you do not perform some minor act for me, such as bathing and massaging me, I will certainly die, but you do not believe this and act accordingly, this is a gross transgression.

original: // nges par 'dir ltung bar 'gyur ba la yang rtsub pas nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ltung ba 'di'o //
analyzed: // nges par 'dir ltung bar 'gyur ba la yang rtsub pas nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ltung ba 'di'o //
translated: This downfall is called rough because it is certain to cause one to fall here.

original: nad pa shi bla'o zhes g-yog mi byed na'o zhes bya ba ni sbom po zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: nad pa shi bla'o zhes g-yog mi byed na'o zhes bya ba ni sbom po zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: If one does not nurse a sick person, saying, Let the sick person die, this is called gross.

original: med par bya ba mi 'phrod pa sbyin na'o zhes bya ba ni nad pa la zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel lo //
analyzed: med par bya ba mi 'phrod pa sbyin na'o zhes bya ba ni nad pa la zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel lo //
translated: If one gives unsuitable food to a sick person, this is called rough.🔽 Here, too, if one does not nurse a sick person because one does not believe in the ripening of karma, then one's roughness is certain to cause one to fall.

original: 'dir yang yid ma ches pa'i phyir shes par gyur pa na rtsub pa nyid la nye bar gnas pa'o //🔽'dir 'chad par 'gyur ba la yang sbom po'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang yid ma ches pa'i phyir shes par gyur pa na rtsub pa nyid la nye bar gnas pa'o // 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ba la yang sbom po'o //
translated: Here, too, if one does not nurse a sick person because one is angry, then one's grossness is certain to cause one to fall.

original: 'bras yongs su ma smin pa brtol na'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang nges par rtsub pa nyid nyes bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ltung ba 'di'o //
analyzed: 'bras yongs su ma smin pa brtol na'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang nges par rtsub pa nyid nyes bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ltung ba 'di'o //
translated: If one breaks open a fruit that has not fully ripened, this downfall is called rough because it is certain to cause one to fall.

original: dong du 'jug pa dang sgo glegs kyis btsir ba la sogs pas nyon mongs par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dong du 'jug pa dang sgo glegs kyis btsir ba la sogs pas nyon mongs par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one torments a person by throwing him into a pit, crushing him with a door, and so on, this is called gross.

original: 'di ni gsad pa'i sbyor ba'i rnam pa ste de bas na 'dir sbom po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsad pa'i sbyor ba'i rnam pa ste de bas na 'dir sbom po'o //
translated: This is the form of the performance of killing, and therefore it is a grave sin here.

original: g-yang sa nas mchong ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa la 'chi ba'i don du bsgrub pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgras ni sbom po'o zhes bya ba de'i rjes su bsnyag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yang sa nas mchong ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa la 'chi ba'i don du bsgrub pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgras ni sbom po'o zhes bya ba de'i rjes su bsnyag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, jumping from a cliff, and so on, for the sake of dying, is a grave sin. The word “also” in the verse is for the purpose of including the grave sin.

original: 'dir gzhan shi ba yod par gyur pa la pham pa ste med par gyur na sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir sbom po 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan shi ba yod par gyur pa la pham pa ste med par gyur na sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir sbom po 'grub pa'o //
translated: Here, if the other person dies, there is a defeat; if he does not die, there is only the performance, and so a grave sin is established.

original: de bas na bdag nyid gsad pa la g-yang sa der btang ba la sogs pa la bzung bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid gsad pa la g-yang sa der btang ba la sogs pa la bzung bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that in the case of one’s own death, one is to be taken to the cliff and so on.

original: 'dir bdag nyid gsod pa la sbom po ste /
analyzed: 'dir bdag nyid gsod pa la sbom po ste /
translated: Here, in the case of one’s own death, there is a grave sin.

original: de bas na 'di @103a * //🔽shi ba la brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di @103a * // shi ba la brjod do //
translated: Therefore, this is not a defeat.🔽Therefore, it is said to be a grave sin.

original: da bas na med par gyur pa la zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: da bas na med par gyur pa la zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that it is in the case of one’s own death.

original: nad pa la bab col du mtshon dang thag pa sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nad g-yog la shi ba'i yo byad ma yin na zhes bya ba brjod zin to //
analyzed: nad pa la bab col du mtshon dang thag pa sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nad g-yog la shi ba'i yo byad ma yin na zhes bya ba brjod zin to //
translated: One should not give a weapon or a rope to a sick person thoughtlessly.🔽The meaning of not being a nurse has already been explained.

original: nad g-yog ma yin pa'i don du ni rtsom pa 'di'i bab col du zhas bya ba'i tshig gis shi ba la ma yin pa'i yo byad nyid shes nas bya ba gzhan gyi don du sbyin par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nad g-yog ma yin pa'i don du ni rtsom pa 'di'i bab col du zhas bya ba'i tshig gis shi ba la ma yin pa'i yo byad nyid shes nas bya ba gzhan gyi don du sbyin par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the word thoughtless in this composition is that, knowing that it is not an implement for death, one should give it for another purpose.

analyzed: 'dir ni mtshon dang thag pa'i tshig ni dpe yin te khab la sogs pa rnams kyang bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Here, the words weapon and rope are examples, and needles, etc., are included.

original: zhal ta bas shes bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: zhal ta bas shes bzhin du bya'o //
translated: One should do it knowingly.

original: gsang sngags kyi thal lcag bya ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni shes bzhin dang zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi thal lcag bya ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni shes bzhin dang zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
translated: One should also give a magical spell and a slap, one should connect with the word knowingly.

original: shes bzhin du zhes byas pas gdon gyis zin pa thar bar bya'i gsang sngags sngon du 'gro bas gdong du thal lcag gis bsnun pa ni thal lcag bsnun pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes byas pas gdon gyis zin pa thar bar bya'i gsang sngags sngon du 'gro bas gdong du thal lcag gis bsnun pa ni thal lcag bsnun pa'o //
