analyzed: ya yig bha yig gi rang bzhin gyi sgra med par de la sbyor ba med pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the term “application” is

original: ma smras pa la dngos gzhi byas pa'i sgra la de dang 'brel pa med pa nyid kyi phyir smra ba 'di la sbyor ba ma yin pa nyid gang zhig 'dod pa de 'dod pa bzlog pa'i don du mdo 'di byas te /
analyzed: ma smras pa la dngos gzhi byas pa'i sgra la de dang 'brel pa med pa nyid kyi phyir smra ba 'di la sbyor ba ma yin pa nyid gang zhig 'dod pa de 'dod pa bzlog pa'i don du mdo 'di byas te /
translated: Because the word that is the basis of the statement is not related to the word that is not stated, this statement is not applicable to the one who asserts that. This sutra is composed for the purpose of refuting that assertion.

original: rgya zhes bya ba dang rna ru zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra brjod pa la ni sbyor ba nyid the tshom med pa'o //
analyzed: rgya zhes bya ba dang rna ru zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra brjod pa la ni sbyor ba nyid the tshom med pa'o //
translated: There is no doubt that the statement of words such as gya and rna ru is itself applicable.

original: bsngags pa dang bsngags pa ma yin pa dang / gsol ba dang nye bar gsol ba dang / 'dri ba dang nye bar 'dri ba dang / brjod pa dang smon pa dang gshe ba dang / phyir smra ba bsgrub pa bdag la ni bye brag med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyis smon pa thams cad nyid rnams la dngos gzhi'i byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: bsngags pa dang bsngags pa ma yin pa dang / gsol ba dang nye bar gsol ba dang / 'dri ba dang nye bar 'dri ba dang / brjod pa dang smon pa dang gshe ba dang / phyir smra ba bsgrub pa bdag la ni bye brag med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyis smon pa thams cad nyid rnams la dngos gzhi'i byed pa nyid de /
translated: Praise and blame, request and entreaty, question and inquiry, expression and aspiration, scolding and counter-argument - for me there is no distinction at all. This means that for all aspirations that have the nature of praise and so forth, there is the nature of the basis.

original: bye brag cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bye brag cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is not even the slightest distinction.

original: de la bsngags pa zhes bya ba ni sru'i rma'i sgo gsum rnams legs par dod pa yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la bsngags pa zhes bya ba ni sru'i rma'i sgo gsum rnams legs par dod pa yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Praise means to praise the three doors of the aunt, saying, Are they well developed?

original: / bsngags pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni de las bzlog par smod pa'o //
analyzed: / bsngags pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni de las bzlog par smod pa'o //
translated: Blame means to criticize the opposite of that.

original: gsol ba zhes bya ba ni sru tshur shog de dang de bya'o zhes brjod cing /
analyzed: gsol ba zhes bya ba ni sru tshur shog de dang de bya'o zhes brjod cing /
translated: Request means to say, Come here, aunt, do this and that.

original: rgya zhes bya ba dang rna ru zhes bya ba gnyis kyis brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgya zhes bya ba dang rna ru zhes bya ba gnyis kyis brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The two expressions gyah and ru-ru are used.

original: nye bar gsol ba zhes bya ba ni sru bud med dam skyes pa gang la la 'di dang 'di byed de ;
analyzed: nye bar gsol ba zhes bya ba ni sru bud med dam skyes pa gang la la 'di dang 'di byed de ;
translated: Approaching request means to say, Aunt, do this and that for any woman or man.

original: de la dga' ba dang yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dga' ba dang yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That will bring you joy and pleasure.

original: sru yang bdag cag la de dang de byed do //
analyzed: sru yang bdag cag la de dang de byed do //
translated: Aunt, do this and that for us too.

original: sru yang bdag cag la dga' ba dang yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dga' ba nye bar bsgrub pas 'dun pa skyed pa ste /
analyzed: sru yang bdag cag la dga' ba dang yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dga' ba nye bar bsgrub pas 'dun pa skyed pa ste /
translated: Aunt, that will bring us joy and pleasure.

original: 'di ni dga' ba nye bar bsgrub pa /
analyzed: 'di ni dga' ba nye bar bsgrub pa /
translated: This is the establishment of joy.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the request.

original: 'dri ba zhes bya ba ni @117b sru skyes pa gang dang bud med gang de dang de byed pa de ni dga' ba dang yid du 'ong bar 'gyur na kho bos kyang kyang sru la de dang de byas na sru kho bo la dga' ba dang yid du
analyzed: 'dri ba zhes bya ba ni @117b sru skyes pa gang dang bud med gang de dang de byed pa de ni dga' ba dang yid du 'ong bar 'gyur na kho bos kyang kyang sru la de dang de byas na sru kho bo la dga' ba dang yid du
translated: “Question” means that whatever a man or woman does for a relative, it becomes pleasing and agreeable. If I do this and that for my aunt, she will be pleased and agreeable with me.🔽

original: 'ong bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'ong bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri ba'o //
translated: The term question refers to the question, If a man or woman does this or that to you, will you love and enjoy it? I will do this or that to you, aunt, will you love and enjoy it?

original: nye bar 'dri ba zhes bya ni sru'i rma'i sgo gsum po rnams legs par 'dod pa dang / legs par gnas pa dang / legs par gyur pa bden nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'dri ba zhes bya ni sru'i rma'i sgo gsum po rnams legs par 'dod pa dang / legs par gnas pa dang / legs par gyur pa bden nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su 'dri ba'o //
translated: The term inquiry refers to the inquiry, Is it true that your three wounds are well-formed, well-placed, and well-developed?

original: brjod pa zhes bya ba ni kho bo ni khyod la dga' ba dang yid du 'ong ba bden na khyod de la ji ltar zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa zhes bya ba ni kho bo ni khyod la dga' ba dang yid du 'ong ba bden na khyod de la ji ltar zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: The term statement refers to the statement, It is true that I love and enjoy you, but how is it for you?

original: smon pa zhes bya ba ni srun ma zhig na kho bo khyod dang lhan cig de dang de ltar byed zhig gu snyam du smos pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa zhes bya ba ni srun ma zhig na kho bo khyod dang lhan cig de dang de ltar byed zhig gu snyam du smos pa'o //
translated: The term wish refers to the wish, If only I could do this or that with you, aunt.

original: gshe ba zhes bya ba ni khyod la bong bu rnams gang de ltar byed par gyur cig pa'i blos 'dir mi ltung zhes gshe ba'o //
analyzed: gshe ba zhes bya ba ni khyod la bong bu rnams gang de ltar byed par gyur cig pa'i blos 'dir mi ltung zhes gshe ba'o //
translated: The term scolding means that a monk says to a woman, May you be struck by donkeys! with the thought that she is not falling into this.

original: phyir smra ba zhes bya ba ni bud med kyis brjod pa'i bsngags pa la sogs pa la dge slong gis phyir rnam pa de rnams kyis slar lan 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir smra ba zhes bya ba ni bud med kyis brjod pa'i bsngags pa la sogs pa la dge slong gis phyir rnam pa de rnams kyis slar lan 'debs pa'o //
translated: The term responding in kind means that a monk responds to a woman's praise and so on with the same kind of words.

original: don gzhan la bsams pas ljongs kyi nges pa'i tshig gi dbang gis na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni mi mdzes pa zhes bya ba bsams par gyur pa la ltung ba'i blos 'dir mi ltung ba'o zhes bya ba de'i zlog pa'i don du mdo 'di🔽dang 'og ma'o //
analyzed: don gzhan la bsams pas ljongs kyi nges pa'i tshig gi dbang gis na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni mi mdzes pa zhes bya ba bsams par gyur pa la ltung ba'i blos 'dir mi ltung ba'o zhes bya ba de'i zlog pa'i don du mdo 'di dang 'og ma'o //
translated: The term without thinking of another meaning means that there is no offense if a monk does not understand the meaning of the words he speaks. The term without thinking of another meaning is stated in this sūtra and in the following sūtra in order to reverse the idea that there is no offense if one speaks with a different meaning in mind, due to the power of the local language and its definitions.🔽If a monk speaks with a different meaning in mind, due to the power of the local language and its definitions, then there is no offense.

original: ci ste don gzhan la bsams pa zhes bya ba ljongs kyi tshig 'di'i nges pa'i tshig gi dbang gis don gzhan gyi bsam pas 'khrig pa smras pa gang yin pa de la ni ltung ba med de /
analyzed: ci ste don gzhan la bsams pa zhes bya ba ljongs kyi tshig 'di'i nges pa'i tshig gi dbang gis don gzhan gyi bsam pas 'khrig pa smras pa gang yin pa de la ni ltung ba med de /
translated: If a monk speaks with a different meaning in mind, due to the power of the local language and its definitions, then there is no offense.

original: gang zhig rung ba tsam gyis gzhan la bsam par byed pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rung ba tsam gyis gzhan la bsam par byed pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not that one should think of another by any means.

original: ming gi cha nyid 'dra ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ming gi cha nyid 'dra ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, in the case of a similarity of part of the name.

original: cha nyid 'dra ba gang zhig gi dbang gis 'khrig pa smras pa gang yin pa ste 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: cha nyid 'dra ba gang zhig gi dbang gis 'khrig pa smras pa gang yin pa ste 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: In the case of a similarity of part, by virtue of which one speaks of sexual intercourse, for example,

original: rgya gar skad du nas la ni ya ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du nas la ni ya ba zhes bya ba /
translated: in the Indian language, the word for barley is yava,🔽and the word for sexual intercourse is yava.🔽When one utters the word yava with the intention of saying barley, by the power of the utterance, there is no offense in saying bhava in place of bhavanti.

original: 'khrig pa la ni ya bha zhes bya ba de la nas kyi ming ya ba zhes brjod pa'i bsam pas drag tu brjod pa'i dbang gis ba zhes bya ba'i gnas su bha zhes brjod ba la ltung ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khrig pa la ni ya bha zhes bya ba de la nas kyi ming ya ba zhes brjod pa'i bsam pas drag tu brjod pa'i dbang gis ba zhes bya ba'i gnas su bha zhes brjod ba la ltung ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma gsum pa'i rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma gsum pa'i rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: This is the analysis of the third remaining in the Saṅgha.

original: // / mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: // / mdzes pa yin no //
translated: It is beautiful.

original: sdig can yin no //
analyzed: sdig can yin no //
translated: It is sinful.

original: rma'i sko mdzes pa 'am sdig can yin no //
analyzed: rma'i sko mdzes pa 'am sdig can yin no //
translated: It is a beautiful or sinful wound.

original: bgo bsha' gyis shig kho bo la bgo bsha' gyis shig / kho bo dang lhan cig nyol cig / phrad par gyis shig ces smras na sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir khyod ni sdig pu can @118a * //
analyzed: bgo bsha' gyis shig kho bo la bgo bsha' gyis shig / kho bo dang lhan cig nyol cig / phrad par gyis shig ces smras na sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir khyod ni sdig pu can @118a * //
translated: If one says, Give me a share, give me a share! Sleep with me! Have intercourse with me! it is a grave offense.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyi sgra brjod pa dang so sor mngon par 'brel lo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyi sgra brjod pa dang so sor mngon par 'brel lo //
translated: Here, the words You are sinful! and so on are expressed and individually connected.

original: gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i sems kyis gnas ngan len gyi tshig brjod pa la sbom po'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i sems kyis gnas ngan len gyi tshig brjod pa la sbom po'o //
translated: If one says the words of depravity with a mind that has depravity, it is a grave offense.

original: rnam pa gang yin sbyar bar gyur pa de'i rnam pa'i gnas ngan len gyis tha na rgod bag tsam gyis smras na yang thams cad du sbom por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gang yin sbyar bar gyur pa de'i rnam pa'i gnas ngan len gyis tha na rgod bag tsam gyis smras na yang thams cad du sbom por rig par bya'o //
translated: Whatever form is applied, by the depravity of that form, even if one speaks with just a little frivolity, it should be understood as always being a grave offense.

original: kun du chags par gyur pas ni ma yin te de yang mthu yod pa can la'o //
analyzed: kun du chags par gyur pas ni ma yin te de yang mthu yod pa can la'o //
translated: It is not due to being completely attached, and that also applies to those who have the ability.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma gsum pa'i zhu ba'i skabs so /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma gsum pa'i zhu ba'i skabs so /
translated: This is the chapter on the request for the third remaining in the Saṅgha.

original: // / de bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i chos can mo la smra na'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / de bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i chos can mo la smra na'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: So too, if one speaks to a woman who has the nature of magical transformation, it is a serious offense.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sbom po'o zhes sngar bstan pa'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sbom po'o zhes sngar bstan pa'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “so too” is used to indicate that the rest of the passage is to be understood in the same way as the previous passage on serious offenses.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul ba'i chos gang la yod pa de ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul ba'i chos gang la yod pa de ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i chos can no //
translated: One who has the nature of magical transformation is one who has the nature of magical transformation.

original: de'i gnas ngan len can smras na ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas ngan len can smras na ni sbom po'o //
translated: If one speaks to a woman who has the nature of magical transformation, it is a serious offense.

original: 'dir sems ni 'jigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir sems ni 'jigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the mind is frightened

original: mngon por zhen pa dman pas rab tu 'gro ba mi srid pa'i phyir dang / mthu mthong ba'i phyir dang // de bas na 'dir na smad pa'o //
analyzed: mngon por zhen pa dman pas rab tu 'gro ba mi srid pa'i phyir dang / mthu mthong ba'i phyir dang // de bas na 'dir na smad pa'o //
translated: because it is impossible for one of low attachment to go to a place of higher attachment, and because one sees the power of the offense. Therefore, it is a serious offense.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'dis thams cad kyi dbang du bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'dis thams cad kyi dbang du bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: So too means that all of this should be understood as in the previous passage on serious offenses.

original: sru kho bo la nas byin cig / sru khyod la ci mthong ba de byin cig / sru khyod kyi mdun na mo gang yin pa de byin cig / sru khyod kyi yid du 'ong ba gang yin pa de byin cig / khyod la ci dga' ba byin
analyzed: sru kho bo la nas byin cig / sru khyod la ci mthong ba de byin cig / sru khyod kyi mdun na mo gang yin pa de byin cig / sru khyod kyi yid du 'ong ba gang yin pa de byin cig / khyod la ci dga' ba byin
translated: Sister, give me what you like. 🔽 What do you like?🔽Sister, I like you. 🔽Sister, give me water, food, soup, and something to eat. 🔽You are all of those. 🔽 What do you like?🔽Sister, I like you.

original: brtsam du rung ba nyid dang / brtan pa nyid ces bya ba las 'da' bar byed pa la tshad las lhag par byed na mthar ni dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtsam du rung ba nyid dang / brtan pa nyid ces bya ba las 'da' bar byed pa la tshad las lhag par byed na mthar ni dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one exceeds the measure in the act of transgressing that which is suitable to undertake and that which is stable, then in the end it is a partial defeat of the Saṅgha.

original: sngar ni sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar ni sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Previously, it is a serious violation.

original: yan lag bzhi po ma tshang ba sgrub pa 'da' bar byed pa tshad kyi mthar ni sbom por 'gyur la /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi po ma tshang ba sgrub pa 'da' bar byed pa tshad kyi mthar ni sbom por 'gyur la /
translated: If one establishes the act of transgressing without four branches, then in the end it is a serious violation.

original: sngar ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Previously, it is a minor offense.

original: 'da' bar mi byed pa la yang tshang ba dang ma tshang ba'i yan lag bzhi po ma bsgrubs pa la mthar ni spom po ste /
analyzed: 'da' bar mi byed pa la yang tshang ba dang ma tshang ba'i yan lag bzhi po ma bsgrubs pa la mthar ni spom po ste /
translated: If one does not transgress, but does not establish the four branches, then in the end it is a serious violation.

original: sngar ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Previously, it is a minor offense.

original: ma blangs pa'i gzhi'i yo byad kyi tshad las 'da' bar byed pa la yan lag bzhi po ma bsgrubs pa la mthar ni spom po ste sngar ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma blangs pa'i gzhi'i yo byad kyi tshad las 'da' bar byed pa la yan lag bzhi po ma bsgrubs pa la mthar ni spom po ste sngar ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one exceeds the measure of the basis of not accepting goods, but does not establish the four branches, then in the end it is a serious violation.🔽Previously, it is a minor offense.

original: tshad las 'da' bar byed pa la yan lag bzhi po thams cad kyis ma bsgrubs pa la mthar ni nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshad las 'da' bar byed pa la yan lag bzhi po thams cad kyis ma bsgrubs pa la mthar ni nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If one exceeds the measure in the act of transgressing, but does not establish all four branches, then in the end it is a minor offense.

original: sngar yang nyes byas nyid do //
analyzed: sngar yang nyes byas nyid do //
translated: Previously, it was a wrong action.

original: tshad las 'da' bar mi byed pa yan lag bzhi po thams cad kyis ma bsgrubs pa la mthar ni nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshad las 'da' bar mi byed pa yan lag bzhi po thams cad kyis ma bsgrubs pa la mthar ni nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If one does not complete all four branches of not exceeding the proper size, then in the end it becomes a wrong action.

original: sngar yang nyes byas nyid do zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa 'di la'o //
analyzed: sngar yang nyes byas nyid do zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa 'di la'o //
translated: This is the presentation.

original: spyod lam bzhi po 'gro ba la sogs pa khang pa dang gtsug lag khang dag tshad las 'da' bar ma byas pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spyod lam bzhi po 'gro ba la sogs pa khang pa dang gtsug lag khang dag tshad las 'da' bar ma byas pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The four modes of conduct such as walking, etc., should be understood as not exceeding the proper size of houses and temples.

original: bskos pa nyid dang ma bskos pa nyid dag ni gtso bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gtso bo ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bskos pa nyid dang ma bskos pa nyid dag ni gtso bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gtso bo ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The terms appointed and not appointed are not primary.

original: bskos pa nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa nyid de /
analyzed: bskos pa nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa nyid de /
translated: The term appointed means being made to do by another.

original: de'i rnam pa nyid bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa nyid bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: That is the accomplishment of its aspect.

original: gang gi rnam par rang gi 'dod pas zhes bya ba 'di la 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi rnam par rang gi 'dod pas zhes bya ba 'di la 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught here: “By the aspect of one’s own desire.”

original: 'dir 'dod pa dang 'brel pa'i ltung ba bsgrub pa la rgyu nyid kyi phyir bskos pa'i rgyu la 'dod pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ma chog pa med pas gang gis 'dra ba nyid mi 'dod pa de'i 'dod pa zlog pa'i don du mdo 'di'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod pa dang 'brel pa'i ltung ba bsgrub pa la rgyu nyid kyi phyir bskos pa'i rgyu la 'dod pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ma chog pa med pas gang gis 'dra ba nyid mi 'dod pa de'i 'dod pa zlog pa'i don du mdo 'di'o //
translated: Here, the cause of establishing a downfall related to desire is the cause of the appointment, but since there is no connection with desire, there is no insufficiency. Therefore, this sutra is for the purpose of countering the assertion of those who do not accept similarity.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir 'dir ltung ba'am 'dra ba nyid bsgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir ltung ba'am 'dra ba nyid bsgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: Because here it is not establishing a downfall or similarity.

original: 'dir 'dod pa 'di la bsgrub par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod pa 'di la bsgrub par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, it is established in this desire.

original: de bas na dge slong rjes su gnang ba nyid la dngos gzhi grub pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na dge slong rjes su gnang ba nyid la dngos gzhi grub pa ste /
translated: Therefore, for a monk who is permitted, the actual basis is established,

original: @126b mngon par rjes su ma gnang ba nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @126b mngon par rjes su ma gnang ba nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for one who is not permitted.

original: bskos pa ni rang nyid dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la bskos pas byas pa ni sko bar byed pa rang nyid kyis byas pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bskos pa ni rang nyid dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la bskos pas byas pa ni sko bar byed pa rang nyid kyis byas pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The appointed one is like oneself. The appointed one's action is like that done by the one who appoints himself.

original: ji ltar bdag nyid kyis khang pa dang gtsug lag khang dag log pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa kha na ma tho bar gyur pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag nyid kyis khang pa dang gtsug lag khang dag log pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa kha na ma tho bar gyur pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as one would incur an offense by oneself building a house or temple in the wrong place,

original: bskos pas log pa nyid du sgrub par byed na yang sgo bar byed pa nyid la kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la 'di byed pa'o //
analyzed: bskos pas log pa nyid du sgrub par byed na yang sgo bar byed pa nyid la kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la 'di byed pa'o //
translated: so too, if one causes another to build in the wrong place, one incurs the offense of ordering it to be built.

original: gang gi tshe gnas par gyur na bskos bzhin pas sgo ba pos bsgrub pa la bskos pa de ni 'dir rgyur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnas par gyur na bskos bzhin pas sgo ba pos bsgrub pa la bskos pa de ni 'dir rgyur rig par bya'o //
translated: But if one is living in a place that has been designated, then the one who has been designated to build should be understood as the cause of the offense.

original: ji skad bsgo ba bzhin mi byed pa la lus dang ngag gis nod na'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bsgo ba bzhin mi byed pa bsgo ba byas pa 'am byed du bcug pa de la ji skad bsgo ba'i rgyu de la lus sam ngag gis nod na
analyzed: ji skad bsgo ba bzhin mi byed pa la lus dang ngag gis nod na'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bsgo ba bzhin mi byed pa bsgo ba byas pa 'am byed du bcug pa de la ji skad bsgo ba'i rgyu de la lus sam ngag gis nod na
translated: One accepts by body or speech that which is not to be done as ordered means that one accepts by body or speech that which is not to be done as ordered, whether one does it oneself or causes another to do it.

original: rang nyid de mi nod pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid de mi nod pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: One does not accept it oneself.

original: yid kyis nod pa la yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid kyis nod pa la yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One does not accept it mentally.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gal te de la 'di skad ces legs par byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gal te de la 'di skad ces legs par byas so //
translated: If someone says, “This is well done,

original: shin tu byas so ngas khyod la 'di ltar bsko'o zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: shin tu byas so ngas khyod la 'di ltar bsko'o zhes zer zhing /
translated: this is very well done. I will give you this,”

original: des de la shing ngam rtsva 'am lci ba 'am sa 'jim rnams 'bul bar byed de /
analyzed: des de la shing ngam rtsva 'am lci ba 'am sa 'jim rnams 'bul bar byed de /
translated: and then offers wood, grass, cow dung, or clay,

analyzed: gang mi rung ba byed du 'jug na gnyis ka la yang gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du ltung bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: then both the one who does the improper act and the one who makes the offer will incur an offense according to the value of the object.🔽The act is the same, but the value is different.

analyzed: byas pa ni gcig nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dir byed pa thams cad rjes su bsgrub pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid de /
translated: The act is the same in that all the acts are completed.🔽The value is different in that the value of the act is determined by the value of the object, such as a cow, and so on.

original: lo la sogs pa'i tshad kyang sdod pa la gzhan la mi ltos pas ma btang ba ni 'dir sdod cing byas pa ltung ba mang ba nyid med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lo la sogs pa'i tshad kyang sdod pa la gzhan la mi ltos pas ma btang ba ni 'dir sdod cing byas pa ltung ba mang ba nyid med ces bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: mi ltos pas btang ba ni dum bu la so so nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: The act is the same in that all the acts are completed.🔽The value is different in that the value of the act is determined by the value of the object, such as a cow, and so on.🔽The value of the act is not determined by the value of the object, such as a cow, and so on.

original: de ltar na mi ltos pas btang ba la sngar gyi cha tsam ltung ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na mi ltos pas btang ba la sngar gyi cha tsam ltung ba ste /
translated: Thus, if one abandons the precepts without depending on the precepts, one falls from the part of the former.

analyzed: mi ltos pas bar du ye btang ba la gang zhig phyis yang rtsom par byung ba la yang phyi ma'i cha la'o //

analyzed: dper na 'thabs pa'i mod la dang 'thabs pa'i 'og tu sdum byed pa la sogs pa'i tshig dag la ltung ba tha dad par byas @127a * //

original: pa bzhin du ci'i phyir 'dir yang rung ba nyid ma yin pa dang / rtsod pa dang bcas pa nyid dang rnam par gnon pa nyid ma yin pa dang / ma bstan pa nyid rnams la zhes bya ba 'dod pa 'di la ltung ba'o snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pa bzhin du ci'i phyir 'dir yang rung ba nyid ma yin pa dang / rtsod pa dang bcas pa nyid dang rnam par gnon pa nyid ma yin pa dang / ma bstan pa nyid rnams la zhes bya ba 'dod pa 'di la ltung ba'o snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: To dispel the doubt that this is a downfall in this vow, he says,

original: yan lag rnams ni byed pa po tha dad pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yan lag rnams ni byed pa po tha dad pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The limbs are not different agents.

original: thob pa la sgrib par byed par 'gyur ba nyid ni de'i 'og tu sdum byed pa la sogs pa rnams la ste /
analyzed: thob pa la sgrib par byed par 'gyur ba nyid ni de'i 'og tu sdum byed pa la sogs pa rnams la ste /
translated: The obscuration to attainment is for those who are engaged in the subsequent activities of reconciliation and so on.

original: de bas na 'di rnams las tha dad pa 'di la bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di rnams las tha dad pa 'di la bskyed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is generated from these.

original: 'dir ni khyim byed par 'dod pa la 'brel pa'i dbang nyid ltung ba bsgrub pa la 'di gsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni khyim byed par 'dod pa la 'brel pa'i dbang nyid ltung ba bsgrub pa la 'di gsal bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the desire to make a household is established as a downfall by the power of the connection, and this is clarified.

original: 'di'i yan lag 'da' bar byed pa gang yin pa ni shin tu khyab pa nyid du gyur pa 'di la gang zhig srog chags rnams la gnod par byed pa'i dogs pa mngon par rjes su gnang ba rnams la ma ltos pa byed pa dang / brtsam du mi rung ba nyid ces bya ba 'da' bar gyur pa'i yan lag rnams 'dir dgos pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di'i yan lag 'da' bar byed pa gang yin pa ni shin tu khyab pa nyid du gyur pa 'di la gang zhig srog chags rnams la gnod par byed pa'i dogs pa mngon par rjes su gnang ba rnams la ma ltos pa byed pa dang / brtsam du mi rung ba nyid ces bya ba 'da' bar gyur pa'i yan lag rnams 'dir dgos pa'o ;
translated: Here, the transgression of any of its branches is a very extensive transgression. It is not necessary to rely on the permission to harm living beings, and it is not right to do it. The transgression of the branches is necessary here.

original: / de bas na rab tu 'byed pa po 'di rnams dang mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: / de bas na rab tu 'byed pa po 'di rnams dang mi sbyor ro //
translated: Therefore, these are not combined with the analysis.

original: 'dir yan lag rnams ji tsam 'da' bar byed pa ltung ba rnam de tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yan lag rnams ji tsam 'da' bar byed pa ltung ba rnam de tsam ma yin te /
translated: Here, the transgression of any of the branches is not a downfall.

original: 'on kyang ltung ba gcig kho nar zad de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang ltung ba gcig kho nar zad de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, it is said that it is just one downfall.

original: gang la khang pa'i dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang la khang pa'i dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If asked, for whom is it a remainder of the Sangha in the house?

original: de'i phyir btsal ba la'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir btsal ba la'o //
translated: Therefore, it is for the one who seeks.

original: des rjes su gnang ba la'o //
analyzed: des rjes su gnang ba la'o //
translated: It is for the one who is permitted by him.

original: rnam pa de lta bus so //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bus so //
translated: It is in that way.

original: gzhi ma dag la'o //
analyzed: gzhi ma dag la'o //
translated: It is for those who are not the basis.

original: ma bstan pa la'o //
analyzed: ma bstan pa la'o //
translated: It is for those who are not taught.

original: gnas byas sam byed du bcug na'o //
analyzed: gnas byas sam byed du bcug na'o //
translated: It is if one has made a dwelling or caused it to be made.

original: mthar ro zhes bya ba rnams smos te /
analyzed: mthar ro zhes bya ba rnams smos te /
translated: The term finally is stated.

original: 'dir gzhi zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sa gzhi brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir gzhi zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sa gzhi brjod do //
translated: Here, the term ground refers to the earth.

original: btsal ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par yongs su ma bzung bas chos 'di la rab tu byung ba las kyang zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: btsal ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par yongs su ma bzung bas chos 'di la rab tu byung ba las kyang zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Since a specific [ground] is not specified, it should be understood that in this Dharma and Vinaya refers to the monastic life.

original: sus btsal zhe na /
analyzed: sus btsal zhe na /
translated: Who searches?

original: de ni 'dir skabs yin pas ltung ba 'byin pa pos zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dir skabs yin pas ltung ba 'byin pa pos zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Since that is the context here, it should be understood that the one who causes the downfall is meant.

original: des rjes su gnang ba la'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang gis sa gzhi btsal bar gyur pas so //
analyzed: des rjes su gnang ba la'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang gis sa gzhi btsal bar gyur pas so //
translated: In that, the one who approves is the monk who searches for the ground.

original: rnam pa de lta bus so zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin pa pos btsal ba 'am btsal ba pos so //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bus so zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin pa pos btsal ba 'am btsal ba pos so //
translated: In that way means by the one who causes the downfall or by the one who searches.

original: de dge slong gis rten du gnang ba la sgrub par byed pa'i tshig 'di'o //
analyzed: de dge slong gis rten du gnang ba la sgrub par byed pa'i tshig 'di'o //
translated: That is the statement establishing the monk's approval as the basis.

original: de yang las la dgos par bya ba'i rdzas rnams dang 'di rnams kyi rin thang ngo //
analyzed: de yang las la dgos par bya ba'i rdzas rnams dang 'di rnams kyi rin thang ngo //
translated: And that is the substance to be used for the purpose of the action and the value of those [substances].

original: 'ga' zhig las ni gnyis ka dag la zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las ni gnyis ka dag la zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In some cases, it is stated as both.

original: nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa @127b las 'di skad ces ji tsam gyis na rang gis btsal ba'i khang pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa @127b las 'di skad ces ji tsam gyis na rang gis btsal ba'i khang pa zhes bgyi /
translated: “Upali, what is a house that one has searched?

original: gang las gnyis yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang las gnyis yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is a house in which two people can be found.

original: byed du bcug pa dang gzhi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byed du bcug pa dang gzhi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is a house in which one can be made to commit an action or in which the basis for an action can be found.

original: 'dir 'di ni btsal ba'i cha nyid la lung rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'di ni btsal ba'i cha nyid la lung rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, this is to be understood as a passage that explains the meaning of ‘to search.’

original: de nyid kyi gzhung yang 'di yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi gzhung yang 'di yin te /
translated: The text continues:

original: gang zag gi gzhir byed du 'jug na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag gi gzhir byed du 'jug na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one makes a person the basis for an action, one commits a serious offense.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo las kyang rang gis btsal ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo las kyang rang gis btsal ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Pratimok˝ha also says, “to search.”

original: gang gi phyir 'di gnyis ka don med pa ste gzhan du na gnyis ka skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di gnyis ka don med pa ste gzhan du na gnyis ka skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because both of these are meaningless, otherwise both would be produced.

original: gzhi ma dag pa la'o zhes bya ba ni mi rung ba nyid la sogs pa ni ma dag pa'o zhes 'og nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhi ma dag pa la'o zhes bya ba ni mi rung ba nyid la sogs pa ni ma dag pa'o zhes 'og nas 'byung ngo //
translated: “On an impure basis” means “on an improper basis,” as will be explained below.

original: ma bstan pa la'o gnas byas sam byed du bcug na'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma bstan pa la'o gnas byas sam byed du bcug na'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Without being taught” means “having made a dwelling or having made someone else do so.”

original: ma bstan pa la'o zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun las bstan pa thob pa ni bstan pa nyid do zhes bstan pa nyid kyang 'og nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma bstan pa la'o zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun las bstan pa thob pa ni bstan pa nyid do zhes bstan pa nyid kyang 'og nas 'byung ste /
translated: The phrase not taught refers to the teaching that one receives from the Saṅgha. The phrase taught is explained below.

original: de las bzlog pa ni ma bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni ma bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The opposite of that is not taught.

original: gnas byas sam byed du bcug na'o zhes bya ba ni khang pa byed du bcug na'o //
analyzed: gnas byas sam byed du bcug na'o zhes bya ba ni khang pa byed du bcug na'o //
translated: The phrase having used or having had it used means having had a house built.

original: mthar ro zhes bya ba ni zin nas te gnas kyi ngo bo nyid ni thog bkab cing bsgo ba ma gtogs pa kun nas bskor ba nyid do //
analyzed: mthar ro zhes bya ba ni zin nas te gnas kyi ngo bo nyid ni thog bkab cing bsgo ba ma gtogs pa kun nas bskor ba nyid do //
translated: The phrase at the end means when it is finished. The nature of a dwelling is to be completely surrounded, except for the roof and the door.

original: de zin pa'i skad cig ma la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de zin pa'i skad cig ma la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is finished in a moment.

original: sngar ni sbom por ro zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes kyi sde pa zhes bya ba ni mdo 'dis byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar ni sbom por ro zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes kyi sde pa zhes bya ba ni mdo 'dis byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase previously, it is a serious offense is the latter part of this verse. The word this should be understood to refer to the sūtra.

original: 'og ma la yang de dag nyid de ma btsal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang 'di nyes pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni skabs su bab pa de de ma thag pa'i gtsug lag khang gi rgyu bslab pa'i gzhi 'og ma la yang blta bar
analyzed: 'og ma la yang de dag nyid de ma btsal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang 'di nyes pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni skabs su bab pa de de ma thag pa'i gtsug lag khang gi rgyu bslab pa'i gzhi 'og ma la yang blta bar
translated: The same applies to the following, except for the search itself.

original: bya ste / de ni btsal ba nyid ma gtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bya ste / de ni btsal ba nyid ma gtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The search itself should be understood as the search for the site of the monastery, which is the subject at hand, in accordance with the following precept.

original: de la yang btsal ba nyid kyi don dang nges par grol ba'i cho ga 'di zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la yang btsal ba nyid kyi don dang nges par grol ba'i cho ga 'di zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the search itself is the meaning of the rite of definite release.

original: btsal ba nyid gsal ba la 'dir 'di skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btsal ba nyid gsal ba la 'dir 'di skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The search itself is clarified here: this is how it arises.

original: rang nyid kyis gnas pa 'am rjes su gnang ba'i gzhi la sgrub par byed pa gnas pa 'am rjes su gnang bas dag pa'i dngos po ma bstan pa'i gnas kyi rgyu'i mthar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis gnas pa 'am rjes su gnang ba'i gzhi la sgrub par byed pa gnas pa 'am rjes su gnang bas dag pa'i dngos po ma bstan pa'i gnas kyi rgyu'i mthar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Either one dwells in the site oneself or one establishes a resident or a permitted resident in the site, and one dwells in the purified thing by permission. The end of the cause of the site is not shown.

original: bdag po dang bcas pa zhes bya ba gtsug lag khang gi tshig 'dir gang yin pa phal che ba'i chos la 'di skye ba'i dbang gis smos pa ste de'i yan lag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag po dang bcas pa zhes bya ba gtsug lag khang gi tshig 'dir gang yin pa phal che ba'i chos la 'di skye ba'i dbang gis smos pa ste de'i yan lag ni ma yin no //
translated: The term with an owner is used here in the sense of a monastery, but it is not a part of the name of the offense.

original: ji ltar bdag po med pa nyid la yang sa gzhi srid pa @128a * //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag po med pa nyid la yang sa gzhi srid pa @128a * //
translated: Just as the ground is possible even without an owner.

original: ste ; khyim gyi gzhi yongs su 'dzin pa dgag pa las 'da' bar byas nas dge 'dun la brten nas nyos pa bzung ba dang / dge 'dun gyi gzhi rjes su gnang bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ste ; khyim gyi gzhi yongs su 'dzin pa dgag pa las 'da' bar byas nas dge 'dun la brten nas nyos pa bzung ba dang / dge 'dun gyi gzhi rjes su gnang bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the purchase is made in reliance on the Saṅgha, after having transgressed the prohibition against taking possession of the ground of a house, and when the ground is approved by the Saṅgha, then it is with an owner.

original: khang ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma pa yan lag gzhan gnyis brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khang ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma pa yan lag gzhan gnyis brjod par bya ste /
translated: The other two parts of the rule for the Saṅgha-monastery should be stated.

original: gcig gi don du'o zhes bya ba ni gang zag gcig gi don du byed du 'jug na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur gyi gnyis dang mang po dag la ni ma yin no //🔽'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa'i gzhung kha cig las /
analyzed: gcig gi don du'o zhes bya ba ni gang zag gcig gi don du byed du 'jug na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur gyi gnyis dang mang po dag la ni ma yin no //🔽'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa'i gzhung kha cig las /
translated: For the sake of one person means that if one causes a monastery to be built for the sake of one person, it becomes a pārājika offense for the Saṅgha, but not for two or many.🔽Here, the text of the Upāliparipṛcchā says, Upāli, if a monk causes a monastery to be built for the sake of one person, it becomes a pārājika offense for the Saṅgha, but not for two or many.

original: gnyis kyis spyi la byed du 'jug na sbom por ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnyis kyis spyi la byed du 'jug na sbom por ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If two or more people are made to do work that should be done by the Saṅgha, it is a serious transgression.

original: 'dir mang po'i don du ni nyes pa med pa nyid rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir mang po'i don du ni nyes pa med pa nyid rigs pa yin te /
translated: Here, it is reasonable that there is no fault if it is for the sake of many people.

original: dge 'dun gyi don nyid du ni nyes bya su brjod pa'i phyir dngos gzhi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi don nyid du ni nyes bya su brjod pa'i phyir dngos gzhi ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is said to be a minor offense for the sake of the Saṅgha, it is not a root downfall.

original: 'dir shin tu 'byung bar 'dod pa dang 'brel pa la gnas pas nyes byas tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir shin tu 'byung bar 'dod pa dang 'brel pa la gnas pas nyes byas tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, it is not just a minor offense for one who is connected to the desire for great attainment.

original: ltung ba bye dpa'i dngos po thams cad la yang lag 'dab bar byed pa la sbom po'i ltung ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltung ba bye dpa'i dngos po thams cad la yang lag 'dab bar byed pa la sbom po'i ltung ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in all cases of downfalls, making a fist and striking is a serious downfall.

original: de bas na gnyis la sogs pa du ma nyid la 'dir gnyis kyi tshig rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba gcig pa nyid kyi gtso bo 'di shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis la sogs pa du ma nyid la 'dir gnyis kyi tshig rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba gcig pa nyid kyi gtso bo 'di shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this case, the word “two” is established as referring to many, and this is understood to be the principal one.

original: de bas na bdag nyid gcig pu 'am dge slong gzhan gcig gam /
analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid gcig pu 'am dge slong gzhan gcig gam /
translated: Therefore, if one is alone, or if there is another monk,

original: khyim pa gcig gi don byed du bcug na dge 'dun lhag ma ste zhes bya ba bye brag tu ma byas pa'i phyir rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa gcig gi don byed du bcug na dge 'dun lhag ma ste zhes bya ba bye brag tu ma byas pa'i phyir rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood because it is not specified.🔽Does this apply to all who are caused to do it?

original: ci gnas byed du bcug pa thams cad las der 'gyur ram zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci gnas byed du bcug pa thams cad las der 'gyur ram zhe na ma yin te /
translated: No, it does not.

original: de'i phyir tshad las lhag pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad las lhag pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “in excess of the proper size.”

original: tshad las 'das pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad las 'das pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is, “in excess of the proper size.”

original: gzhi ma dag pa la'o zhes smos na 'dir ma dag pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi ma dag pa la'o zhes smos na 'dir ma dag pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: If it says, “on an impure site,” what is impure here?

original: de'i phyir mi rung ba nyid dang rtsod pa dang bcas pa nyid dang brtsam du mi rung ba nyid ni ma dag pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rung ba nyid dang rtsod pa dang bcas pa nyid dang brtsam du mi rung ba nyid ni ma dag pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “Impurity is unsuitability, dispute, and unfitness.”

original: de gsum gyi rang bzhin ji ltar zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de gsum gyi rang bzhin ji ltar zhe na ma yin te /
translated: What are the natures of those three?

original: de'i phyir skye ba po phra mo'i gnas dang ldan pa nyid dang rgyal po dang lha'i gnas dang / mu stegs can gyi 'dug gnas la brten pa nyid dang / shing ljon pa gcad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid dang / phyi rol 'dom gang gi mtha'i nyen kor gyi nang rol du chu klung ngam ngam grog gam khron pa dang 'dom pa nyid ni go rims bzhin du de dag yin no zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba po phra mo'i gnas dang ldan pa nyid dang rgyal po dang lha'i gnas dang / mu stegs can gyi 'dug gnas la brten pa nyid dang / shing ljon pa gcad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid dang / phyi rol 'dom gang gi mtha'i nyen kor gyi nang rol du chu klung ngam ngam grog gam khron pa dang 'dom pa nyid ni go rims bzhin du de dag yin no zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, the status of being a small living being’s abode, the status of being a king’s abode or a god’s abode, the status of being a tīrthika’s dwelling place, the status of being a tree that should not be cut down, and the status of being within a distance of one fathom from a river, a ravine, or a well are, respectively, those.

original: de la skye ba po phra mo'i gnas dang ldan pa nyid dang 'dom pa @128b nyid ni mi rung ba nyid dang / rgyal po'i gnas la sogs par brten pa nyid dang / shing ljon pa gcad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni rtsod pa dang bcas pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de la skye ba po phra mo'i gnas dang ldan pa nyid dang 'dom pa @128b nyid ni mi rung ba nyid dang / rgyal po'i gnas la sogs par brten pa nyid dang / shing ljon pa gcad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni rtsod pa dang bcas pa nyid dang /
translated: Among them, the status of being a small living being’s abode and the status of being a tree that should not be cut down are unsuitable, and the status of being a king’s abode and so on, the status of being a tīrthika’s dwelling place, and the status of being a tree that should not be cut down are contentious.

original: phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa brtsam du mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa brtsam du mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: “Outside” and so on are unsuitable to begin with.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gal te da na skye ba po phra mo'i gnas dang sbrul gyi gnas sam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gal te da na skye ba po phra mo'i gnas dang sbrul gyi gnas sam /
translated: Here the text is: “If now, the abode of the subtle being, the abode of the snake,

original: sdig pa'i gnas sam /
analyzed: sdig pa'i gnas sam /
translated: the abode of the sinner,

original: sprang bu tre ma bu ka dang tree la ta ka'i gnas yod pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: sprang bu tre ma bu ka dang tree la ta ka'i gnas yod pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: the abode of the Tremelo fruit fly and the Treelouse fly are existent.”

original: 'dir sbrul la sogs pa skye ba phra mo rnams ni dpe tsam du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sbrul la sogs pa skye ba phra mo rnams ni dpe tsam du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Here the subtle birth of the snake, etc., is established as mere example.

original: de bas na 'di rnams thams cad khongs su bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di rnams thams cad khongs su bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all these are included.

original: rgyal po'i gnas la sogs pa la brten pa nyid ni de'i drung du 'gro ba nyid do //
analyzed: rgyal po'i gnas la sogs pa la brten pa nyid ni de'i drung du 'gro ba nyid do //
translated: The dependence on the king’s abode, etc., is the going to it.

original: 'dir mtho btsams pa las 'byung ba'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir mtho btsams pa las 'byung ba'i nyes pa'o //
translated: Here the fault arises from the insult.

original: sgra de dang de'i dbang gis byung ba'i srog chags rnams dang rdzas gzhan rnams kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: sgra de dang de'i dbang gis byung ba'i srog chags rnams dang rdzas gzhan rnams kyis kyang ngo //
translated: The creatures and other substances that arise by the power of that sound.

original: 'dir rnam par mtho btsams pa ni gnod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par mtho btsams pa ni gnod pa'o //
translated: Here the insult is the harm.

original: shing ljon pa gcad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni gcad par 'os pa ma yin pa ni 'dir shing zhes 'jig rten pa dag la mkho ba yin pa'i phyir kha mchu 'byung ba mi rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: shing ljon pa gcad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni gcad par 'os pa ma yin pa ni 'dir shing zhes 'jig rten pa dag la mkho ba yin pa'i phyir kha mchu 'byung ba mi rtsom pa'o //
translated: The fault of not being a tree is that it is not fit to be cut down; for in the world, a tree is what is fit to be cut down, because it is useful.

original: yun thung bar gnas pa nyid kyis dgos pa chung ba nyid do //
analyzed: yun thung bar gnas pa nyid kyis dgos pa chung ba nyid do //
translated: The fault of not being a long-lasting thing is that it has little purpose, because it does not last long.

original: rnam par gnon pa ma yin pa nyid tsam du mi rung ba nyid kyi skyon no //🔽phyogs gcig pa yang 'dom ste de'i gang zhig nyen kor gyi nang rol de ma thag pa gzhan gyis nye bar longs spyod pa de'i phyir rol nyid du 'dzin pa nyid ma yin pa ji tsam pa de tsam gyi phyogs la'o //
analyzed: rnam par gnon pa ma yin pa nyid tsam du mi rung ba nyid kyi skyon no // phyogs gcig pa yang 'dom ste de'i gang zhig nyen kor gyi nang rol de ma thag pa gzhan gyis nye bar longs spyod pa de'i phyir rol nyid du 'dzin pa nyid ma yin pa ji tsam pa de tsam gyi phyogs la'o //
translated: The fault of not being a thing that can be overcome is that it is not fit to be overcome, because it is not a thing that can be overcome.

original: gcig gis kyang chu klung la sogs pa rnams la nyes pa 'di yin no //🔽'dir gzhung ni 'dom gang gi mtha'i nyen kor brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gcig gis kyang chu klung la sogs pa rnams la nyes pa 'di yin no //🔽'dir gzhung ni 'dom gang gi mtha'i nyen kor brtag par bya ste /

original: gal te gzhi chu klung la brten nam ngam grog la brten pa yin na brtsam du mi rung ba'i phyir bstan par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhi chu klung la brten nam ngam grog la brten pa yin na brtsam du mi rung ba'i phyir bstan par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If the basis is a river or a ravine, it is not suitable to begin, so it should not be taught.

original: gang las 'das na gnas tshad las 'das par gyur pa'i tshad de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang las 'das na gnas tshad las 'das par gyur pa'i tshad de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the measure that is exceeded when one exceeds the measure of the site?

original: de'i phyir tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang do ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang do ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang ste /
translated: Therefore it is said: The measure of a cubit and a half of the Sugata is the measure of the site.

original: nang rol nas de bcu gnyis dang bdun gyi tshad do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nang rol nas de bcu gnyis dang bdun gyi tshad do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The inner space is twelve and seven cubits.

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'di tsam gyi tshad de la'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'di tsam gyi tshad de la'o //
translated: The word that refers to this measure.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang zhes bya ba ni dkyus su'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang zhes bya ba ni dkyus su'o //
translated: The word cubit refers to the length of the Sugata.

original: nang rol du ni de bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: nang rol du ni de bcu gnyis te /
translated: The inner space is twelve of those.

original: rgyar ni bdun gyi tshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de las bzlog pa nyid ni ma bstan pa nyid do zhes @129a * //
analyzed: rgyar ni bdun gyi tshad do zhes bya ba'i don to // de las bzlog pa nyid ni ma bstan pa nyid do zhes @129a * //
translated: The width is seven cubits. This is the meaning.

original: smras na bstan pa nyid de gang zhe na /
analyzed: smras na bstan pa nyid de gang zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the opposite of that is not taught, it is taught. What is it?

original: de'i phyir dge 'dun la bstan pa thob pa nyid ni bstan pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /🔽shin tu gtong bar gyur pa'i gzhi de'i las la mngon par rjes su gnang bar gyur pa'i tshig ni bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge 'dun la bstan pa thob pa nyid ni bstan pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos te / shin tu gtong bar gyur pa'i gzhi de'i las la mngon par rjes su gnang bar gyur pa'i tshig ni bstan pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the phrase “the basis of the Saṅgha’s proclamation is the proclamation itself” is stated.🔽The proclamation is the statement that permits the action of the basis of the Saṅgha’s proclamation.

original: gzhi gang las dge 'dun la thob pa de ni bstan pa zhes bya bar 'dir 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: gzhi gang las dge 'dun la thob pa de ni bstan pa zhes bya bar 'dir 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The meaning of the phrase “the basis of the Saṅgha’s proclamation is the proclamation itself” is that the basis of the Saṅgha’s proclamation is asserted to be the proclamation.

original: ma dag pa gsol bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhi mi rung ba nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang ma dag pa dge 'dun las bstan pa gsol bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma dag pa gsol bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhi mi rung ba nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang ma dag pa dge 'dun las bstan pa gsol bar mi bya'o //
translated: “Do not request the Saṅgha to proclaim an impure basis” means that you should not request the Saṅgha to proclaim a basis that is not suitable, and so on, or that is impure.

original: rang dag rtog tu dong bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang dag rtog tu dong bar bya'o //
translated: “Go to a pure place” means that you should go to a place that is pure.

original: yang na dge slong bskos pa dag go zhes bya ba ni gang dag la gzhi bstan pa la gsol pa de rnams rang gi rkyen gyis dngos po'i dag pa nyid shes par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: yang na dge slong bskos pa dag go zhes bya ba ni gang dag la gzhi bstan pa la gsol pa de rnams rang gi rkyen gyis dngos po'i dag pa nyid shes par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: “Or the appointed monks” means that the appointed monks who request the proclamation of the basis will know the purity of the matter through their own conditions.

original: rang nyid kyis bskos pa'i dge slong rnams kyi rkyen gyis shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis bskos pa'i dge slong rnams kyi rkyen gyis shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should understand through one’s own conditions, i.e., through the conditions of the monks who are appointed.🔽The same applies to the sitting mat.

original: stan la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rnying ba nyid kyi phyir lo drug tshun chad du stan bya ba'i phyir gnang ba gsol bar byed na bstan la rang gi rkyen gyis shes par 'gyur ba 'am gsol ba'i dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba 'di
analyzed: stan la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rnying ba nyid kyi phyir lo drug tshun chad du stan bya ba'i phyir gnang ba gsol bar byed na bstan la rang gi rkyen gyis shes par 'gyur ba 'am gsol ba'i dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba 'di
translated: If one requests permission to use an old sitting mat for six years or less, one should understand through one’s own conditions, i.e., through the conditions of the monks who are appointed.

original: rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should understand this, is the meaning.🔽There is no offense for one who has obtained what was made or who uses what was made.

original: byas pa rnyed pa dang byas pa la longs spyod pa dag la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni rnyed par byas pa'am longs spyad par byas pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: byas pa rnyed pa dang byas pa la longs spyod pa dag la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni rnyed par byas pa'am longs spyad par byas pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for one who has obtained what was made or who uses what was made.

original: 'di la bdag tu byas pa'i dbang gis kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: 'di la bdag tu byas pa'i dbang gis kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: There is no offense in this case due to the power of ownership,

original: lhag par gnas pa'i dbang gis ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir tshig 'di'o //
analyzed: lhag par gnas pa'i dbang gis ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir tshig 'di'o //
translated: not due to the power of consecration. This is the meaning of this statement.

original: rnying pa ma 'chos pa la sogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ltung ba med do zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnying pa ma 'chos pa la sogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ltung ba med do zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The word “also” is connected to “there is no offense.”

original: 'dir gsar pa brtsig pa la ni skyon te /
analyzed: 'dir gsar pa brtsig pa la ni skyon te /
translated: Here, there is an offense for building a new one,

original: rnying pa ma 'chos pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnying pa ma 'chos pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for not repairing an old one.

original: de bas na rnying pa ma yin pa ma 'chos pa la yang ltung ba med de /
analyzed: de bas na rnying pa ma yin pa ma 'chos pa la yang ltung ba med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no offense for not repairing an old one that is not new.

original: 'dir rnying pa'i tshig smos pa ni dper na rig par bya'o //🔽khang pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'o /
analyzed: 'dir rnying pa'i tshig smos pa ni dper na rig par bya'o // khang pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'o /
translated: The word “old” here is like the word “know.”🔽This is the Saṅgha-sthūlā of a temple.

original: // / gang byas na gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang byas na gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the Saṅgha-sthūlā of a temple?

original: 'dir 'og ma la yang de dag nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir 'og ma la yang de dag nyid de /
translated: Here, those same [offenses] are also below.

original: de ma btsal ba nyid do zhes bya ba sngar bstan pa'i cho ga la ltos nas bye brag brjod par ba ste /
analyzed: de ma btsal ba nyid do zhes bya ba sngar bstan pa'i cho ga la ltos nas bye brag brjod par ba ste /
translated: Not seeking them is said to be the difference in relation to the previously taught ritual.

original: tshogs kyi don du'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir khyim pa yan chad kyi gang zag bzhi la sogs pa tshogs zhes bya ba mngon par 'dod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi don du'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir khyim pa yan chad kyi gang zag bzhi la sogs pa tshogs zhes bya ba mngon par 'dod par rig par bya'o //
translated: For the sake of the assembly means that here, four or more individuals, including laypeople, are known as the “assembly.”

original: shin tu sdig pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir khyim pa'i don nyid @129b kyi bsam pa la 'phags pa'i dge 'dun rjes su gzung ba'i bsam pa la shin tu dge ba nyid la yang kha na ma tho ba rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu sdig pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir khyim pa'i don nyid @129b kyi bsam pa la 'phags pa'i dge 'dun rjes su gzung ba'i bsam pa la shin tu dge ba nyid la yang kha na ma tho ba rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is extremely sinful, and because the intention of the householder is extremely virtuous in the intention to support the noble Sangha, it is established as a downfall.

original: gang zhig tshogs kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun no zhes gsungs pa de ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gis de dpe tsam du zad par 'di la nyes pa med do zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig tshogs kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun no zhes gsungs pa de ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gis de dpe tsam du zad par 'di la nyes pa med do zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase for the sake of the community refers to the community of disciples of the Tathagata. This is merely an example, and there is no fault in understanding it in this way, since it is stated in the nidana.

original: gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma'o /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma'o /
translated: The Saṅgha of the monastery is the remainder.

original: // / rtsom pa nyid ni sbyor ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa gang la dngos gzhi'i tshad 'da' bar byed pa nyid la thams cad du yan lag lhag ma rnams la 'da' bar byed pa dang / sbyor ba nyid la der 'di rnams sbom por ston par byed pa'i tshig rnams zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: // / rtsom pa nyid ni sbyor ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa gang la dngos gzhi'i tshad 'da' bar byed pa nyid la thams cad du yan lag lhag ma rnams la 'da' bar byed pa dang / sbyor ba nyid la der 'di rnams sbom por ston par byed pa'i tshig rnams zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The composition itself is the performance. It should be understood that in any culmination where the measure of the main part is exceeded, all the remaining limbs are exceeded, and in the performance itself, these words indicate the gross.

original: mthar thug pa gang la sbom po des sbyor ba yang sbom po rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthar thug pa gang la sbom po des sbyor ba yang sbom po rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that the performance is also gross in any culmination where it is gross.

original: 'dir gzhung ni brtsams nas bdag nyid gsod par byed pa nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni brtsams nas bdag nyid gsod par byed pa nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text states that if one composes and then kills oneself, it is a gross fault.

original: ma g-yogs pa byed du 'jug pa'i mtha' yang de 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni gnas de ma g-yogs pa zhig byed du gzhug go snyam pa'i bsam pas mtha'i mthar thug pa gang yin pa de yang de bzhin du ste sbyor ba dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma g-yogs pa byed du 'jug pa'i mtha' yang de 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni gnas de ma g-yogs pa zhig byed du gzhug go snyam pa'i bsam pas mtha'i mthar thug pa gang yin pa de yang de bzhin du ste sbyor ba dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The conclusion of causing the construction of an uncovered building is similar. It should be understood that any culmination where one thinks, “I will cause the construction of an uncovered building in that place,” is similar to the performance.

original: 'dir gzhung ni steng ma g-yogs pa zhig byed du 'jug na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni steng ma g-yogs pa zhig byed du 'jug na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says that if one has a roof made, it is a serious offense.

original: sngar ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di'i sbyor ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: sngar ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di'i sbyor ba la nyes byas so //
translated: Previously, it was a minor offense.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba 'dis byas pa nyid rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba 'dis byas pa nyid rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the term “all” should be understood to refer to the act itself.

original: du ma'i don du'o zhes bya ba ni khang pa mi rung ba la sogs pa'i yan lag thams cad las 'das pa du ma'i don du byed du bcug pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de yang sbyor ba dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: du ma'i don du'o zhes bya ba ni khang pa mi rung ba la sogs pa'i yan lag thams cad las 'das pa du ma'i don du byed du bcug pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de yang sbyor ba dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: “For many” means that if one has a house built that exceeds the proper size in all its parts, the conclusion of the act should be understood to be similar to the preparation.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gnyis kyi spyi la byed du 'jug na sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽ma bskos par ro zhes bya ba ni 'tshol ba po 'am gnang ba pos rjes su ma gnang bar gnas byed du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gnyis kyi spyi la byed du 'jug na sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no // ma bskos par ro zhes bya ba ni 'tshol ba po 'am gnang ba pos rjes su ma gnang bar gnas byed du 'jug pa ste /
translated: Here the text says that if one has a house built that exceeds the proper size in two dimensions, it is a serious offense.

original: de'i mtha' gang yin pa de yang sbyor ba dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mtha' gang yin pa de yang sbyor ba dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: “Without being appointed” means that if one has a house built without being appointed by the saṅgha to do so, the conclusion of the act should be understood to be similar to the preparation.

original: gang gi de so sor bzung ba de'i don nyid du 'di byed du 'jug pas mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi de so sor bzung ba de'i don nyid du 'di byed du 'jug pas mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Since one is made to do this for the sake of that person, it is a permission.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir dngos gzhir rnam par mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir dngos gzhir rnam par mi gzhag ste /
translated: Why is it not posited as the actual basis?

original: lhag ma bsgrub pa dag la 'dir gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma bsgrub pa dag la 'dir gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: One would remain here in the practice of the remainder.

original: ji ltar rang bzhin mi mthun pa byed du 'jug pas 'das pa la yang rjes su @130a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin mi mthun pa byed du 'jug pas 'das pa la yang rjes su @130a * //
translated: Just as one is made to do something contrary to one's nature, so too one is permitted to do something contrary to the nature of the training.

original: gnang ba la ni bzung ba 'dis 'gyur te de ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gnang ba la ni bzung ba 'dis 'gyur te de ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: This is the engagement.

original: de bas na rjes su gnang ba dang bsgrub pa de la gnod pa nyid kyi phyir dngos gzhi bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rjes su gnang ba dang bsgrub pa de la gnod pa nyid kyi phyir dngos gzhi bskyed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is harmful to the permission and practice, it is the generation of the actual basis.

original: rjes su ma gnang ba la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su ma gnang ba la sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is the preparation for what is not permitted.

original: 'dir gzhung ni yi ge kha cig las ma bskos par byed du 'jug na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni yi ge kha cig las ma bskos par byed du 'jug na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says that if one makes someone do something without being appointed, there is a serious downfall.

original: gang zag gis so zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pas byed du 'jug na de bzhin du mtha'o //
analyzed: gang zag gis so zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pas byed du 'jug na de bzhin du mtha'o //
translated: By person means that if one makes someone else do it, it is the same.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gang zag gi gzhis byed du 'jug na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gang zag gi gzhis byed du 'jug na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says that if one makes a person do this, there is a grave offense.

original: 'di thams cad zhu ba dang 'brel pa bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis kyi dbang du byas pa yin gyi gang zag gi zhes bya ba 'di ni ma gtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad zhu ba dang 'brel pa bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis kyi dbang du byas pa yin gyi gang zag gi zhes bya ba 'di ni ma gtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: All of this is from the perspective of two bases of training that are related to requests, but it should be understood that the term “person” is not included.

original: gang gi phyir gtsug lag khang gi bslab pa'i gzhi la btsal ba nyid kyi yan lag rnam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtsug lag khang gi bslab pa'i gzhi la btsal ba nyid kyi yan lag rnam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the branches of the training rules for the temple are not established as a separate category.

original: rang bzhin mi mthun pa yang ngo zhes bya ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de bzhin du byed du 'jug na mtha' de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi mthun pa yang ngo zhes bya ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de bzhin du byed du 'jug na mtha' de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, if it is not compatible with one’s nature, the term also indicates that if one makes another do this, the offense is similar to that.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rang bzhin mi mthun pa'i zhal ta byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rang bzhin mi mthun pa'i zhal ta byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says that if one makes a person do this, there is a grave offense.

original: gsol ba'i 'og tu ma grub na nyes byas so zhes bya ba gsol ba'i 'og tu gnas de mor ma grub pa gang yin pa de la ni nyes byas so//
analyzed: gsol ba'i 'og tu ma grub na nyes byas so zhes bya ba gsol ba'i 'og tu gnas de mor ma grub pa gang yin pa de la ni nyes byas so//
translated: If one does not complete the request at that place, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'dir rim pa nyid ni skyon te de bas na rim pa'i ngo bos mi 'dod pa'i bsam pas ma grub pa la nyes byas su rnam par gzhag gi bar chad kyi dbang gis ma grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rim pa nyid ni skyon te de bas na rim pa'i ngo bos mi 'dod pa'i bsam pas ma grub pa la nyes byas su rnam par gzhag gi bar chad kyi dbang gis ma grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the fault is the very order, therefore, it is established that there is an offense of wrong conduct for not completing it with the intention of not desiring the order, but it is not for not completing it due to an obstacle.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig gzhi btsal nas mi bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig gzhi btsal nas mi bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here, the text says, “Venerable, if one does not do it after searching for a site, what is the offense?”

original: nyes byas su'o //
analyzed: nyes byas su'o //
translated: “It is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: khang pa bstan pa gsol nas bgyid du mi stsol na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas su'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: khang pa bstan pa gsol nas bgyid du mi stsol na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas su'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “If one does not do it after requesting the teaching of a house, what is the offense?” “It is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: khang pa dang gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma zhu ba'i skabs so /
analyzed: khang pa dang gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma zhu ba'i skabs so /
translated: This is the chapter on the Saṅgha remainder offenses for houses and temples.

original: // / gang du dngos gzhi dang 'brel pa brjod pa la dge 'dun gya lhag ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang du dngos gzhi dang 'brel pa brjod pa la dge 'dun gya lhag ma yin zhe na /
translated: Where is there a Saṅgha remainder offense that is related to the actual basis?

original: de'i phyir pham par 'gyur ba lhag par spyod pas dge slong nyams pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir pham par 'gyur ba lhag par spyod pas dge slong nyams pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “Also, if a fully ordained monk who has committed a defeating offense slanders him.”

original: mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pas pham par 'gyur ba lhag par spyod pa des skur pa 'debs na dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pas pham par 'gyur ba lhag par spyod pa des skur pa 'debs na dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
translated: If one who has committed a defeating offense, such as sexual intercourse, slanders a monk, it is a partial defeat.

original: su la lhag par spyod pa des skur ba 'debs she na /
analyzed: su la lhag par spyod pa des skur ba 'debs she na /
translated: With regard to whom does one commit a partial defeat by slandering him?

original: de'i phyir dge slong nyams pa yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te tshul khrims dang ldan pa @130b 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi nyams pa la skur ba btab na yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong nyams pa yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te tshul khrims dang ldan pa @130b 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi nyams pa la skur ba btab na yang ngo //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “Also, if a fully ordained monk.” One does not commit a partial defeat by slandering a monk who is endowed with ethical discipline, but one does commit a partial defeat by slandering a monk who has violated his ethical discipline.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las dang bcas pa tshul khrims dang ldan pa gcig pu la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las dang bcas pa tshul khrims dang ldan pa gcig pu la ni ma yin no //
translated: One does not commit a partial defeat by slandering a monk who is endowed with ethical discipline and who has not violated his ethical discipline.

original: nyams pa la yang zhes bya ba'i tshig ni dge slong pha dang dge slong ma nyid nyams pa zhes bya ba 'di la skur ba 'debs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: nyams pa la yang zhes bya ba'i tshig ni dge slong pha dang dge slong ma nyid nyams pa zhes bya ba 'di la skur ba 'debs pa'i don du'o //
translated: The phrase “also, if a fully ordained monk” is stated in order to indicate that one commits a partial defeat by slandering a monk or nun who has violated his or her ethical discipline.

original: ma dag pa dang nyams pa la dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba'i tshig la gzhung ni 'di yin te zhu ba las kyang btsun pa dge slong rang 'di skad ces bdag gis mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bsten no zhes mchi ba de la dge slong
analyzed: ma dag pa dang nyams pa la dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba'i tshig la gzhung ni 'di yin te zhu ba las kyang btsun pa dge slong rang 'di skad ces bdag gis mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bsten no zhes mchi ba de la dge slong
translated: The Buddha said, “Monks, if a monk says, ‘I have engaged in the act of sexual intercourse, which is an impure, unvirtuous act,’

original: gis gzhi ma mchis par rku ba 'am 'gugs pa'i smra bas skur pa 'debs na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: gis gzhi ma mchis par rku ba 'am 'gugs pa'i smra bas skur pa 'debs na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: then if a monk accuses him of lying without a basis in truth, saying, ‘You are a thief, you are a liar,’ what is his offense?”🔽“It is an offense of partial defeat,” and so on.

original: dge 'dun lhag mar ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag mar ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The basis of the Saṅgha’s act of reconciliation is a monk who is fully ordained in the same Buddhist order.🔽The basis of the Saṅgha’s act of ejecting for not recognizing an offense is a monk who is fully ordained in the same Buddhist order.🔽The basis of the Saṅgha’s act of ejecting for not making amends for an offense is a monk who is fully ordained in the same Buddhist order.🔽The basis of the Saṅgha’s act of ejecting for not relinquishing an evil view is a monk who is fully ordained in the same Buddhist order.

original: rang gi phyogs kyi bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang mthun pa ni mtshan dang khas len pa dag gis zhes bya ba 'di la de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /🔽phyogs las rang nyid ni 'dir yan lag ma yin no zhes bya pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs kyi bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang mthun pa ni mtshan dang khas len pa dag gis zhes bya ba 'di la de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /🔽phyogs las rang nyid ni 'dir yan lag ma yin no zhes bya pa smos te /

original: de bzhin du dge slong mas dge slong la gzhi med pa'i pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur pa 'debs na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs so ;

original: / nyams pa la skur ba 'debs pa la yang kha na mtho ba yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba las na khas len pa dang mi len pa nyid kyi tha dad pa la 'dra ba'i kha na ma tho ba 'dir rnam par gzhag go //

translated: And in the case of one who denigrates the one who has fallen, it is called the complete form of the offense, so the difference between accepting and not accepting is established here as a similar offense.

original: shin tu slar khros pa'i 'jug pa 'di shin tu yang sgor gyur pa dge sbyong gi rigs la skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba dang / nyams pa dang mtshan tha dad pa'i yul la yang ltung ba mtshungs pa nyid du 'di la rnam par gzhag pa'o //

translated: This is the extremely angry engagement, which is called denigrating the type of spiritual practitioner, and the similarity of the downfall is established here even in the case of a different gender of the one who has fallen.

original: brdzun du smra ba'o zhes bya ba ni gzhi med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ma yin no //🔽ma grags pa'i shes pas nye bar dmigs par bya ba go bar byed pa la yid ma ches pa'i thos @131a * //

original: pas bdag gis thos so //
analyzed: pas bdag gis thos so //
translated: It is by the understanding of what is perceived by unrecognized cognition, and by the hearing of disbelief, I have heard.

analyzed: bdag ni yid ches pas ma yin zhes bya ba 'di ltar dge 'dun lhag ma skyed par gyur tam zhes bya ba'o //

original: skur ba 'debs pa la kha na ma tho ba 'di'o //
analyzed: skur ba 'debs pa la kha na ma tho ba 'di'o //

original: gzhan la smra ba ni skur pa 'debs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la smra ba ni skur pa 'debs pa yang ma yin no //

original: khyod ni bdag gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyod ni bdag gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
