original: gang la 'dir skyon gzhan yin gyi pham pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i blo sgrub pa gzhan la des nyams pa la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: gang la 'dir skyon gzhan yin gyi pham pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i blo sgrub pa gzhan la des nyams pa la 'jug pa ste /
translated: The thought that this is a fault here, but not a defeat, engages in the defeat of another.

original: 'pho bar gyur pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'pho bar gyur pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not engage in the defeat of one who has already been defeated.

original: 'dir gang la skyon yod pa zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyi blo 'di ni 'di ma yin zhes bya ba de la yang rnam pa gzhan nyid de nyams par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gang la skyon yod pa zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyi blo 'di ni 'di ma yin zhes bya ba de la yang rnam pa gzhan nyid de nyams par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The thought that this is a fault here, but not a defeat, is a different aspect of the thought that this is not a defeat. It does not engage in the defeat of one who has already been defeated.🔽Therefore, what is the point of any thought here?

original: de bas na 'dir bsam pa gang yang rung ba des ci zhig bya zhes bya ba su zhig la go bar byas na de bas na ltos pa der brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir bsam pa gang yang rung ba des ci zhig bya zhes bya ba su zhig la go bar byas na de bas na ltos pa der brjod par bya'o //
translated: When one is understood by another, then that dependence should be stated.

original: nyams par 'dun pas so zhes bya ba ni khros par ma gyur cig ces bya ba byung rgyal gyis smras pas brda byas pa la pham pa 'di zhes bya ba brdzun du smras pa las 'pho bar 'jug pa'i 'dun pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyams par 'dun pas so zhes bya ba ni khros par ma gyur cig ces bya ba byung rgyal gyis smras pas brda byas pa la pham pa 'di zhes bya ba brdzun du smras pa las 'pho bar 'jug pa'i 'dun pa med pa'o //
translated: The thought of defeat is the thought that one should not be angry, but should speak freely. The thought of engaging in the defeat of one who has already been defeated is the absence of the thought of lying, which is the false statement that this is a defeat.

original: nyams pa nyid du srid pa dang 'brel pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: nyams pa nyid du srid pa dang 'brel pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is the connection with the possibility of defeat.

original: nyams pa nyid las gzhan ni 'dir nyams pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams pa nyid las gzhan ni 'dir nyams pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no other offense here than the offense of degradation itself.

original: de bas na 'di lta bu'i 'dun pas brdzun par gzhan la go bar byed pa gang yin pa de la 'dir lhag ma'i lhung byed do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di lta bu'i 'dun pas brdzun par gzhan la go bar byed pa gang yin pa de la 'dir lhag ma'i lhung byed do //
translated: Therefore, if one causes another to understand a lie with such an intention, then here there is an offense of a partial defeat.

original: nyams par ma gyur pa'i brjod pa rnams gang yin pa de rnams la ni gang du dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i blo yod pa de la lhung byed do //
analyzed: nyams par ma gyur pa'i brjod pa rnams gang yin pa de rnams la ni gang du dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i blo yod pa de la lhung byed do //
translated: But if the words are not those of degradation, then in those cases, wherever there is the idea of a partial defeat of the Saṅgha, there is an offense of a partial defeat.

original: gzhan la ni nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: In other cases, it should be understood as a minor offense.

original: gang du dogs pa 'jug pa 'di pham pa zhes bya bar ma gyur tam snyam du yid gnyis su gyur pas de la bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: gang du dogs pa 'jug pa 'di pham pa zhes bya bar ma gyur tam snyam du yid gnyis su gyur pas de la bskyed pa'o //
translated: In this case, it is a doubt that arises, thinking, “Has this become a defeat?”

original: de gzhi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gis smra ba de 'dir ni zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de gzhi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gis smra ba de 'dir ni zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: “It is not another basis” means that the one who speaks is here called “this.”

original: gzhi de las gzhi gzhan gang yin pa de la ni 'dir gzhi ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhi de las gzhi gzhan gang yin pa de la ni 'dir gzhi ma yin no //
translated: Whatever is another basis than that basis, that is not a basis here.

original: 'di lta ste dper na mthong bas smra ba @131b yod par gyur pa la mthong ba de las gzhan dogs pa'i gzhi ma thos pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na mthong bas smra ba @131b yod par gyur pa la mthong ba de las gzhan dogs pa'i gzhi ma thos pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, it is like saying, The one who speaks having seen exists, but that which is the basis of doubt other than that seeing, which is not heard, is not seeing.

original: gzhi gzhan yod par gyur kyang gang gis smra ba de med pa la 'dir dge 'dun gyi lhag ma yod par gyur te zhes bya ba 'di la byed du 'jug pa'i tshig gis ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi gzhan yod par gyur kyang gang gis smra ba de med pa la 'dir dge 'dun gyi lhag ma yod par gyur te zhes bya ba 'di la byed du 'jug pa'i tshig gis ston pa'o //
translated: Even if the basis exists, when the one who speaks does not exist, here the remainder of the Saṅgha exists. This is shown by the word makes.

original: gal te gzhi gzhan gang yin pa de nyid de'i gzhir 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzhi gzhan gang yin pa de nyid de'i gzhir 'gyur na /
translated: If that which is the basis of another were to become the basis of that,

original: gzhi gzhan yod pas kyang gzhi gang gis gleng ba'i gzhi des dge 'dun lhag ma yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhi gzhan yod pas kyang gzhi gang gis gleng ba'i gzhi des dge 'dun lhag ma yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then even by the existence of another basis, the basis by which the basis is brought up would not be the remainder of the Saṅgha.

original: 'di ni yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of it does not exist.

original: 'dir gzhung ni thos pa la yid ches nas smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni thos pa la yid ches nas smras pa /
translated: Here the text is: Having trusted what is heard, one says,🔽I have seen. This is to inspire trust. Not trusting what is heard, one says,

original: bdag gis mthong ngo zhes yid ches par byed pa dang / thos pa la yid ma ches pas smras pa /
analyzed: bdag gis mthong ngo zhes yid ches par byed pa dang / thos pa la yid ma ches pas smras pa /
translated: I have heard.

original: bdag gis mthong ngo zhes smras pa dang thos pa la dogs te /
analyzed: bdag gis mthong ngo zhes smras pa dang thos pa la dogs te /
translated: I saw it and he is doubtful about what he heard.🔽 He says I saw it and he is not doubtful about what he saw.🔽 He says I saw it and he is doubtful about what he saw.🔽 He says I saw it and he is doubtful about what he heard.

original: mthong bar brjod pa dang / mi dogs te mthong par brjod pa dang / dogs par gyur pas smras pa /
analyzed: mthong bar brjod pa dang / mi dogs te mthong par brjod pa dang / dogs par gyur pas smras pa /
translated: He says I saw it and he is doubtful about what he suspected.🔽 He says I saw it and he is not doubtful about what he suspected.

original: bdag gis mthong ngo zhes smra na brjod do cog dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis mthong ngo zhes smra na brjod do cog dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He says I saw it and he is doubtful about what he suspected.🔽 He says I saw it and he is not doubtful about what he saw.🔽 He says I saw it and he is not doubtful about what he heard.🔽 He says I saw it and he is not doubtful about what he suspected.🔽 He says I saw it and he is doubtful about what he saw and what he heard.

analyzed: brjod pa ni yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra ba ni med pa nyid du blta bar bya ste / gang zhig mi dran pas brjed pa la ni nyes pas 'dir brjod pa'o // 'dir gzhung ni 'dis mthong bar gyur pa brjed bzhin du dang / 'dis thos par gyur te /
translated: He says I saw it and he is doubtful about what he saw and what he suspected.🔽 He says I saw it and he is doubtful about what he saw and what he heard and what he suspected.🔽 He says I saw it and he is not doubtful about what he saw and what he heard and what he suspected.🔽 He says I saw it and he is doubtful about what he saw and what he heard and what he suspected.🔽 He says I saw it and he is not doubtful about what he saw and what he heard and what he suspected.🔽 He says I saw it and he is doubtful about what he saw and what he heard and what he suspected.🔽 He says I saw it and he is not doubtful about what he saw and what he heard and what he suspected.🔽 He says I saw it and he is doubtful about what he saw and what he heard and what he suspected.🔽 He says I saw it and he is not doubtful about what he saw and what he heard and what he suspected.🔽 He says I saw it and he is doubtful about what he saw and what he heard and what he suspected.

original: de yang brjed bzhin du dang / 'dis dogs par gyur te de yang brjed bzhin du des 'du shes bsgyur ba dang bcas pas ji srid du mthong ngo //
analyzed: de yang brjed bzhin du dang / 'dis dogs par gyur te de yang brjed bzhin du des 'du shes bsgyur ba dang bcas pas ji srid du mthong ngo //
translated: He says I saw it and he is not doubtful about what he saw and what he heard and what he suspected.

original: de yang mi brjed pa dang smras pa thos te 'di yang ma brjed pa dang dogs so zhes de yang ma brjed pa'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: de yang mi brjed pa dang smras pa thos te 'di yang ma brjed pa dang dogs so zhes de yang ma brjed pa'o zhes zer na /
translated: If one says, “I do not forget, I hear what is said, and I do not forget that either,”

original: brjod do cog la dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod do cog la dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: then for every statement, there is a saṃghāvaśeṣa offense.

original: don gyi de nyid ni mi brdzun par smra ba nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'du shes pa la ji ltar smra ba de nyid med pa ni 'dir rgyu yin te don la ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyi de nyid ni mi brdzun par smra ba nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'du shes pa la ji ltar smra ba de nyid med pa ni 'dir rgyu yin te don la ma yin no //
translated: The meaning is that the cause of lying is not the absence of the very thing that one conceives of. Here, the cause is the absence of the very thing that one says, but it is not the absence of the meaning.

original: de nyid yod kyang don la bsams pa nyid ni 'du shes pa nyid smra ba la brdzun du smra ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid yod kyang don la bsams pa nyid ni 'du shes pa nyid smra ba la brdzun du smra ba nyid do //
translated: Even if that very thing exists, if one conceives of the meaning, then lying is the cause of speaking.

original: ma bsams par 'du shes pa med par gyur pa la smra ba la bden pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma bsams par 'du shes pa med par gyur pa la smra ba la bden pa nyid do //
translated: If one does not conceive of the meaning, then speaking is the cause of truth.

original: gzhi gzhan gyis mi dran pas brjod pa la dge 'dun gyi lhag ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi gzhan gyis mi dran pas brjod pa la dge 'dun gyi lhag ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since one does not remember the basis of the other, it is called a saṃghāvaśeṣa offense.

original: 'di dang 'di brjod pa la ltung ba'i rgyur brjod pa ni ma dag pas skur ba btab pa la dge 'dun gyi lhag mar brjod pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di brjod pa la ltung ba'i rgyur brjod pa ni ma dag pas skur ba btab pa la dge 'dun gyi lhag mar brjod pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The expression “the basis of a downfall” is used to refer to the act of speaking and the act of accusing.

original: zhe sdang bas ma gtogs zhes bya ba 'di dang 'og tu brjod pa de'i yan lag nyid ni ma yin @132a * //
analyzed: zhe sdang bas ma gtogs zhes bya ba 'di dang 'og tu brjod pa de'i yan lag nyid ni ma yin @132a * //
translated: The phrase “except if done out of hatred” is not a subsidiary element of the act of accusing,

original: te ; skur ba 'debs pa la 'dir skyon nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: te ; skur ba 'debs pa la 'dir skyon nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the act of accusing is itself a fault.🔽The phrase “may this be spoken” is also an accusation made by one who is in opposition or by one who is accusing in some other way.🔽The phrase “what is the cause of engaging in an accusation?” is a mere repetition.

original: brjod pa yod par gyur cig ces bya ba yang kun nas rgol ba'am rnam pa gzhan gyis skur ba 'debs pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa nyid kyis ci ste 'jug pa'i rgyu rjes su 'gro ba tsam 'di dpe nyid kyis phal che ba nyid la brten nas phal cher skur ba 'debs pa 'jug pa la zhe sdang gi rgyu skyes pa'i dbang gis 'dir gsungs pa yin gyi yan lag🔽nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa yod par gyur cig ces bya ba yang kun nas rgol ba'am rnam pa gzhan gyis skur ba 'debs pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa nyid kyis ci ste 'jug pa'i rgyu rjes su 'gro ba tsam 'di dpe nyid kyis phal che ba nyid la brten nas phal cher skur ba 'debs pa 'jug pa la zhe sdang gi rgyu skyes pa'i dbang gis 'dir gsungs pa yin gyi yan lag nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase “the cause of engaging in an accusation is mostly hatred” is stated here in terms of the predominance of hatred, but not in terms of its being a subsidiary element.

original: gzhi med pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'o /
analyzed: gzhi med pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'o /
translated: The basis of a saṃgha-sheaf offense is that there is no basis for an accusation.

original: // / da ni gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma la 'di nyid cho ga ma lus pa khas blangs nas brdzun du smra bas so zhes smos pa'i gnas su 'di 'thob pas de'i bye brag 'ga' zhig 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma la 'di nyid cho ga ma lus pa khas blangs nas brdzun du smra bas so zhes smos pa'i gnas su 'di 'thob pas de'i bye brag 'ga' zhig 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, in the remaining Saṃghabheda offenses, one obtains this by accepting the entire procedure, and then lying. Therefore, some of its distinctions should be stated here.

original: brjod par bya ba gzhan la gnas pa'i tshig gis brdzun na'o zhes bya ba 'di pham par 'gyur ba'i las 'dis lhag par spyod pa zhes bya ba brjod par bya ba 'dis las gzhan du de'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i rnam par bral ba brjod par bya ba
analyzed: brjod par bya ba gzhan la gnas pa'i tshig gis brdzun na'o zhes bya ba 'di pham par 'gyur ba'i las 'dis lhag par spyod pa zhes bya ba brjod par bya ba 'dis las gzhan du de'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i rnam par bral ba brjod par bya ba
translated: The words “in another matter” mean that this is a case of “excessive conduct” by this act of defeat. This is a case of “in another matter” that is a part of that, a case of “in another matter” that is a branch of that.

original: la gnas pa gang la yod pa de ni brjod par bya ba gzhan la gnas pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: la gnas pa gang la yod pa de ni brjod par bya ba gzhan la gnas pa'i tshig go //
translated: That which exists in another matter is the words “in another matter.”

original: 'di lta ste dper na kho bo cag gis tshe dang ldan pa gyang bu nor mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na kho bo cag gis tshe dang ldan pa gyang bu nor mthong ngo //
translated: For example, it is like this: “We see the venerable Jīvaka Komārabhacca.”

original: dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog can mthong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog can mthong ngo //
translated: “We see the nun Utpalavarnā.”

original: mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bsten pa mthong ngo zhes gang gi phyir sgra de gsum gcig la gcig sbyar ba de bzhin du 'di rnams kyis brjod par bya ba'i don rnam par bral ba de'i char gyur pa'i pham pa'i las 'dis lhag par spyod pa
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bsten pa mthong ngo zhes gang gi phyir sgra de gsum gcig la gcig sbyar ba de bzhin du 'di rnams kyis brjod par bya ba'i don rnam par bral ba de'i char gyur pa'i pham pa'i las 'dis lhag par spyod pa
translated: Just as those three terms are applied to each other, in the same way, the meaning of what is to be expressed is separated from that part, and this act of defeat is engaged in excessively.

original: de bas na de ltar de'i cha dang rnam par bral ba so sor gyur pa 'dis zhes bya ba byas nas so //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar de'i cha dang rnam par bral ba so sor gyur pa 'dis zhes bya ba byas nas so //
translated: Therefore, in this way, it is separated from that part and becomes individual.

original: 'dir yang 'di nyid kyi tshig la gnas pa ste ;
analyzed: 'dir yang 'di nyid kyi tshig la gnas pa ste ;
translated: Here, it is also based on just those words.

original: des na brjod par bya ba gzhan la gnas pa'i tshig gis pham par lhag par spyod pa'i dge slong su zhig la go bar byed pa la dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na brjod par bya ba gzhan la gnas pa'i tshig gis pham par lhag par spyod pa'i dge slong su zhig la go bar byed pa la dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, by the words based on another meaning to be expressed, which one understands to be a monk who engages in defeat excessively, the meaning is “an offense entailing suspension.”

original: yang dag par shes nas kyang skul par byed pa dang 'brel ba pham pa lhag par spyod par gyur pa yin te brjod par bya ba gzhan la gnas pa'i tshig gis de ston pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par shes nas kyang skul par byed pa dang 'brel ba pham pa lhag par spyod par gyur pa yin te brjod par bya ba gzhan la gnas pa'i tshig gis de ston pa ste /
translated: Having understood correctly, one encourages others to engage in the defeat that is related to that, and one teaches it with words that are based on other topics to be discussed.

original: de bsal ba'i phyir brdzun na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir brdzun na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to eliminate that, the text says, “if one lies.”

original: 'og ma sgrogs par 'dod pa'i 'dun pas 'dra ba'i don brjod pa la sbom po'o zhes bya ba rnam pa 'dis sbom po thob pa la tha snyad 'di btags pa'o //
analyzed: 'og ma sgrogs par 'dod pa'i 'dun pas 'dra ba'i don brjod pa la sbom po'o zhes bya ba rnam pa 'dis sbom po thob pa la tha snyad 'di btags pa'o //
translated: The term “grave offense” is applied to the attainment of a grave offense by this method: “If one expresses a similar meaning with words that are based on other topics to be discussed, with the intention of proclaiming something else below.”

original: gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'o /🔽// / @132b mi bsten pas skur pa 'debs na sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma la pho'i dbang po med pa ni dper na ma ning phos lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'o / // / @132b mi bsten pas skur pa 'debs na sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma la pho'i dbang po med pa ni dper na ma ning phos lta bu'o //
translated: “The remaining part of the Saṅgha’s punishment is a partial defeat.”🔽“If one denigrates without relying on, it is a grave offense” means that if a man denigrates a nun who does not have a male faculty, it is a grave offense, like a man who is a eunuch.

original: dge slong la mo'i dbang po med pa ni dper na ma ning mos skur pa 'debs na yang sbom po'i kha na ma tho ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong la mo'i dbang po med pa ni dper na ma ning mos skur pa 'debs na yang sbom po'i kha na ma tho ba'o //
translated: If a woman denigrates a monk who does not have a female faculty, it is a grave offense, like a woman who is a eunuch.

original: de yang 'di'i dbang du ma byas shing kha dang bshang ba'i lam zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di'i dbang du ma byas shing kha dang bshang ba'i lam zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the mouth and the anus are not included in this.

original: ming ma smos pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni nyams par bya ba'i ming la smos par skur pa 'debs na yang sbom pa'o //
analyzed: ming ma smos pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni nyams par bya ba'i ming la smos par skur pa 'debs na yang sbom pa'o //
translated: If one says, “I have committed such and such a downfall,” but does not mention the name of the downfall, it is a serious transgression.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las /
translated: In this regard, some texts say:

original: dge 'dun gyi dbus su nges pa med par 'di skad ces mi tshangs par spyod pa byas so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbus su nges pa med par 'di skad ces mi tshangs par spyod pa byas so //
translated: “In the midst of the saṅgha, without specifying, one says, ‘I have had sexual intercourse,’

original: ma sha ka lnga las lhag pa brkus so //
analyzed: ma sha ka lnga las lhag pa brkus so //
translated: ‘I have stolen more than five māsakas,’

original: mi srog dang phral lo //
analyzed: mi srog dang phral lo //
translated: ‘I have taken the life of a human,’

original: mi chos bla ma dag pa ma yin pa smras so zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: mi chos bla ma dag pa ma yin pa smras so zhes zer zhing /
translated: ‘I have spoken of the higher knowledge of a non-human.’

original: bdag ni che ge mos so zhes mi zer na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni che ge mos so zhes mi zer na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one does not say, ‘I have done this by such and such a means,’ it is a serious transgression.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba dang dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams med pa 'di gnyis ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba dang dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams med pa 'di gnyis ni sbom po'o //
translated: Drawing blood with evil intent toward a tathāgata and creating a schism in the saṅgha are serious transgressions.

original: mi gsod pa dang dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi lhag ma dbye bar brtul ba ni spong ba'i phyogs la /
analyzed: mi gsod pa dang dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi lhag ma dbye bar brtul ba ni spong ba'i phyogs la /
translated: The remainder of killing and schism of the Saṅgha are vows to be abandoned.

original: 'di dag la go rims ji bzhin du sbom po'i ltung ba yin gyi skur pa 'debs pa'i phyogs pa ni ma yin zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag la go rims ji bzhin du sbom po'i ltung ba yin gyi skur pa 'debs pa'i phyogs pa ni ma yin zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: These are respectively known as grave offenses, not denigrators.

original: de gnyis kyis skur pa 'debs na nyes byas su rnam par gnas pa yin no //🔽bsams te smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhogs smos byed na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni 'dir sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis skur pa 'debs na nyes byas su rnam par gnas pa yin no // bsams te smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhogs smos byed na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni 'dir sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they denigrate those two, they remain in an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one says, “I thought,” etc., and accuses falsely, it is wrong conduct.🔽Here, the term “etc.” indicates other forms.

original: bsams te smras so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta bu'i rnam pa mtshon par byed pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: bsams te smras so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta bu'i rnam pa mtshon par byed pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one says, “I thought,” etc., and accuses falsely, it is wrong conduct.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig gi gzhung las dge slong stan las langs te bdag gis bsams te smras so zhes zer zhing skye bo thams cad la nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig gi gzhung las dge slong stan las langs te bdag gis bsams te smras so zhes zer zhing skye bo thams cad la nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Here, the text is: “Some monks, having risen from their seats, said, ‘I think and say that it is a misdeed for all people.’

original: bag tsam la yang rnam pa de dag shes par byas te /
analyzed: bag tsam la yang rnam pa de dag shes par byas te /
translated: ” One should understand these forms in the case of minor offenses as well.

original: bdag gis dge slong ma che ge mo zhes bya ba ni pho dang mi tshangs par spyod pa'i 'khrig pa'i chos bsten pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis dge slong ma che ge mo zhes bya ba ni pho dang mi tshangs par spyod pa'i 'khrig pa'i chos bsten pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “I saw a certain nun who engaged in sexual intercourse with a man, the act of lying with an unchaste person.”

original: gzhi med pa'i dang bag tsam gyi zhu ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi med pa'i dang bag tsam gyi zhu ba'o //
translated: This is the confession of a groundless and minor offense.

original: gzhan gyi 'khor kha 'dren na sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni phran tshegs rnams las 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'khor kha 'dren na sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni phran tshegs rnams las 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: “If one leads away the retinue of another, it is a serious violation,” this appears in the Kṣudraka Collection.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen la sogs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma bsgo ba las byung ba bzhi po @133a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen la sogs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma bsgo ba las byung ba bzhi po @133a * //
translated: The four remaining offenses entailing suspension that are related to the schism in the Saṅgha and so on

original: rnams kyi thun mong gi rnam par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rnams kyi thun mong gi rnam par brjod par bya ste /
translated: are common to all.

original: bzlog pa'i tshul gyis mi gtong bar rjes su bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin ni rjes su mthun no zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba dag las dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa la 'jug pas zhes bya ba 'di lta bu la sogs pa mi gtong ba'i bdag nyid
analyzed: bzlog pa'i tshul gyis mi gtong bar rjes su bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin ni rjes su mthun no zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba dag las dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa la 'jug pas zhes bya ba 'di lta bu la sogs pa mi gtong ba'i bdag nyid
translated: This is explained in the future in such passages as “engaging in causing a schism in the Saṅgha.”🔽The nature of not forsaking is that which is understood by body and speech.

original: can rjes su bsgrub pa la gang zhig gi ngo bo lus ngag gis go bar gyur pa la'ang cang mi smra ba'i ngo bos rjes su mthun par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: can rjes su bsgrub pa la gang zhig gi ngo bo lus ngag gis go bar gyur pa la'ang cang mi smra ba'i ngo bos rjes su mthun par gyur pa'am /
translated: The concordant nature is that which is understood by the nature of silence.

original: gnyis ka'i bdag nyid can bzlog pa'i tshul gyis de rjes su 'gro ba'o //🔽gang gi phyir bzlog pa dang 'brel pa'i so sor nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di la mi gtong bar rjes su bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bdag nyid can bzlog pa'i tshul gyis de rjes su 'gro ba'o // gang gi phyir bzlog pa dang 'brel pa'i so sor nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di la mi gtong bar rjes su bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Or, the nature of both is that which is understood by the method of reversal.🔽That is why this is called “the nature of not forsaking by the method of reversal.”

original: de bas na bzlog pa'i ngo bos rjes su 'gro bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bzlog pa'i ngo bos rjes su 'gro bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the concordant nature is the nature of reversal.

original: gcig tu bzlog pa la de dang 'brel pa'i mi gtong ba'i rjes su bsgrub pa la gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan la ni gzhan nyid dang / sbyor bar gyur pa la sbyor bar 'gyur ba nyid dang / mthar thug par gyur pa la mthar thug par 'gyur ba nyid ces bya ba 'di la 'di byed pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu bzlog pa la de dang 'brel pa'i mi gtong ba'i rjes su bsgrub pa la gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan la ni gzhan nyid dang / sbyor bar gyur pa la sbyor bar 'gyur ba nyid dang / mthar thug par gyur pa la mthar thug par 'gyur ba nyid ces bya ba 'di la 'di byed pa'o //
translated: In the case of the reversal of one, the non-abandonment connected with that is established in the proof of identity; in the case of another, it is difference; in the case of the occurrence of connection, it is the occurrence of connection; and in the case of the occurrence of conclusion, it is the occurrence of conclusion. This is the function of this [reversal].

original: gsol ba ni bzlog pa dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang mi gtong ba la la byed pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsol ba ni bzlog pa dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang mi gtong ba la la byed pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The request is similar to the reversal. This means that here too, the non-abandonment is the function.

original: bzlog par bya ba nyid la 'di khas len pa ste /
analyzed: bzlog par bya ba nyid la 'di khas len pa ste /
translated: This is accepted in the case of the object of reversal,

original: bzlog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rtsom pa'i 'di'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rtsom pa'i 'di'o //
translated: but not in the case of the reversal. This is the beginning of the argument.

original: bsgrub pa 'di ni bzlog pa'i don can nyid de /
analyzed: bsgrub pa 'di ni bzlog pa'i don can nyid de /
translated: This proof has the meaning of reversal,

original: de bas na bzlog pa'i dbang can gyi nyes pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na bzlog pa'i dbang can gyi nyes pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: therefore it generates the fault of being under the power of reversal.

original: tshig gi skad cig ma gcig nyid do zhes bya ba ni cha shas re re la yang 'dir cha re re ni so sor gcod pa la ni ltung ba med do /
analyzed: tshig gi skad cig ma gcig nyid do zhes bya ba ni cha shas re re la yang 'dir cha re re ni so sor gcod pa la ni ltung ba med do /
translated: If one part is cut off, there is no offense.

original: 'dir shin tu ring ba gcig nyid la yang ltung ba gcig nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir shin tu ring ba gcig nyid la yang ltung ba gcig nyid do //
translated: Here, even if it is very long, there is only one offense.

original: gang zhig gang du dngos gzhi'i dus de'i dus las 'byung ba'i rnam par rig pa dang rnam par rig pa ma yin pa dag la ltung ba byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig gang du dngos gzhi'i dus de'i dus las 'byung ba'i rnam par rig pa dang rnam par rig pa ma yin pa dag la ltung ba byas pa nyid do //
translated: If one does or does not do an action in the place and time of the basic offense, there is or is not an offense.

original: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gzhan dag la rnam par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa la mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gzhan dag la rnam par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa la mthong ba'o //
translated: If it is transformed into something else, it is seen to be established as an offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gsol ba byed pa na gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gsol ba byed pa na gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /
translated: Here, the text says, “If one requests and gives up that basis, it is good.

original: gal te mi gtong na de la brjod par byas na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi gtong na de la brjod par byas na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one does not give it up, one should speak about it. It becomes a serious offense.”

original: skad cig ma gang la phal cher byas pa nyid gang yin pa ni 'dir dngos gzhi'i dus shes par bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gang la phal cher byas pa nyid gang yin pa ni 'dir dngos gzhi'i dus shes par bya'o //
translated: The moment in which the most is done is to be understood here as the time of the actual basis.

original: bzlas pa ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni las so so la bzlog par byed pa ni tha dad pa'o//
analyzed: bzlas pa ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni las so so la bzlog par byed pa ni tha dad pa'o//
translated: The repetition is different, that is, the reversal is different for each action.

original: @133b dang po 'di dag la so sor sbom po ste /
analyzed: @133b dang po 'di dag la so sor sbom po ste /
translated: The first of these is a serious offense,

original: phyi ma ni dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba gang zhig brjod pa de bas na mdo 'di brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba gang zhig brjod pa de bas na mdo 'di brtsams pa'o //
translated: and the latter is the actual basis. Since this is what is stated, this sūtra is composed.

original: mjug sdud pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mjug sdud pa la so so nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mjug sdud pa la so so nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not a conclusion, that is, the conclusion such as If the Saṅgha accepts and approves of it is not a serious offense.

original: byas pa ni go bar bya ba tsam nyid kyi phyir lhag ma ltar dngos gzhi'i dus kyi tha ma rgyun las 'di la sngon du zhugs pa rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byas pa ni go bar bya ba tsam nyid kyi phyir lhag ma ltar dngos gzhi'i dus kyi tha ma rgyun las 'di la sngon du zhugs pa rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Since the act is merely to be understood, like the remainder, this is established as the preliminary stage at the end of the time of the actual basis.

original: sngar sngon du 'di la zhugs pa gang du rigs pa ma yin te phyi ma bsgrub pa la rigs pa yin zhe na /🔽de'i phyir 'jug pa nyid ni sbyor ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen bya ba la brtsams pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ni sbyor ba nyid do //
analyzed: sngar sngon du 'di la zhugs pa gang du rigs pa ma yin te phyi ma bsgrub pa la rigs pa yin zhe na / de'i phyir 'jug pa nyid ni sbyor ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen bya ba la brtsams pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ni sbyor ba nyid do //
translated: It is not reasonable to engage in this first, because it is reasonable to accomplish the latter.🔽Therefore, engagement itself is preparation.

original: dus gang zhig la 'jug pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba 'dir khyad par ma brjod pas sngar yang bzhams te bsgo ba la sogs pa'i 'og tu 'am gsol ba la sogs pa'i bar du yang zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dus gang zhig la 'jug pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba 'dir khyad par ma brjod pas sngar yang bzhams te bsgo ba la sogs pa'i 'og tu 'am gsol ba la sogs pa'i bar du yang zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
translated: Since it is not specified at what time it is engagement, it should be understood that it is engagement that begins with the schism of the Saṅgha, and it is also engagement that occurs after the admonition to be reconciled, etc., and up to the request, etc.

original: ma gtad pa'i phyir shin tu dman pa 'jug pa 'di yin te ;
analyzed: ma gtad pa'i phyir shin tu dman pa 'jug pa 'di yin te ;
translated: This engagement is extremely inferior because it is not directed.

original: de bas na 'dis de ma thag pa'i mi gtong ba la sbyor ba nyid du grags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis de ma thag pa'i mi gtong ba la sbyor ba nyid du grags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is well known that this is preparation for the immediate non-relinquishment.

original: bskrad pa'i las ma bgyis par yang 'dun pas 'gro ba la sogs pa nyid kyis 'gro bar byed pa la 'di las sbyor ba nyid thal ba dang / bskrad pa dang gleng ba dang dran par byed du 'jug pa la yang brtsam par bya ba nyid go bar byed pas de bsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: bskrad pa'i las ma bgyis par yang 'dun pas 'gro ba la sogs pa nyid kyis 'gro bar byed pa la 'di las sbyor ba nyid thal ba dang / bskrad pa dang gleng ba dang dran par byed du 'jug pa la yang brtsam par bya ba nyid go bar byed pas de bsal bar bya ste /
translated: Also, when one goes by oneself through desire and so on, without performing the rite of banishment, then the consequence is that one would be engaged in the rite.🔽And when one is banished, or reminded, or made to remember, one is made to understand that one is engaged in the rite. Therefore, that should be refuted.

original: bskrad pa dang gleng ba dang dran par ma byas par de'i 'o zhes bya ba ni gnas 'di la sbyor ba 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskrad pa dang gleng ba dang dran par ma byas par de'i 'o zhes bya ba ni gnas 'di la sbyor ba 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one is not banished, or reminded, or made to remember, then one is engaged in the rite in this case, because one goes by oneself through desire and so on.

original: sbyor ba nyid de dngos gzhi'i la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyid de dngos gzhi'i la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one is engaged in the rite, but not in the actual rite.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here is the text from the Questions of Subāhu:

analyzed: mi bsgo bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba mang po'i @134b tshig bzung ba'o //

translated: the text says, “If he does not stop after the last admonition.”🔽The last admonition is the last of the admonitions.

analyzed: tha ma la mi gtong ba gang yin pa de la zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: don gang me gtong na /

analyzed: gang gi phyir dbyen byed pa la zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi'o zhes smos te / dge 'dun gyi dbyen la'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “in the Saṅgha.”🔽In the Saṅgha.

original: dbyen byed pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dbyen byed pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
translated: It is a remainder offense for the Saṅgha to create a schism.

original: gang zhig mi gtong na de'i rjes su phyogs pa dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig mi gtong na de'i rjes su phyogs pa dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one does not give up that position, it is a remainder offense for those who side with him.

analyzed: de'i phyir de'i grogs nyid rjes su sgrub par byed pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: de dang 'brel pa der dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang 'brel pa'i grogs ni de'i grogs nyid do //
translated: That which is related to it is the companion related to the schism in the Saṅgha.

original: de la rjes su bsgrub pa nyid ni shin tu dman pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rjes su bsgrub pa nyid ni shin tu dman pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: sngon nas 'jug pa 'di la na smad pa thob pa nyid la 'di btags pa'o //
translated: and this is imputed to the one who obtains contempt in this life.

original: rjes su phyogs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'o /
analyzed: rjes su phyogs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'o /
translated: The remainder of the Saṅgha that sides with him is the remainder of the Saṅgha.

original: // / gang zhig mi gtong na khyim sun 'byin pa'i dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang zhig mi gtong na khyim sun 'byin pa'i dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one does not give up that view, it is a remainder offense for one who causes a lay person to lose faith.

analyzed: de'i phyir rang skrod par byed pa'i dge 'dun la log pa'i bsam pas de de la de ltar zhugs so zhes brdzun du smra ba nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that “it is the lying that, with a wrong thought, one engages in that to the Saṅgha that expels oneself.”

original: 'di'i bdag nyid kyi rang skrod pa la dge 'dun gang zhig byed pa po der 'di la kho bo cag gi skrod pa la las go bar bya ba la 'jug par gyur pa la log pa'i bsam @135a * //🔽pas 'dun pa dang zhe sdang dang 'jigs pa dang rmongs pa dang sdug bsngal gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba log par smra ba po nyid gang yin pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i brdzun du smra ba rnams pa de lta bu'i tshig gis mtha' mar ma
analyzed: 'di'i bdag nyid kyi rang skrod pa la dge 'dun gang zhig byed pa po der 'di la kho bo cag gi skrod pa la las go bar bya ba la 'jug par gyur pa la log pa'i bsam @135a * // pas 'dun pa dang zhe sdang dang 'jigs pa dang rmongs pa dang sdug bsngal gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba log par smra ba po nyid gang yin pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i brdzun du smra ba rnams pa de lta bu'i tshig gis mtha' mar ma
translated: The Saṅgha that performs the expulsion of this type of person is understood to be the agent of the expulsion.🔽The one who speaks falsely in this way is the one who is expelled.🔽The words that are spoken are the words that are spoken in this way.

original: btang ba la'o //🔽khyim sun 'byin pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma ste bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: btang ba la'o // khyim sun 'byin pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma ste bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: The basis is the basis that is not relinquished.

original: // / gang zhig mi gtong na bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang zhig mi gtong na bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: This is the twelfth class of partial defeat for monks that is a downfall due to consenting to a householder’s criticism.🔽What is the partial defeat for disobeying the Saṅgha?

original: de'i phyir dge slong gis lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyis gleng ba nyid na bdag nyid kyi de la dge slong dag gis brjod par mi bya ba nyid du byed pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong gis lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyis gleng ba nyid na bdag nyid kyi de la dge slong dag gis brjod par mi bya ba nyid du byed pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, when a monk is being accused of a transgression of morality, he should make himself such that the monks do not speak about him.

original: dge slong gis lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyis gleng ba nyid na 'dir bdag nyid dang 'brel pa'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims la dge slong rnams kyis brjod par mi bya ba nyid la byed pa gang yin pa de la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge slong gis lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyis gleng ba nyid na 'dir bdag nyid dang 'brel pa'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims la dge slong rnams kyis brjod par mi bya ba nyid la byed pa gang yin pa de la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When a monk is being accused of a transgression of morality, he should make himself such that the monks do not speak about his transgression of morality.

original: phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dge slong gi dge 'dun la 'dir dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba brjod pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dge slong gi dge 'dun la 'dir dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba brjod pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The monks should be understood as the community of monks of all the Tathagatas dwelling in the ten directions.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dul ba'i rnam pa thams cad bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dul ba'i rnam pa thams cad bstan pa yin no //
translated: A transgression of morality is taught here as a form of discipline.

original: yongs su gcod pa brjod par mi bya ba nyid byed pa la ji srid du cung zad dge slong zhes bya ba 'dis nyes byas su bya ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa brjod par mi bya ba nyid byed pa la ji srid du cung zad dge slong zhes bya ba 'dis nyes byas su bya ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that as long as the monk does not do what is to be done, which is to say, does not confess, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bslab ba'i gzhi rnams kyis kyang rnam par gcod par brjod par mi bya ba nyid byed pa la nyes byas nyid do //
analyzed: bslab ba'i gzhi rnams kyis kyang rnam par gcod par brjod par mi bya ba nyid byed pa la nyes byas nyid do //
translated: And by the rules of training, he commits an offense of wrong conduct in not doing what is to be done, which is to say, in not confessing.

original: so so nyid thob pa la 'di ni kha na ma tho ba ste /
analyzed: so so nyid thob pa la 'di ni kha na ma tho ba ste /
translated: This is a downfall that is incurred by one’s own action, not by the action of another.

original: yongs su gcod pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams kyis brjod par mi bya ba nyid byed pa ni so so nyid thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams kyis brjod par mi bya ba nyid byed pa ni so so nyid thob pa ma yin no //
translated: The rules of training that prescribe confession are not to be done by the action of another.

original: de bas na 'dir sbom po mi bskyed pa nyid do ;
analyzed: de bas na 'dir sbom po mi bskyed pa nyid do ;
translated: Therefore, one does not incur a serious violation.

original: / der nyes byas nyid de mi mdzes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: / der nyes byas nyid de mi mdzes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is an offense of wrong conduct because it is unbecoming.

original: bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
translated: The offense of disparaging a monk’s ethical conduct is a serious violation of the monastic law.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma rnams rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma rnams rdzogs so /
